Actions.Name: Form data poll
Actions.Description:
The Forms API polling endpoint allows your application to continually poll and process recently submitted standalone forms.
Integration:
This endpoint is designed to work out of the box with Microsoft Flow as a polling trigger integration. Alternatively, you may develop your own
custom integration using any language.
Usage:
In a typical scenario, the first request to this endpoint should not provide any parameters. There are two (2) possible successful responses:

HTTP Response code 200 - Recently submitted form records exist; response body will display form data.
HTTP Response code 202  No recently submitted records exist; response body will be empty.

In both cases, there are two (2) important headers in the response:

Location  The URL for the next request.
Retry-After  The recommended time interval in seconds for next request. For example, if there is data to retrieve, the Retry-After header will have a value of 1 or 60.
If there is no data to retrieve, the value of the Retry-After header will be 300.

Note: These are just recommended values  your application may choose to poll at a different frequency depending on your requirements. After the first request, all subsequent
requests should use the URL provided in the Location header of the most recent response. Do not add more parameters to the URL, as it already contains the necessary
parameters required to ensure forms are not missing from the request.
Results are automatically sorted by ModifiedUtc and then by FormHeaderId, in ascending order. Sort parameters are not configurable.
ModifiedUtc definition: internal time tag = time of latest form data change.

Actions.Name: Orders poll
Actions.Description:
The Orders API polling endpoint allows your application to continually poll and process recent changes to orders.
Integration:
This endpoint is designed to work out of the box with Microsoft Flow as a polling trigger integration. Alternatively, you may develop your own
custom integration using any language.
Usage:
In a typical scenario, the first request to this endpoint should not provide any parameters. There are two (2) possible successful responses:

HTTP Response code 200 - Recently changed orders exist; response body will display order data.
HTTP Response code 202  No recently changed orders exist; response body will be empty.

In both cases, there are two (2) important headers in the response:

Location  The URL for the next request.
Retry-After  The recommended time interval in seconds for next request. For example, if there is data to retrieve, the Retry-After header will have a value of 1 or 60.
If there is no data to retrieve, the value of the Retry-After header will be 300.

Note: These are just recommended values  your application may choose to poll at a different frequency depending on your requirements. After the first request, all
subsequent requests should use the URL provided in the Location header of the most recent response. Do not add more parameters to the URL, as it already contains the
necessary parameters required to ensure order changes are not missing from the request.
Results are automatically sorted by ModifiedUtc and then by OrderId, in ascending order. Sort parameters are not configurable.
ModifiedUtc definition: internal time tag = time of latest order data change.

Actions.Name: Order statuses poll
Actions.Description:
The Order Statuses API polling endpoint allows your application to continually poll and process recent changes to orders.
Integration:
This endpoint is designed to work out of the box with Microsoft Flow as a polling trigger integration. Alternatively, you may develop your own
custom integration using any language.
Usage:
In a typical scenario, the first request to this endpoint should not provide any parameters. There are two (2) possible successful responses:

HTTP Response code 200 - Recently changed order status records exist; response body will display order status data
HTTP Response code 202  No recently submitted records exist; response body will be empty.

In both cases, there are two (2) important headers in the response:

Location  The URL for the next request.
Retry-After  The recommended time interval in seconds for next request. For example, if there is data to retrieve, the Retry-After header will have a value of 1 or 60.
If there is no data to retrieve, the value of the Retry-After header will be 300.

Note: These are just recommended values  your application may choose to poll at a different frequency depending on your requirements. After the first request, all
subsequent requests should use the URL provided in the Location header of the most recent response. Do not add more parameters to the URL, as it already contains
those necessary to ensure order statuses are not missing from the request.
Results are sorted by ModifiedUtc and then by StatusId, in ascending order. Sort parameters are not configurable.
ModifiedUtc definition: internal time tag = time of latest order status data change.

Actions.Name: Timekeeping poll
Actions.Description:
The Timekeeping API polling endpoint allows your application to continually poll and process recently submitted timekeeping entries.
Integration:
This endpoint is designed to work out of the box with Microsoft Flow as a polling trigger integration. Alternatively, you may develop your own
custom integration using any language.
Usage:
In a typical scenario, the first request to this endpoint should not provide any parameters. There are two (2) possible successful responses:

HTTP Response code 200 - Recently submitted timekeeping records exist; response body will display timekeeping entry data.
HTTP Response code 202  No recently submitted records exist; response body will be empty.

In both cases, there are two (2) important headers in the response:

Location  The URL for the next request.
Retry-After  The recommended time interval in seconds for next request. For example, if there is data to retrieve, the Retry-After header will have a value of 1 or 60.
If there is no data to retrieve, the value of the Retry-After header will be 300.

Note: These are just recommended values  your application may choose to poll at a different frequency depending on your requirements. After the first request, all
subsequent requests should use the URL provided in the Location header of the most recent response. Do not add more parameters to the URL, as it already contains
those necessary to ensure timekeeping entries are not missing from the request.
Results are automatically sorted by ModifiedUtc and then by TimekeepingStatusId and then in ascending order. Sort parameters are not configurable.
ModifiedUtc definition: internal time tag = time of latest timekeeping status change.

Actions.Name: Get GPS data entries

returned and the number of elements per page.
Positions for deleted users/vehicles are not returned. However, if the user/vehicle existed when data was requested and was later removed, then data for the
user/vehicle requested by a continuation token will be returned.
Results are automatically sorted by UtcTime, and in ascending order. Sort parameters are not configurable.

Actions.Name: Get Single Dataset
Actions.Description: Gets a single dataset matching the supplied dataset id.

Actions.Name: Get Dataset Items
Actions.Description: Gets a list of data items for a dataset,, optionally filtered, using logical disjunction (OR), by a list of reporting unit codes.

Actions.Name: Get Datasets
Actions.Description: Gets a list of datasets, optionally filtered by a list of measure and reported measure codes. Matching within each filter is by logical disjunction (OR) and matching across filters is by logical conjunction (AND).

Actions.Name: Get Flat Data
Actions.Description: Gets data in a flattened structure with each item corresponding to a single data point. Data is restricted to within a single measure category and can be optionally filtered by measure, reporting unit type and reporting dates. Matching within each filter is by logical disjunction (OR) and matching across filters is by logical conjunction (AND). NOTE: There is currently a pagination restriction on this query that restricts requests to a maximum of 1000 results. Use skip and top to control this pagination. Sorting is not currently available.

Actions.Name: Get Flat Formatted Data
Actions.Description: Gets formatted data in a flattened structure with each item corresponding to a single data point. Data is restricted to within a single measure category and can be optionally filtered by measure, reporting unit code, reporting unit type and reporting dates. Matching within each filter is by logical disjunction (OR) and matching across filters is by logical conjunction (AND). NOTE: There is currently a pagination restriction on this query that restricts requests to a maximum of 1000 results. Use skip and top to control this pagination. Sorting is not currently available.

Actions.Description: Endpoint returns measurements for concrete installation given by InstallationId.

Actions.Name: Get measurements for a point
Actions.Description: Endpoint returns measurements for any geographical location. Measurement values are interpolated by averaging measurements from nearby sensors (up to 1,5km away from the given point). The returned value is a weighted average, with the weight inversely proportional to the distance from the sensor to the given point.

Actions.Name: Get nearest installations
Actions.Description: Endpoint returns list of installations which are closest to a given point, sorted by distance to that point.

Actions.Name: Get nearest measurements
Actions.Description: Endpoint returns measurements for an installation closest to a given location.

Actions.Name: Get current air quality by city search
Actions.Description: Ambee Air Quality API helps you to get real-time, hyper local air quality data for any city by passing the name of the city.

Actions.Name: Get current air quality by country search
Actions.Description: Ambee Air Quality API helps you to get real-time, hyper local air quality data for any country by passing the ISO country code.

Actions.Name: Get current air quality current by geospatial search
Actions.Description: Ambee Air Quality API helps you to get real-time, hyper local air quality data for any location by passing the geographic coordinates.

Actions.Name: Get historical air quality by geospatial search
Actions.Description: Ambee Air Quality API helps you to get historical hyper local air quality data for any for any location by passing the geographic coordinates along with period for which the data is required.

Actions.Name: Get least polluted places by air quality
Actions.Description: Ambee Air Quality API helps you to get least polluted places calculated from among various countries. The API also provides location information about the postal code passed like country code, division, latitude, longitude, placename, state, city, etc.

Actions.Name: Get most polluted places by air quality
Actions.Description: Ambee Air Quality API helps you to get most polluted places calculated from among various countries. The API also provides location information about the postal code passed like country code, division, latitude, longitude, placename, state, city, etc.

Actions.Name: Get current air quality by postal code search
Actions.Description: Ambee Air Quality API helps you to get real-time, hyper local air quality data for any location by passing the postal code of the respective area.

Actions.Name: Get historical air quality by postal code search
Actions.Description: Ambee Air Quality API helps you to get historical hyper local air quality data for any for any location by passing the geographic coordinates along with period for which the data is required.

Actions.Name: Get current fires by geospatial search
Actions.Description: Ambee’s Fire API gives access to real-time local active fires data by latitude and longitude for any location in the world.

Actions.Name: Get historical pollen by geospatial search
Actions.Description: Ambee Pollen API gives access to get historical pollen count - tree, grass and weed, by passing the geographic coordinates along with period for which the data is required.

Actions.Name: Get historical pollen by place search
Actions.Description: Ambee Pollen API gives access to get historical pollen count - tree, grass and weed, by passing the place name along with period for which the data is required.

Actions.Name: Get latest pollen by geospatial search
Actions.Description: Ambee Pollen API gives access to real-time pollen count - tree, grass and weed, by latitude and longitude.

Actions.Name: Get latest pollen by place search
Actions.Description: Ambee Pollen API gives access to get realtime pollen count - tree, grass and weed, by passing the place name along with period for which the data is required.

Actions.Name: Get pollen forecast by geospatial search
Actions.Description: Ambee Pollen API gives access to get forecast of pollen count - tree, grass and weed, by passing the geographic coordinates.

Actions.Name: Get current soil by geospatial search
Actions.Description: Ambee Soil API gives access to real-time soil moisture and soil temperature levels of any given location in the world by latitude and longitude.

Actions.Name: Get historical soil by geospatial search
Actions.Description: Ambee Soil API gives access to historical soil moisture and soil temperature levels of any given location in the world by latitude and longitude.

Actions.Name: Get current water vapor by geospatial search
Actions.Description: Ambee Water Vapor API gives access to real-time water vapor level of any given location in the world by latitude and longitude.

Actions.Name: Get historical water vapor by geospatial search
Actions.Description: Ambee Water Vapor API gives access to historical water vapor level of any given location in the world by latitude and longitude.

Actions.Name: Get current weather by geospatial search
Actions.Description: Ambee Weather API gives access to real-time local weather updates for temperature, pressure, humidity, wind, cloud coverage, visibility, and dew point of any location in the world by latitude and longitude.

Actions.Name: Get weather forecast by geospatial search
Actions.Description: Ambee Weather API gives access to daily, hourly and even minutely forecasts for temperature, pressure, humidity, wind, cloud coverage, visibility, and dew point of any location in the world by latitude and longitude.

Actions.Name: Create feature layer
Actions.Description: Create a feature layer in ArcGIS using data from an existing source, such as a SharePoint list. A feature layer is a grouping of similar geographic features, for example, buildings, parcels, cities, roads, and earthquake epicenters. Features can be points, lines, or polygons (areas). Feature layers are most appropriate for visualizing data on top of a basemap.

Actions.Name: Find address candidate
Actions.Description: Locate a single address using a geocode service resource. This resource provides information about candidates, including the address, location, and match score.  The result of this operation is a list of address candidates.

Actions.Name: Geocode addresses
Actions.Description: Find multiple (batch) addresses, place-names, and businesses and then display that information on a map. This data can be added to an existing dataset or you can create a new one. This data can be used to create new maps in all ArcGIS for Microsoft 365 products.

Actions.Name: Geoenrichment
Actions.Description: Get facts about a location or area. Using the GeoEnrichment service, you can get information about the people, places, and businesses in a specific area or within a certain distance or drive time from a location.

Actions.Name: Get data from feature layer
Actions.Description: Connect to a feature layer in ArcGIS and pull its data and attributes into your existing dataset or create a new one. This data can be used to create new maps in all ArcGIS for Microsoft 365 products.

Actions.Name: Get geometry from feature layer
Actions.Description: Get geometry or boundary information from a feature layer and export it as Esri JSON or to a shape column in your dataset. This data can be used in all ArcGIS for Microsoft 365 products.

Actions.Name: Point to point routing
Actions.Description: Create point-to-point routes. Points in a route can visited in the order you specify or in the order that minimizes overall travel time or distance. Routes represent the quickest or shortest path along roads to visit stops or point locations.

Actions.Name: Find address candidate
Actions.Description: Locate a single address using a geocode service resource. This resource provides information about candidates, including the address, location, and match score.  The result of this operation is a list of address candidates.

Actions.Name: Geocode addresses
Actions.Description: Find multiple (batch) addresses, place-names, and businesses and then display that information on a map. This data can be added to an existing dataset or you can create a new one. This data can be used to create new maps in all ArcGIS for Microsoft 365 products.

Actions.Name: Geoenrichment
Actions.Description: Get facts about a location or area. Using the GeoEnrichment service, you can get information about the people, places, and businesses in a specific area or within a certain distance or drive time from a location.

Actions.Name: Point to point routing
Actions.Description: Create point-to-point routes. Points in a route can visited in the order you specify or in the order that minimizes overall travel time or distance. Routes represent the quickest or shortest path along roads to visit stops or point locations.

Actions.Description: Case is deleted permanently. If the case is sent, it will be recalled prior to deletion.

Actions.Name: Get a Case
Actions.Description: Get a Case by its CaseId

Actions.Name: Get a case by temporary id
Actions.Description: Gets a case by its temporaryId. A temporary id is a 4+ digit number that is only valid for 24 hours.

Actions.Name: Get file content of a Case Document
Actions.Description: Gets file of a case by caseId and documentId

Actions.Name: Recall a case
Actions.Description: If the case is sent, it will be recalled. Finished cases cannot be recalled.

Actions.Name: Send a reminder
Actions.Description: Sends reminders to all parties that have not yet signed. If signing order is enforced, only the next party in turn will be reminded.

Actions.Name: Request Approval to send
Actions.Description: Used when a case is set to require approval before sent. Sends a request to approver stakeholders to approve and send the case. Approvals are requested in the name of the API user.

Actions.Name: Send a Case
Actions.Description: Changes the status of the case to Sent, making it available for signing. In order to send a case the parameters Parties, Documents and AllowedSignatureTypes must be specified on the case. If notifications are enabled, parties will be notified.

Actions.Name: Update a Case
Actions.Description: Updates properties and collections of a case. It is recommended to use GetCase action before making an update. Collections: missing items will be removed, others updated or added. Documents collection: Only filename and formfields can be changed. To modify size, hash or data, the document must be removed first and a new document (with a new id) must be added.

Actions.Name: Update Case Metadata
Actions.Description: Allows updating metadata regardless of the case status. Existing metadata will be replaced with new metadata. Metadata cannot be complex objects.

Actions.Name: Copy blob [DEPRECATED]
Actions.Description:
This action has been deprecated. Please use Copy blob (V2) instead.
This operation copies a blob. If blob is being deleted/renamed on server right after it was copied, connector may return HTTP 404 error by it's design. Please use a delay for 1 minute before deleting or renaming newly created blob. Chunk transfer is not supported in this action. If source and destination are present in same storage account, please use relative path. Otherwise, maximum size of a source for copy blob operation is 50 MB.

Actions.Name: Copy blob (V2)

If source and destination are present in same storage account, please use relative path. Otherwise, maximum size of a source for copy blob operation is 50 MB.

This action has been deprecated. Please use When a blob is added or modified (properties only) (V2) instead.
This operation triggers a flow when one or more blobs are added or modified in a container. This trigger will only fetch the file metadata. To get the file content, you can use the "Get file content" operation. The trigger does not fire if a file is added/updated in a subfolder. If it is required to trigger on subfolders, multiple triggers should be created.

Actions.Description: Search can be performed using one of two approaches, a lookup or a parameterized query. A lookup takes a single string as input to matching entities. A paramaterized query takes one or more search parameters.

Actions.Name: Search for a constituent
Actions.Description: Performs a constituent search based on the provided search text. Supports first name, last name, preferred name, former name, alias, email address, phone number, address, or lookup ID. Name combinations such as first name and last name or preferred name and last name are valid, but otherwise search only supports one parameter at a time. By default, searches include results that sound similar to your criteria. For example, searches for "Smith" include matches for "Smyth" and other alternative spellings. This search does not support wildcard characters such as * or ?. Search results are limited to 500 records.

Actions.Description: Performs a constituent search based on the provided search text. Supports first name, last name, preferred name, former name, alias, email address, phone number, address, or lookup ID. Name combinations such as first name and last name or preferred name and last name are valid, but otherwise search only supports one parameter at a time. By default, searches include results that sound similar to your criteria. For example, searches for "Smith" include matches for "Smyth" and other alternative spellings. This search does not support wildcard characters such as * or ?. Search results are limited to 500 records.

Actions.Name: Email
Actions.Description: Send single or bulk email messages. Emails are sent from the domain @boomerangui.com and it is possible to customise the Subject and to override the 'From' address. It is also possible to forward responses to an email address and / or a URL

Actions.Name: On SMS response submission
Actions.Description: Triggered by inbound replies which are automatically mapped to the associated outbound messages when sent as an Intelligent 2-way / conversational message

Actions.Name: On Delivery Confirmed
Actions.Description: Triggered by end user delivery status update. Updates the transaction with the delivery status returned by the end user's network operator. See https://boomerangmessaging.com/docs for more information

Actions.Name: Sms one-way
Actions.Description: SMS messages are delivered using an alpha-numeric originator (such as a company name) which must contain a maximum of 11 characters, and a recipient cannot respond to a message sent using an alpha numeric originator. Please also note that in destinations where delivery of messages with alpha-numeric originator is not supported (due to local restrictions), this may be replaced with a numeric originator, to ensure that the message is delivered.

Actions.Name: Sms two-way
Actions.Description: This method allows replies to be tracked directly against each outbound transaction and is used to manage conversations between your system and the end user. Replies can be forwarded to an email address and customers with Boommail can send an email-2-SMS message back to the responder. See https://boomerangmessaging.com/docs/sending-sms-messages, for more information regarding 2-way and conversational messaging.

Actions.Name: Sms custom number
Actions.Description: SMS messages are delivered using the number specified in the request so that any replies are returned to that number. Customers using Boomerang's Campaign feature can use a number associated to a Campaign, which allows inbound replies to to be accessed from the Campaign reporting section within Boomerang UI. However, unlike the SMS 2-way method, replies are not tracked against the outbound message. See https://boomerangmessaging.com/docs/sending-sms-messages for more information.

Actions.Name: Voice
Actions.Description: A fixed number is used as the originator for a Text-To-Speech (TTS) voice call. Keystrokes ‘1’ and ‘2’ are used to accept or decline the message, ‘9’ is used to redirect the call. See https://boomerangmessaging.com/docs/sending-delivering-voice-messages for more information

Provided XML document is automatically loaded as the default context; to access elements in the document, simply refer to them without a document reference, such as bookstore/book

Actions.Description: Return the reuslts of querying an XML document with an XQuery expression.  Supports XQuery 3.1 and earlier.  This API is optimized for multiple XML documents as input.  You can refer to the contents of a given document by name, for example doc("books.xml") or doc("restaurants.xml") if you included two input files named books.xml and restaurants.xml.  If input files contain no file name, they will default to file names input1.xml, input2.xml and so on.

Supports over 100 image file formats, Office document file formats, PDF, and more.

Supports all of the major Office document file formats including Word (DOCX, DOC), Excel (XLSX, XLS), PowerPoint (PPTX, PPT) and PDF files.  For spreadsheets, all worksheets will be included.  If you wish to exclude certain pages, worksheets, slides, etc. use the Split document API first, or the delete pages/slides/worksheet APIs first to adjust the document to the target state prior to converting to text.

If you wish to export the text from only one worksheet, try using the Split XLSX API to split the spreadsheet into multiple worksheet files, and then run XLSX to Text on the individual worksheet file that you need to extract the text from.

Actions.Name: Begin editing a document
Actions.Description: Uploads a document to Cloudmersive to begin a series of one or more editing operations.  To edit a document, first call Begin Editing on the document.  Then perform operations on the document using the secure URL returned from BeginEditing, such as Word DOCX Delete Pages and Insert Table.  Finally, perform finish editing on the URL to return the resulting edited document.  The editing URL is temporary and only stored in-memory cache, and will automatically expire from the cache after 30 minutes, and cannot be directly accessed.

Actions.Description: Deletes a range of 1 or more existing table rows in a Word DOCX Document and returns the result.

Actions.Name: Get comments from a Word DOCX document hierarchically
Actions.Description: Returns the comments and review annotations stored in the Word Document (DOCX) format file hierarchically, where reply comments are nested as children under top-level comments in the results returned.

Actions.Name: Get content of a footer from a Word DOCX document
Actions.Description: Returns the footer content from a Word Document (DOCX) format file

Actions.Name: Get images from a Word DOCX document
Actions.Description: Returns the images defined in the Word Document (DOCX) format file

Actions.Name: Get sections from a Word DOCX document
Actions.Description: Returns the sections defined in the Word Document (DOCX) format file

Actions.Name: Get styles from a Word DOCX document
Actions.Description: Returns the styles defined in the Word Document (DOCX) format file

Actions.Name: Get a specific table by index in a Word DOCX document
Actions.Description: Returns the specific table object by its 0-based index in an Office Word Document (DOCX)

Actions.Name: Gets the contents of an existing table row in an existing table in a W
Actions.Description: Gets the contents of an existing table row in a Word DOCX Document and returns the result.

Actions.Name: Get all tables in Word DOCX document
Actions.Description: Returns all the table objects in an Office Word Document (docx)

Actions.Name: Insert a new comment into a Word DOCX document attached to a paragraph
Actions.Description: Adds a new comment into a Word DOCX document attached to a paragraph and returns the result.  Call Finish Editing on the output URL to complete the operation.

Actions.Name: Insert image into a Word DOCX document
Actions.Description: Set the footer in a Word Document (DOCX).  Call Finish Editing on the output URL to complete the operation.

Actions.Name: Insert a new paragraph into a Word DOCX document
Actions.Description: Adds a new paragraph into a DOCX and returns the result.  You can insert at the beginning/end of a document, or before/after an existing object using its Path (location within the document).  Call Finish Editing on the output URL to complete the operation.

Actions.Name: Insert a new table into a Word DOCX document
Actions.Description: Adds a new table into a DOCX and returns the result.  Call Finish Editing on the output URL to complete the operation.

Actions.Name: Insert a new row into an existing table in a Word DOCX document
Actions.Description: Adds a new table row into a DOCX Document and returns the result.  Call Finish Editing on the output URL to complete the operation.

Actions.Name: Get pages and content from a Word DOCX document
Actions.Description: Returns the pages and contents of each page defined in the Word Document (DOCX) format file

Actions.Name: Remove headers and footers from Word DOCX document
Actions.Description: Remove all headers, or footers, or both from a Word Document (DOCX).  Call Finish Editing on the output URL to complete the operation.

Actions.Name: Delete any object in a Word DOCX document
Actions.Description: Delete any object, such as a paragraph, table, image, etc. from a Word Document (DOCX).  Pass in the Path of the object you would like to delete.  You can call other functions such as Get-Tables, Get-Images, Get-Body, etc. to get the paths of the objects in the document.  Call Finish Editing on the output URL to complete the operation.

Actions.Name: Replace string in Word DOCX document
Actions.Description: Replace all instances of a string in an Office Word Document (docx)

Actions.Name: Set the footer in a Word DOCX document
Actions.Description: Set the footer in a Word Document (DOCX).  Call Finish Editing on the output URL to complete the operation.

Actions.Name: Add page number to footer in a Word DOCX document
Actions.Description: Set the footer in a Word Document (DOCX) to contain a page number.  Call Finish Editing on the output URL to complete the operation.

Actions.Name: Set the header in a Word DOCX document
Actions.Description: Set the header in a Word Document (DOCX).  Call Finish Editing on the output URL to complete the operation.

Actions.Name: Update, set contents of a table cell in an existing table in a Word DO
Actions.Description: Sets the contents of a table cell into a DOCX Document and returns the result.  Call Finish Editing on the output URL to complete the operation.

Actions.Name: Update, set contents of a table row in an existing table in a Word DOCX document
Actions.Description: Sets the contents of a table row into a DOCX Document and returns the result.  Call Finish Editing on the output URL to complete the operation.

Actions.Name: Finish editing document, and download result from document editing
Actions.Description: Once done editing a document, download the result.  Begin editing a document by calling begin-editing, then perform operations, then call finish-editing to get the result.

Actions.Name: Delete, remove slides from a PowerPoint PPTX presentation document
Actions.Description: Edits the input PowerPoint PPTX presentation document to remove the specified slides

Actions.Name: Replace string in PowerPoint PPTX presentation
Actions.Description: Replace all instances of a string in an Office PowerPoint Document (pptx)

Actions.Name: Clear cell contents in an Excel XLSX spreadsheet, worksheet by index
Actions.Description: Clears, sets to blank, the contents of a specific cell in an Excel XLSX spreadsheet, worksheet

Actions.Name: Create a blank Excel XLSX spreadsheet
Actions.Description: Returns a blank Excel XLSX Spreadsheet (XLSX) format file

Actions.Name: Create a new Excel XLSX spreadsheet from column and row data
Actions.Description: Returns a new Excel XLSX Spreadsheet (XLSX) format file populated with column and row data specified as input

Actions.Name: Delete, remove worksheet from an Excel XLSX spreadsheet document
Actions.Description: Edits the input Excel XLSX spreadsheet document to remove the specified worksheet (tab).  Use the Get Worksheets API to enumerate available worksheets in a spreadsheet.

Actions.Name: Get cell from an Excel XLSX spreadsheet, worksheet by cell identifier
Actions.Description: Returns the value of a specific cell based on its identifier (e.g. A1, B22, C33, etc.) in the Excel Spreadsheet worksheet

Actions.Name: Get cell from an Excel XLSX spreadsheet, worksheet by index
Actions.Description: Returns the value and definition of a specific cell in a specific row in the Excel Spreadsheet worksheet

Actions.Name: Get images from a Excel XLSX spreadsheet, worksheet
Actions.Description: Returns the images defined in the Excel Spreadsheet worksheet

Actions.Name: Get rows and cells from a Excel XLSX spreadsheet, worksheet
Actions.Description: Returns the rows and cells defined in the Excel Spreadsheet worksheet

Actions.Name: Get rows and cells from a Excel XLSX spreadsheet, worksheet
Actions.Description: Returns the rows and cells defined in the Excel Spreadsheet worksheet

Actions.Name: Get styles from a Excel XLSX spreadsheet, worksheet
Actions.Description: Returns the style defined in the Excel Spreadsheet

Actions.Name: Get worksheets from a Excel XLSX spreadsheet
Actions.Description: Returns the worksheets (tabs) defined in the Excel Spreadsheet (XLSX) format file

Actions.Name: Insert a new worksheet into an Excel XLSX spreadsheet
Actions.Description: Inserts a new worksheet into an Excel Spreadsheet

Actions.Name: Set, update cell contents in an Excel XLSX spreadsheet, worksheet by c
Actions.Description: Sets, updates the contents of a specific cell in an Excel XLSX spreadsheet, worksheet using its cell identifier (e.g. A1, B22, C33) in the worksheet

Actions.Name: Set, update cell contents in an Excel XLSX spreadsheet, worksheet by index
Actions.Description: Sets, updates the contents of a specific cell in an Excel XLSX spreadsheet, worksheet

Actions.Name: Merge Two Word DOCX Together
Actions.Description: Combine two Office Word Documents (docx) into one single Office Word document

Actions.Name: Merge Multple Word DOCX Together
Actions.Description: Combine multiple Office Word Documents (docx) into one single Office Word document

Actions.Name: Merge Two PDF Files Together
Actions.Description: Combine two PDF files (pdf) into a single PDF document, preserving the order of the input documents in the combined document

Actions.Name: Merge Multple PDF Files Together
Actions.Description: Combine multiple PDF files (pdf) into a single PDF document, preserving the order of the input documents in the combined document

Actions.Name: Merge Multple PNG Files Together
Actions.Description: Combine multiple PNG files into a single PNG document, preserving the order of the input documents in the combined document by stacking them vertically

Actions.Name: Merge Two PowerPoint PPTX Together
Actions.Description: Combine two Office PowerPoint presentations (pptx) into one single Office PowerPoint presentation

Actions.Name: Merge Multple PowerPoint PPTX Together
Actions.Description: Combine multiple Office PowerPoint presentations (pptx) into one single Office PowerPoint presentation

Actions.Name: Merge Two Text (TXT) Files Together
Actions.Description: Combine two Text (.TXT) files into a single text document, preserving the order of the input documents in the combined document by stacking them vertically.

Actions.Name: Merge Multple Text (TXT) Files Together
Actions.Description: Combine multiple Text (.TXT) files into a single text document, preserving the order of the input documents in the combined document by stacking them vertically.

Actions.Name: Merge Two Excel XLSX Together
Actions.Description: Combine two Office Excel spreadsheets (xlsx) into a single Office Excel spreadsheet

Actions.Name: Merge Multple Excel XLSX Together
Actions.Description: Combine multiple Office Excel spreadsheets (xlsx) into a single Office Excel spreadsheet

Actions.Name: Split a single Word Document DOCX into Separate Documents by Page
Actions.Description: Split a Word DOCX Document, comprised of multiple pages into separate Word DOCX document files, with each containing exactly one page.

Actions.Name: Split a PDF file into separate PDF files, one per page
Actions.Description: Split an input PDF file into separate pages, comprised of one PDF file per page.

Actions.Name: Split a single PowerPoint Presentation PPTX into Separate Slides
Actions.Description: Split an PowerPoint PPTX Presentation, comprised of multiple slides into separate PowerPoint PPTX presentation files, with each containing exactly one slide.

Actions.Name: Split a single Text file (txt) into lines
Actions.Description: Split a Text (txt) Document by line, returning each line separately in order.  Supports multiple types of newlines.

Actions.Name: Split a single Text file (txt) by a string delimiter
Actions.Description: Split a Text (txt) Document by a string delimiter, returning each component of the string as an array of strings.

Actions.Name: Split a single Excel XLSX into Separate Worksheets
Actions.Description: Split an Excel XLSX Spreadsheet, comprised of multiple Worksheets (or Tabs) into separate Excel XLSX spreadsheet files, with each containing exactly one Worksheet.

Actions.Name: Autodetect content type and validate
Actions.Description: Automatically detect the type of content, verify and validate that the content is indeed fully valid at depth, and then report the validation result.

Actions.Name: Validate a Word document (DOCX)
Actions.Description: Validate a Word document (DOCX); if the document is not valid, identifies the errors in the document

Actions.Name: Validate a JSON file
Actions.Description: Validate a JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) document file; if the document is not valid, identifies the errors in the document

Actions.Name: Validate a PDF document file
Actions.Description: Validate a PDF document; if the document is not valid, identifies the errors in the document

Actions.Name: Validate a PowerPoint presentation (PPTX)
Actions.Description: Validate a PowerPoint presentation (PPTX); if the document is not valid, identifies the errors in the document

Actions.Name: Validate a Excel document (XLSX)
Actions.Description: Validate a Excel document (XLSX); if the document is not valid, identifies the errors in the document

Actions.Name: Validate an XML file
Actions.Description: Validate an XML document file; if the document is not valid, identifies the errors in the document

Actions.Name: Get comments from a Word DOCX document as a flat list
Actions.Description: Returns the comments and review annotations stored in the Word Document (DOCX) format file as a flattened list (not as a hierarchy of comments and replies).

Actions.Name: Base 64 decode, convert base 64 string to binary content
Actions.Description: Decodes / converts base 64 UTF-8 text string to binary content

Actions.Name: Detect, check if text string is base 64 encoded
Actions.Description: Checks, detects if input string is base 64 encoded

Actions.Name: Base 64 encode, convert binary or file data to a text string
Actions.Description: Encodes / converts binary or file data to a text string

Actions.Name: Set, change line endings of a text file
Actions.Description: Sets the line ending type of a text file; set to Windows, Unix or Mac.

Actions.Name: Detect line endings of a text file
Actions.Description: Detect line ending type (Windows, Unix or Mac) of an input file.

Actions.Name: Find a regular expression regex in text input
Actions.Description: Find all occurrences of the input regular expression in the input content, and returns the matches

Actions.Name: Find a string in text input
Actions.Description: Finds all occurrences of the input string in the input content, and returns the matches

Actions.Name: Remove whitespace from text string
Actions.Description: Removes all whitespace from text, leaving behind only non-whitespace characters.  Whitespace includes newlines, spaces and other whitespace characters.

Actions.Name: Remove HTML from text string
Actions.Description: Removes HTML from text, leaving behind only text.  Formatted text will become plain text.  Important for protecting against HTML and Cross-Site-Scripting attacks.

Actions.Name: Replace a string in text with a regex regular expression string
Actions.Description: Replaces all occurrences of the input regular expression regex string in the input content, and returns the result

Actions.Name: Replace a string in text with another string value
Actions.Description: Replaces all occurrences of the input string in the input content, and returns the result

Actions.Name: Detect text encoding of file
Actions.Description: Checks text encoding of file

Actions.Name: Trim leading and trailing whitespace from text string
Actions.Description: Trim leading and trailing whitespace from text, leaving behind a trimmed string.  Whitespace includes newlines, spaces and other whitespace characters.

Actions.Name: Validate if a file is executable
Actions.Description: Validate if an input file is a valid binary executable file.

Actions.Name: Create a web-based viewer
Actions.Description: Creates an HTML embed code for a simple web-based viewer of a document; supports Office document types and PDF.

Actions.Name: Compress files to create a new zip archive
Actions.Description: Create a new zip archive by compressing input files.

Actions.Name: Compress files and folders to create a new zip archive with advanced options
Actions.Description: Create a new zip archive by compressing input files, folders and leverage advanced options to control the structure of the resulting zip archive.

Actions.Description: Decrypts and removes password protection from an encrypted zip file with the specified password

Actions.Name: Encrypt and password protect a zip file
Actions.Description: Encrypts and password protects an existing zip file with the specified password and encryption algorithm

Actions.Name: Extract, decompress files and folders from a zip archive
Actions.Description: Extracts a zip archive by decompressing files, and folders.

Actions.Name: Transform an image into an artistic painting automatically
Actions.Description: Uses machine learning to automatically transform an image into an artistic painting.  Due to depth of AI processing, depending on image size this operation can take up to 20 seconds.

Actions.Name: Normalizes image rotation and removes EXIF rotation data
Actions.Description: Automatically orients the input image based on EXIF information and then removes the EXIF information.  EXIF is an additional set of information stored in some images taken with cell phone cameras based on the orientation of the camera.  By normalizing rotation and removing EXIF data these images become much easier to process.

Actions.Name: Composite two images together
Actions.Description: Composites two input images together; a layered image onto a base image.  The first image you input is the base image.  The second image (the layered image) will be composited on top of this base image.  Supports PNG transparency.  To control padding you can include transparent pixels at the border(s) of your layered images as appropriate.

Actions.Name: Adaptively adjust the contrast of the image to be more appealing and easy to see
Actions.Description: Uses Gamma to adjust the contrast adaptively the way the human eye sees the world.  Results significantly improve the viewability and visual appeal of the image.

Actions.Name: Crop an image to a rectangular area
Actions.Description: Crop an image to a target rectangular area

Actions.Name: Draw a polygon onto an image
Actions.Description: Draw one or more polygons, with customized visuals, onto an image

Actions.Name: Draw a rectangle onto an image
Actions.Description: Draw one or more rectangles, with customized visuals, onto an image

Actions.Name: Draw text onto an image
Actions.Description: Draw one or more pieces of text, with customized visuals, onto an image

Actions.Name: Add a customizeable drop shadow to an image
Actions.Description: Add a customizeable drop shadow to the image

Actions.Name: Remove transparency from the image
Actions.Description: Removes any active transparency in the image.  Effectively renders the image at the same resolution, in the same file format, over a white background, thus removing transparency.

Actions.Name: Rotate an image any number of degrees
Actions.Description: Rotates an image by an arbitrary number of degrees

Actions.Name: Compare and match faces
Actions.Description: Find the faces in an input image, and compare against a reference image to determine if there is a match against the face in the reference image.  The reference image (second parameter) should contain exactly one face.

Actions.Name: Crop image to face with square crop
Actions.Description: Crop an image to the face (rectangular crop).  If there is more than one face present, choose the first one.

Actions.Name: Crop image to face with round crop
Actions.Description: Crop an image to the face (circular/round crop).  If there is more than one face present, choose the first one.

Actions.Name: Detect the age of people in an image
Actions.Description: Identify the age, position, and size of human faces in an image, along with a recognition confidence level.  People in the image do NOT need to be facing the camera; they can be facing away, edge-on, etc.

Actions.Name: Detect the gender of people in an image
Actions.Description: Identify the gender, position, and size of human faces in an image, along with a recognition confidence level.  People in the image should be facing the camera.

Actions.Name: Detect and find faces in an image
Actions.Description: Locate the positions of all faces in an image

Actions.Name: Detect and find faces and landmarks eyes and nose and mouth in image
Actions.Description: Locate the positions of all faces in an image, along with the eyes, eye brows, nose and mouth components of each

Actions.Name: Convert image to black-and-white grayscale
Actions.Description: Remove color from the image by converting to a grayscale, black-and-white image

Actions.Name: Despeckle to remove point noise from the image
Actions.Description: Remove point noise / despeckle the input image

Actions.Name: Detect and highlight edges in an image
Actions.Description: Perform an edge detection operation on the input image

Actions.Name: Emboss an image
Actions.Description: Perform an emboss operation on the input image

Actions.Name: Perform a guassian blur on the input image
Actions.Description: Perform a gaussian blur on the input image

Actions.Name: Perform a motion blur on the input image
Actions.Description: Perform a motion blur on the input image at a specific angle

Actions.Name: Posterize the image by reducing distinct colors
Actions.Description: Reduce the unique number of colors in the image to the specified level

Actions.Name: Swirl distort the image
Actions.Description: Swirl distort the image by the specified number of degrees

Actions.Name: Returns the dominant colors of the image
Actions.Description: Uses advanced image processing to extract the top 5 dominant colors in the image, returned in the order of dominance with the most-dominant color first.  These are the primary perceptual colors used in the image as perceived by a viewer.

Actions.Name: Returns the image metadata including EXIF and resolution
Actions.Description: Returns the metadata information on the image, including file type, EXIF (if available), and resolution.

Actions.Name: Not safe for work NSFW racy content classification
Actions.Description: Classify an image into Not Safe For Work (NSFW)/Porn/Racy content and Safe Content.

Actions.Name: Describe an image in natural language
Actions.Description: Generate an English language text description of the image as a sentence.

Actions.Name: Detect and unskew a photo of a document
Actions.Description: Detect and unskew a photo of a document (e.g. taken on a cell phone) into a perfectly square image.  Great for document scanning applications; once unskewed, this image is perfect for converting to PDF using the Convert API or optical character recognition using the OCR API.

Actions.Name: Detect objects including types and locations in an image
Actions.Description: Identify the position, size and description of objects in an image, along with a recognition confidence level.  Detects both human people and objects in an image.

Actions.Name: Detect people including locations in an image
Actions.Description: Identify the position, and size of human people in an image, along with a recognition confidence level.  People in the image do NOT need to be facing the camera; they can be facing away, edge-on, etc.

Actions.Name: Detect fine text in a photo of a document
Actions.Description: Identify the position, and size of small/fine text within a photograph of a document.  Identify the location of small text in a photo - such as words and other forms of high density text.  Can be used on a scan of a document or a photograph (e.g. smartphone camera) of a document, page or receipt.  For OCR purposes - please see our Deep Learning OCR APIs.

Actions.Name: Detect large text in a photo
Actions.Description: Identify the position, and size of large text within a photograph.  Identify the location of large text in a photo - such as signs, titles, etc. and other forms of large, low-density text.  Not suitable for high-density text (e.g. scans of documents, receipts, etc.) for OCR purposes - for OCR, please see our Deep Learning OCR APIs.

Actions.Name: Detect vehicle license plates in an image
Actions.Description: Identify the position, and size, and content of vehicle license plates in an image.  License plates should be within 15-20 degrees on-axis to the camera.

Actions.Name: Find the location of a symbol in an image
Actions.Description: Determine if an image contains a symbol, and if so, the location of that symbol in the image.

Actions.Name: Resize an image while preserving aspect ratio
Actions.Description: Resize an image to a maximum width and maximum height, while preserving the image's original aspect ratio

Actions.Name: Resize an image
Actions.Description: Resize an image to a specific width and specific height

Actions.Name: Perform Profanity and Obscene Language Analysis and Detection on Text
Actions.Description: Analyze input text using advanced Profanity and Obscene Language Analysis to determine if the input contains profane language.  Supports English language input.  Consumes 1-2 API calls per sentence.

Actions.Name: Perform Sentiment Analysis and Classification on Text
Actions.Description: Analyze input text using advanced Sentiment Analysis to determine if the input is positive, negative, or neutral.  Supports English language input.  Consumes 1-2 API calls per sentence.

Actions.Name: Perform Subjectivity and Objectivity Analysis on Text
Actions.Description: Analyze input text using advanced Subjectivity and Objectivity Language Analysis to determine if the input text is objective or subjective, and how much.  Supports English language input.  Consumes 1-2 API calls per sentence.

Actions.Name: Extract entities from string
Actions.Description: Extract the named entitites from an input string.

Actions.Name: Detect language of text
Actions.Description: Automatically determine which language a text string is written in.  Supports Danish (DAN), German (DEU), English (ENG), French (FRA), Italian (ITA), Japanese (JPN), Korean (KOR), Dutch (NLD), Norwegian (NOR), Portuguese (POR), Russian (RUS), Spanish (SPA), Swedish (SWE), Chinese (ZHO).

Actions.Name: Translate German to English text with Deep Learning AI
Actions.Description: Automatically translates input text in German to output text in English using advanced Deep Learning and Neural NLP.  Consumes 1-2 API calls per input sentence.

Actions.Name: Translate English to German text with Deep Learning AI
Actions.Description: Automatically translates input text in English to output text in German using advanced Deep Learning and Neural NLP.  Consumes 1-2 API calls per input sentence.

Actions.Name: Translate English to Russian text with Deep Learning AI
Actions.Description: Automatically translates input text in English to output text in Russian using advanced Deep Learning and Neural NLP.  Consumes 1-2 API calls per input sentence.

Actions.Name: Translate Russian to English text with Deep Learning AI
Actions.Description: Automatically translates input text in Russian to output text in English using advanced Deep Learning and Neural NLP.  Consumes 1-2 API calls per input sentence.

Actions.Name: Parse string to syntax tree
Actions.Description: Parses the input string into a Penn Treebank syntax tree

Actions.Name: Part-of-speech tag a string, filter to adjectives
Actions.Description: Part-of-speech (POS) tag a string, find the adjectives, and return result as JSON

Actions.Name: Part-of-speech tag a string, filter to adverbs
Actions.Description: Part-of-speech (POS) tag a string, find the adverbs, and return result as JSON

Actions.Name: Part-of-speech tag a string, filter to nouns
Actions.Description: Part-of-speech (POS) tag a string, find the nouns, and return result as JSON

Actions.Name: Part-of-speech tag a string, filter to pronouns
Actions.Description: Part-of-speech (POS) tag a string, find the pronouns, and return result as JSON

Actions.Name: Part-of-speech tag a string
Actions.Description: Part-of-speech (POS) tag a string and return result as JSON

Actions.Name: Part-of-speech tag a string, filter to verbs
Actions.Description: Part-of-speech (POS) tag a string, find the verbs, and return result as JSON

Actions.Name: Rephrase, paraphrase English text sentence-by-sentence using Deep Learning AI
Actions.Description: Automatically rephrases or paraphrases input text in English sentence by sentence using advanced Deep Learning and Neural NLP.  Creates multiple reprhasing candidates per input sentence, from 1 to 10 possible rephrasings of the original sentence.  Seeks to preserve original semantic meaning in rephrased output candidates.  Consumes 1-2 API calls per output rephrasing option generated, per sentence.

Actions.Name: Extract sentences from string
Actions.Description: Segment an input string into separate sentences, output result as a string.

Actions.Name: Get words in input string
Actions.Description: Get the component words in an input string

Actions.Name: Check if sentence is spelled correctly
Actions.Description: Checks whether the sentence is spelled correctly and returns the result as JSON

Actions.Name: Find spelling corrections
Actions.Description: Find spelling correction suggestions and return result as JSON

Actions.Name: Add one or more PDF annotations, comments in the PDF document
Actions.Description: Adds one or more annotations, comments to a PDF document.

Actions.Name: Decrypt and password-protect a PDF
Actions.Description: Decrypt a PDF document with a password.  Decrypted PDF will no longer require a password to open.

Actions.Name: Remove, delete pages from a PDF document
Actions.Description: Remove one or more pages from a PDF document

Actions.Name: Encrypt and password-protect a PDF
Actions.Description: Encrypt a PDF document with a password.  Set an owner password to control owner (editor/creator) permissions, and set a user (reader) password to control the viewer of the PDF.  Set the password fields null to omit the given password.

Actions.Name: Get PDF annotations, including comments in the document
Actions.Description: Enumerates the annotations, including comments and notes, in a PDF document.

Actions.Name: Gets PDF Form fields and values
Actions.Description: Encrypt a PDF document with a password.  Set an owner password to control owner (editor/creator) permissions, and set a user (reader) password to control the viewer of the PDF.  Set the password fields null to omit the given password.

Actions.Name: Get PDF document metadata
Actions.Description: Returns the metadata from the PDF document, including Title, Author, etc.

Actions.Name: Get text in a PDF document by page
Actions.Description: Gets the text in a PDF by page

Actions.Name: Insert, copy pages from one PDF document into another
Actions.Description: Copy one or more pages from one PDF document (source document) and insert them into a second PDF document (destination document).

Actions.Name: Rasterize a PDF to an image-based PDF
Actions.Description: Rasterize a PDF into an image-based PDF.  The output is a PDF where each page is comprised of a high-resolution image, with all text, figures and other components removed.

Actions.Name: Remove all PDF annotations, including comments in the document
Actions.Description: Removes all of the annotations, including comments and notes, in a PDF document.

Actions.Name: Remove a specific PDF annotation, comment in the document
Actions.Description: Removes a specific annotation in a PDF document, using the AnnotationIndex.  To enumerate AnnotationIndex for all of the annotations in the PDF document, use the /edit/pdf/annotations/list API.

Actions.Name: Rotate all pages in a PDF document
Actions.Description: Rotate all of the pages in a PDF document by a multiple of 90 degrees

Actions.Name: Rotate a range, subset of pages in a PDF document
Actions.Description: Rotate a range of specific pages in a PDF document by a multiple of 90 degrees

Actions.Name: Sets ands fills PDF Form field values
Actions.Description: Fill in the form fields in a PDF form with specific values.  Use form/get-fields to enumerate the available fields and their data types in an input form.

Actions.Name: Sets PDF document metadata
Actions.Description: Sets (writes) metadata into the input PDF document, including Title, Author, etc.

Actions.Name: Encrypt, password-protect and set restricted permissions on a PDF
Actions.Description: Encrypt a PDF document with a password, and set permissions on the PDF.  Set an owner password to control owner (editor/creator) permissions [required], and set a user (reader) password to control the viewer of the PDF [optional].  Set the reader password to null to omit the password.  Restrict or allow printing, copying content, document assembly, editing (read-only), form filling, modification of annotations, and degraded printing through document Digital Rights Management (DRM).

Actions.Name: Add a text watermark to a PDF
Actions.Description: Adds a text watermark to a PDF

Actions.Name: Automatically detect threats in an input string
Actions.Description: Auto-detects a wide range of threat types in input string, including Cross-Site Scripting (XSS), SQL Injection (SQLI), XML External Entitites (XXE), Server-side Request Forgeries (SSRF), and JSON Insecure Deserialization (JID).

Actions.Name: Check text input for SQL Injection (SQLI) attacks
Actions.Description: Detects SQL Injection (SQLI) attacks from text input.

Actions.Name: Protect text input from XML External Entity (XXE) attacks
Actions.Description: Detects XXE (XML External Entity) attacks from XML text input.

Actions.Name: Detect Insecure Deserialization JSON (JID) attacks in a string
Actions.Description: Detects Insecure Deserialization JSON (JID) attacks from text input.

Actions.Name: Protect text input from Cross-Site-Scripting (XSS) attacks through normalization
Actions.Description: Detects and removes XSS (Cross-Site-Scripting) attacks from text input through normalization.  Returns the normalized result, as well as information on whether the original input contained an XSS risk.

Actions.Name: Check a URL for Server-side Request Forgery (SSRF) threats
Actions.Description: Checks if an input URL is at risk of being an SSRF (Server-side request forgery) threat or attack.

Actions.Name: Check if IP address is a Bot client threat
Actions.Description: Check if the input IP address is a Bot, robot, or otherwise a non-user entity.  Leverages real-time signals to check against known high-probability bots..

Actions.Name: Check if IP address is a known threat
Actions.Description: Check if the input IP address is a known threat IP address.  Checks against known bad IPs, botnets, compromised servers, and other lists of threats.

Actions.Name: Check if IP address is a Tor node server
Actions.Description: Check if the input IP address is a Tor exit node server.  Tor servers are a type of privacy-preserving technology that can hide the original IP address who makes a request.

Actions.Name: Convert Audio File to AAC format
Actions.Description: Automatically detect audio file format and convert it to AAC format. Supports many input audio formats, including AAC, FLAC, M4A, MP2, MP3, OGG, WMA, and WAV. Uses 1 API call per 10 MB of file size. Also uses 1 API call per additional minute of processing time over 5 minutes, up to a maximum of 25 minutes total processing time. Maximum output file size is 50GB.

Actions.Name: Convert Audio File to M4A format
Actions.Description: Automatically detect audio file format and convert it to M4A format. Supports many input audio formats, including AAC, FLAC, M4A, MP2, MP3, OGG, WMA, and WAV. Uses 1 API call per 10 MB of file size. Also uses 1 API call per additional minute of processing time over 5 minutes, up to a maximum of 25 minutes total processing time. Maximum output file size is 50GB.

Actions.Name: Convert Audio File to MP3 format
Actions.Description: Automatically detect audio file format and convert it to MP3 format. Supports many input audio formats, including AAC, FLAC, M4A, MP2, MP3, OGG, WMA, and WAV. Uses 1 API call per 10 MB of file size. Also uses 1 API call per additional minute of processing time over 5 minutes, up to a maximum of 25 minutes total processing time. Maximum output file size is 50GB.

Actions.Name: Convert Audio File to WAV format
Actions.Description: Automatically detect audio file format and convert it to WAV format. Supports many input audio formats, including AAC, FLAC, M4A, MP2, MP3, OGG, WMA, and WAV. Uses 1 API call per 10 MB of file size. Also uses 1 API call per additional minute of processing time over 5 minutes, up to a maximum of 25 minutes total processing time. Maximum output file size is 50GB.

Actions.Name: Convert Video to Animated GIF format
Actions.Description: Automatically detect video file format and convert it to animated GIF format. Supports many input video formats, including AVI, ASF, FLV, MP4, MPEG/MPG, Matroska/WEBM, 3G2, OGV, MKV, M4V and MOV. Uses 1 API call per 10 MB of file size. Also uses 1 API call per additional minute of processing time over 5 minutes, up to a maximum of 25 minutes total processing time. Maximum output file size is 50GB. Default height is 250 pixels, while preserving the video's aspect ratio.

Actions.Name: Convert Video to MOV format
Actions.Description: Automatically detect video file format and convert it to MOV format. Supports many input video formats, including AVI, ASF, FLV, MP4, MPEG/MPG, Matroska/WEBM, 3G2, OGV, MKV, M4V and MOV. Uses 1 API call per 10 MB of file size. Also uses 1 API call per additional minute of processing time over 5 minutes, up to a maximum of 25 minutes total processing time. Maximum output file size is 50GB.

Actions.Name: Convert Video to MP4 format
Actions.Description: Automatically detect video file format and convert it to MP4 format. Supports many input video formats, including AVI, ASF, FLV, MP4, MPEG/MPG, Matroska/WEBM, 3G2, OGV, MKV, M4V and MOV. Uses 1 API call per 10 MB of file size. Also uses 1 API call per additional minute of processing time over 5 minutes, up to a maximum of 25 minutes total processing time. Maximum output file size is 50GB.

Actions.Name: Convert Video to PNG Still Frames
Actions.Description: Automatically detect video file format and convert it to an array of still frame PNG images. Supports many input video formats, including AVI, ASF, FLV, MP4, MPEG/MPG, Matroska/WEBM, 3G2, OGV, MKV, M4V and MOV. Uses 1 API call per 10 MB of file size. Also uses 1 API call per additional minute of processing time over 5 minutes, up to a maximum of 25 minutes total processing time.

Actions.Name: Convert Video to WEBM format
Actions.Description: Automatically detect video file format and convert it to WEBM format. Supports many input video formats, including AVI, ASF, FLV, MP4, MPEG/MPG, Matroska/WEBM, 3G2, OGV, MKV, M4V and MOV. Uses 1 API call per 10 MB of file size. Also uses 1 API call per additional minute of processing time over 5 minutes, up to a maximum of 25 minutes total processing time. Maximum output file size is 50GB.

Actions.Name: Cut a Video to a Shorter Length
Actions.Description: Cuts a video to the specified start and end times. Supports many input video formats, including AVI, ASF, FLV, MP4, MPEG/MPG, Matroska/WEBM, 3G2, MKV, M4V and MOV. Uses 1 API call per 10 MB of file size. Also uses 1 API call per additional minute of processing time over 5 minutes, up to a maximum of 25 minutes total processing time. Maximum output file size is 50GB.

Actions.Name: Get detailed information about a video or audio file
Actions.Description: Retrieve detailed information about a video or audio file, including format, dimensions, file size, bit rate, duration and start time. Compatible with many formats, including: AVI, ASF, FLV, GIF, MP4, MPEG/MPG, Matroska/WEBM, MOV, AIFF, ASF, CAF, MP3, MP2, MP1, Ogg, OMG/OMA, and WAV. Uses 1 API call per 10 MB of file size.

Actions.Name: Resizes a Video Preserving the Original Aspect Ratio
Actions.Description: Resizes a video, while maintaining the original aspect ratio and encoding. Supports many input video formats, including AVI, ASF, FLV, MP4, MPEG/MPG, Matroska/WEBM, 3G2, MKV, M4V and MOV. Uses 1 API call per 10 MB of file size. Also uses 1 API call per additional minute of processing time over 5 minutes, up to a maximum of 25 minutes total processing time. Maximum output file size is 50GB.

Actions.Name: Resizes a Video without Preserving Aspect Ratio
Actions.Description: Resizes a video without maintaining original aspect ratio, allowing fully customizable dimensions. May cause image skewing. Supports many input video formats, including AVI, ASF, FLV, MP4, MPEG/MPG, Matroska/WEBM, 3G2, MKV, M4V and MOV. Uses 1 API call per 10 MB of file size. Also uses 1 API call per additional minute of processing time over 5 minutes, up to a maximum of 25 minutes total processing time. Maximum output file size is 50GB.

Actions.Name: Scan a Video for NSFW content
Actions.Description: Automatically detect video file format and scan it for Not Safe For Work (NSFW)/Porn/Racy content. Supports many input video formats, including AVI, ASF, FLV, MP4, MPEG/MPG, Matroska/WEBM, 3G2, OGV, MKV, M4V and MOV. Uses 1 API call per 10 MB of file size. Also uses 1 API call per frame scanned.

Actions.Name: Split a Video into Two Shorter Videos
Actions.Description: Cuts a video into two videos based on the specified start time. Supports many input video formats, including AVI, ASF, FLV, MP4, MPEG/MPG, Matroska/WEBM, 3G2, MKV, M4V and MOV. Uses 1 API call per 10 MB of file size. Also uses 1 API call per additional minute of processing time over 5 minutes, up to a maximum of 25 minutes total processing time. Maximum output file size is 50GB.

Actions.Name: Scan a file for viruses
Actions.Description: Scan files and content for viruses. Leverage continuously updated signatures for millions of threats, and advanced high-performance scanning capabilities.  Over 5 million virus and malware signatures.  Continuous cloud-based updates.  Wide file format support including Office, PDF, HTML, Flash.  Zip support including .Zip, .Rar, .DMG, .Tar, and other archive formats.  Multi-threat scanning across viruses, malware, trojans, ransomware, and spyware.  High-speed in-memory scanning delivers subsecond typical response time.

Actions.Name: Scan a website for malicious content and threats
Actions.Description: Operation includes scanning the content of the URL for various types of malicious content and threats, including viruses and threats (including Phishing).

Actions.Name: Get account information
Actions.Description: Returns details about your account.

Actions.Name: Add document to package
Actions.Description: This call will add a document to an existing package.

Actions.Description: This call creates a package with a single document in it and instantly prepares it for signing

Actions.Description: This call creates an empty package, allowing documents to be added to it

Actions.Description: eSignatures does not automatically delete packages from the database once they have reached a final state. They are stored indefinitely. To delete packages from the database, users can use the Delete Package call.

Actions.Name: Document Correlation Audit Proof Download
Actions.Description: Correlation ids are used to track packages or documents across several passes through the eSignatures application.

Actions.Name: Download Document from Package
Actions.Description: The signed documents in a package can be downloaded one by one by an external system using this call. Each document will be downloaded as a PDF, or as an XML file stream, depending on the value of the DocumentType parameter.

Actions.Name: Download Package
Actions.Description: The package containing the signed documents can be downloaded by an external system using this call.

Actions.Name: Expiry Time Stamp
Actions.Description: A package may have the status Expired when a package passed a value for the ExpiryTimestamp parameter in the Create Package call. Such a package can no longer be signed.

Actions.Description: Retrieves the current state of the package and its documents.

Actions.Name: Get Signing Locations
Actions.Description: This call provides an overview of all signing locations inside the documents within a package.

Actions.Description: A package’s audit proofs xml can be retrieved when the package is fully signed. The same applies for a document: it only works when the containing package is fully signed.

Actions.Description: A package’s audit proofs xml can be retrieved when the package is fully signed. The same applies for a document: it only works when the containing package is fully signed.

Actions.Description: Get a list of packages with their current status

Actions.Description: This call allows API users to add extra proofs from an external source to a location on a document.

Actions.Name: Send Package Reminders
Actions.Description: Company policy might require that a document is handled within a given timespan. Triggering the “send reminders” call will look up everybody who hasn’t signed and send them an extra notification as a reminder.

Actions.Name: Set Package Status
Actions.Description: By means of the Set Package Status call, you can change the status of a package.

Actions.Description: This webservice method updates the people involved in the process (stakeholders) and assigns them steps which need to be taken.

Actions.Name: Skip Signers
Actions.Description: This call skips all signers that haven’t signed yet and sets their status to “Skipped”, which results in the complete package being marked as “Finished”.

Actions.Name: Give feedback to the extraction results of a document
Actions.Description:
You can give feedback by sending the adapted extraction result dictionary.
Example python code:
import requests
import json
from requests.auth import HTTPBasicAuth

url = f"https://app.konfuzio.com/api/v2/docs/{DOC_ID}/"
auth = HTTPBasicAuth(KONFUZIO_USER, KONFUZIO_PASSWORD)
data = requests.get(url=url, auth=auth).json()

# Mark Extraction as correct.
data['labels']['Bruttozahlweise']['extractions'][0]['correct'] = True

# Add new Extraction which has not been in result list.
data['labels']['Bruttozahlweise']['extractions'].append({'value': '123,45'})

r = requests.patch(url = url, data=json.dumps(data), auth=auth, headers={'Content-Type': 'application/json'},)

Actions.Name: Get Single Weather Station 15min Summary
Actions.Description: Returns a set of quarter-hourly summaries for a specific station. Note that the 30min summary is only available from the beginning of the previous year to the current date.

Actions.Name: Get Single Weather Station 30min Summary
Actions.Description: Returns a set of half-hourly summaries for a specific station. Note that the 15min summary is only available from the beginning of the previous year to the current date.

Actions.Name: Get Single Weather Station Bulletins
Actions.Description: Returns daily 9am bulletins for a station. The daily 9am bulletin is a summary where every field has been summarized over the 24 hour period to 9am.

Actions.Name: Get Single Weather Station Daily Summary
Actions.Description: Returns a set of daily summaries for a specific station. The 24 hour period each field is summarized over varies between 24 hours to 9am (eg rainfall, minimum temperature), 24 hours from 9am (eg maximum temperature) and 24 hours from 12am (eg wind, solar).

Actions.Name: Get Single Weather Station Hourly Summary
Actions.Description: Returns a set of hourly summaries for a specific station.

Actions.Name: Get Single Weather Station Latest Data
Actions.Description: Get the latest data for a station.

Actions.Name: Get Single Weather Station Minute Data
Actions.Description: Returns minute recordings for a station over a maximum 24 hour period.

Actions.Name: Get Single Weather Station Monthly Summary
Actions.Description: Returns a set of monthly summaries for a specific station. The monthly period each field is summarized over is a monthly composite of the same 24 hour period used by the field in the daily summary. For example, rainfall, which uses the 24 hours to 9am daily period starts at 9am on the last day of the previous month and concludes at 9am on the last day of the month.

Actions.Name: Get Weather Stations Extreme Conditions

The extreme conditions indicated are: frost conditions - where temperature is less than or equal to 2°C; heat conditions - where temperature is greater than or equal to 30°C; and erosion conditions - where wind is greater than or equal to 28.8km/h.

Actions.Description: This event updates or creates user account information for account protection service, for example, Add Payment Instrument, Add Address, or any other user attribute. This is a data ingestion event only

Actions.Name: Updates fraud label information for account protection
Actions.Description: This event sends an update of the label. This is a data ingestion event only

Actions.Name: Provides risk assessment for custom events
Actions.Description: This event allows you to send a structure of their own choosing, triggered by conditions of their own choosing for rule-evaluation. The response contains a decision for the event

Actions.Name: Updates bank authorization information
Actions.Description: This event conveys if a purchase transaction sent to the bank was approved or rejected for bank authorization or bank charge/settlement. This is a data ingestion event only

Actions.Name: Updates confirmed fraud information
Actions.Description:
This event sends information about a previous purchase that the customer disputed with their bank as fraud. This is
a data ingestion event only. Many merchants send these events using bulk data upload

Actions.Name: Updates fraud label information for purchase protection
Actions.Description: This event sends an update of the label. This is a data ingestion event only

Actions.Name: Provides risk assessment for online purchase transaction
Actions.Description: This event sends information and context about an incoming new purchase transaction. The response contains a decision to either approve or reject the purchase transaction and the appropriate Merchant ID (MID) the merchant should send in the authorization call to their bank

Actions.Name: Updates status of a online purchase transaction
Actions.Description: This event sends an update of the status of a purchase, for example, if the purchase has been canceled. This is a data ingestion event only

Actions.Name: Updates refund information

Actions.Description: Updates the inventory for a listing identified by a listing ID. The update fails if the supplied values for product SKU, offering quantity, and/or price are incompatible with values in on property fields. When setting a price, assign a float equal to amount divided by divisor as specified in the money resource.

Actions.Name: Delete a listing
Actions.Description: This action deletes a shop listing. A listing can be deleted only if the state is one of the following: SOLD_OUT, DRAFT, EXPIRED, INACTIVE, ACTIVE and is_available or ACTIVE and has seller flags: SUPRESSED (frozen), VACATION, CUSTOM_SHOPS (pattern), SELL_ON_FACEBOOK

Actions.Name: Delete a file from listing
Actions.Description: When you delete the final file for a digital listing, the listing converts into a physical listing. The response to a delete request returns a list of the remaining file records associated with the given listing.

Actions.Name: Delete a listing image
Actions.Description: Deletes a listing image. A copy of the file remains on our servers, and so a deleted image may be re-associated with the listing without re-uploading the original image.

Actions.Description: Deletes a property from a listing.

Actions.Name: Get a listing
Actions.Description: Retrieves a listing record by listing ID.
