Actions.Description: A list of all active listings on Etsy paginated by their creation date. Without sort order listings will be returned newest-first by default.

Actions.Name: Get active listings by shop
Actions.Description: Retrieves a list of all active listings on Etsy in a specific shop, paginated by listing creation date.

Actions.Name: Get listings by ID
Actions.Description: Allows to query multiple listing IDs at once. Limit 100 IDs maximum per query.

Actions.Name: Get listings by shop receipt
Actions.Description: Gets all listings associated with a receipt.

Actions.Name: Get listings by shop section ID
Actions.Description: Retrieves all the listings from the section of a specific shop.

Actions.Name: Get featured listings by shop
Actions.Description: Retrieves listings associated to a shop that are featured.

Actions.Name: Get a file from a listing
Actions.Description: Retrieves a single file associated with the given digital listing. Requesting a file from a physical listing returns an empty result.

Actions.Name: Get all listing files
Actions.Description: Retrieves all the files associated with the given digital listing. Requesting files from a physical listing returns an empty result.

Actions.Name: Get a listing image
Actions.Description: Retrieves the references and metadata for a listing image with a specific image ID.

Actions.Name: Get product properties by taxonomy ID
Actions.Description: Retrieves a list of product properties, with applicable scales and values, supported for a specific seller taxonomy ID.

Actions.Name: Get listings by shop
Actions.Description: Returns listings that belong to a Shop. Listings can be filtered using the state parameter.

Actions.Name: Get seller taxonomy nodes
Actions.Description: Retrieves the full hierarchy tree of seller taxonomy nodes.

Actions.Name: Update a listing
Actions.Description: Updates a listing, identified by a listing ID, for a specific shop identified by a shop ID.

Actions.Name: Update a listing property
Actions.Description: Updates or populates the properties list defining product offerings for a listing. Each offering requires both a value and a value ID that are valid for a scale ID assigned to the listing or that you assign to the listing with this request.

Actions.Name: Update a listing translation
Actions.Description: Updates a listing translation by listing ID and language.

Actions.Name: Upload a listing file
Actions.Description: Uploads a new file for a digital listing, or associates an existing file with a specific listing. You must either provide the listing file ID of an existing file, or the name and binary file data for a file to upload. Associating an existing file to a physical listing converts the physical listing into a digital listing, which removes all shipping costs and any product and inventory variations.

Actions.Name: Upload a listing image
Actions.Description: Uploads or assigns an image to a listing identified by a shop ID with a listing ID. To upload a new image, set the image file as the value for the image parameter. You can assign a previously deleted image to a listing using the deleted image's image ID in the listing image ID parameter. When a request contains both image and listing image ID parameter values, the endpoint uploads the image in the image parameter only.

Actions.Name: Get a payment from a payment account ledger entry ID
Actions.Description: Get a Payment from a Payment Account Ledger Entry ID, if applicable.

Actions.Name: Get a payment from a specific receipt

Actions.Name: Get a list of payments
Actions.Description: Retrieves a list of payments from a shop identified by shop ID. You can also filter results using a list of payment IDs.

Actions.Name: Ping
Actions.Description: Check to confirm connectivity to the Etsy API with an application.

Actions.Name: Create a Shipment Receipt
Actions.Description: Submits tracking information for a shop receipt, which creates a shop receipt Shipment entry for the given receipt ID. Each time you successfully submit tracking info, Etsy sends a notification email to the buyer User. When send BCC is true, Etsy sends shipping notifications to the seller as well. When tracking code and carrier name aren't sent, the receipt is marked as shipped only.

Actions.Name: Get a receipt
Actions.Description: Retrieves a receipt, identified by a receipt ID, from an Etsy shop.

Actions.Name: Get receipts
Actions.Description: Requests the shop receipts from a specific shop, unfiltered or filtered by receipt ID range or offset, date, paid, and/or shipped purchases.

Actions.Name: Get reviews
Actions.Description: Retrieves the reviews from a shop given its ID.

Actions.Name: Get shipping carriers
Actions.Description: Retrieves a list of available shipping carriers and the mail classes associated with them for a given country.

Actions.Name: Create a shipping profile destination
Actions.Description: Creates a new shipping destination, which sets the shipping cost, carrier, and class for a destination in a shipping profile. This assigns costs using the currency of the associated shop. Set the destination using either destination country ISO or destination region; destination country ISO and destination region are mutually exclusive — set one or the other. Setting both triggers error 400. If the request sets neither destination country ISO nor destination region, the default destination is everywhere. You must also either assign both a shipping carrier ID and mail class or both min delivery days and max delivery days.

Actions.Name: Create a shipping profile
Actions.Description: Creates a new shipping profile. You can pass a country ISO code or a region when creating a shipping profile, but not both. Only one is required. You must pass either a shipping carrier ID and mail class, or both min and max delivery days.

Actions.Name: Create a shipping profile upgrade
Actions.Description: Creates a new shipping profile upgrade, which can establish a price for a shipping option, such as an alternate carrier or faster delivery.

Actions.Name: Delete a shipping profile
Actions.Description: Deletes a shipping profile by given ID.

Actions.Name: Delete a shipping profile destination
Actions.Description: Deletes a shipping destination and removes the destination option from every listing that uses the associated shipping profile. A shipping profile requires at least one shipping destination, so this endpoint cannot delete the final shipping destination for any shipping profile. To delete the final shipping destination from a shipping profile, you must delete the entire shipping profile.

Actions.Name: Delete a shipping profile upgrade
Actions.Description: Deletes a shipping profile upgrade and removes the upgrade option from every listing that uses the associated shipping profile.

Actions.Name: Get profile destinations by shipping profile
Actions.Description: Retrieves a list of shipping destination objects associated with a shipping profile.

Actions.Description: Retrieves the list of shipping profile upgrades assigned to a specific shipping profile.

Actions.Name: Update a shipping profile upgrade

Actions.Description: Retrieve information about a persisted face specified by persistedFaceId, personId and its belonging personGroupId.

Actions.Description: Retrieve the information of a person group, including its name and userData.

Actions.Name: Get a person (V2)
Actions.Description: Retrieve a person's information, including registered persisted faces, name and userData.

Actions.Description: Verify whether two faces belong to a same person or whether one face belongs to a person.

Actions.Name: Flexible Search
Actions.Description: Flexible Search adds both Regular Expressions and Globbing support to the DNSDB API to expand the types of search queries and add more control to searches.

Actions.Name: Ping
Actions.Description: This request is for end to end connectivity tests to the DNSDB API endpoint, letting you know that there are no firewall blockages. This request does not require an API key. It returns just a JSON object {'ping': 'ok'}.

Actions.Name: Service Limits
Actions.Description: Retrieve service limits

Actions.Description: The RData lookup queries DNSDB's Rdata index, which supports inverse lookups based on Rdata record values.

Actions.Name: RRSet Lookup
Actions.Description: The RRSet lookup queries DNSDB's RRset index, which supports forward lookups based on the owner name of an RRset.

Actions.Name: When a file is added or modified [DEPRECATED]
Actions.Description: This operation triggers a flow when a file is added or modified in a folder. The trigger will fetch both the file metadata as well as the content of the file. The trigger relies on the last modified time of a file. If a file is being created by a third-party client, the preservation of the last modified time should be disabled in the client. Files larger than 50 megabytes are skipped by the trigger. The trigger does not fire if a file is added/updated in a subfolder. If it is required to trigger on subfolders, multiple triggers should be created.

Actions.Name: When a file is added or modified (properties only)
Actions.Description: This operation triggers a flow when one or more files are added or modified in a folder. This trigger will only fetch the file metadata. To get the file content, you can use the "Get file content" operation. The trigger relies on the last modified time of a file. If a file is being created by a third-party client, the preservation of the last modified time should be disabled in the client. The trigger does not fire if a file is added/updated in a subfolder. If it is required to trigger on subfolders, multiple triggers should be created.

Actions.Name: Update file
Actions.Description: This operation updates a file. If a file is being deleted/renamed on server right after it was updated, connector may return HTTP 404 error by it's design. Please use a delay for 1 minute before deleting or renaming recently updated file.

Actions.Name: Create and send document or template
Actions.Description:
You must create a document to be able to send it to a recipient. When creating a document you can refer to previously uploaded files with file_id or you can choose to create a document and upload the files in on API post. You can only upload ONE file when including a file in the create document POST.
Use either file_ids parameter to use existing uploaded file(s), file_content to send the document as base64 encoded string or do a multipart post with file parameter.
All recipients must have either a valid e-mail or a mobile number.
All events are recorded using requestor IP address. You can override this using header CLIENT_IP containing the end-users public IP address.

Actions.Name: Subscribe to document events
Actions.Description:
This call will create a new subscription.
The response will be wrapped in an array even for single object according to REST hook standards.

Events


document.created - Document is created
document.sent - Document is sent
document.viewed - Document is sent
document.signed - Document is signed
document.approved - Document is approved
document.expired - Document has expired
document.rejected - Document is rejected
document.downloaded - Document is downloaded
document.printed - Document is printed
document.forwarded - Document is forwarded
document.partially_signed - Document has been partially signed
document.commented - Document is commented
document.hardbounced - Document is hardbounced
document.imported - Document is imported

Actions.Name: Send existing document
Actions.Description:
When you send a document via GetAccept, we deliver an email to all recipients, each containing a unique, secured link. This API call triggers the document send action and can only be performed on documents with document_status = draft. The document will be sent to recipients you provided when it was created.
If document was created using self-sign option it will also be self-signed by the authenticated or specified user before sending.

Actions.Name: Upload an attachment
Actions.Description:
You can upload attachment files to include with documents you send.
Successful request will return the attachment_id. Use attachment_id to assign an attachment to a document.

Actions.Name: Upload a document file
Actions.Description:
You can upload one file at a time and get a file id. The file id is used to connect a file with a GetAccept document which is sent to recipients. If you want to upload mutliple files you run multiple POST. We only accept files up to 10 MB as default. Uploaded file need to be imported/added to a document within 48 hours after uploading.
We recommended you to upload PDF files in order to guarantee the same look when sent. Other file types can be converted, such as:
Mirosoft Office: doc, docx, xl, xls, xlsx, ppt, pptx
Mac: numbers, key
Images: jpg, jpeg, png
Other: html, tex, csv

Actions.Name: Upload a video
Actions.Description:

Actions.Name: Get access token
Actions.Description: Access tokens are similar to session tokens and allow entering of credentials once per session. Once authenticated, a user is provided with an access token that is submitted with every secure request (those containing '/secure/' in the URL path, e.g. submitting a donation) instead of always submitting a username and password. Access tokens are short-lived and can expire so users need to re-GET a token at the start of each session or if their current access token expires. Note that access token timeouts are individually set for each API user as a database configuration and by default are set to 10 hours.

Actions.Name: Get all projects for a campaign
Actions.Description: This action retrieves information for all projects in specific Campaign. The result set, however, is limited to a maximum of 10 results for every request. If there are more results available, the response will return two extra elements  and . Note that these two elements are not present if there are no more available results. The  element indicates whether there are more results available and the  element indicates the next project id to include in the query string to retrieve the next set of results.

The result set, however, is limited to a maximum of 10 results for every request. If there are more results available, the response will return two extra elements  and . Note that these two elements are not present if there are no more available results. The  element indicates whether there are more results available and the  element indicates the next project id to include in the query string to retrieve the next set of results.

The  element indicates whether there are more results available and the  element indicates the next project id to include in the query string to retrieve the next set of results.

Actions.Name: Get all projects summary

If there are more results available, the response will return two extra elements  and . Note that these two elements are not present if there are no more available results. The  element indicates whether there are more results available and the  element indicates the next project id to include in the query string to retrieve the next set of results.

Actions.Name: Get all projects for a theme
Actions.Description: This action retrieves information for all projects in a specific theme. The result set, however, is limited to a maximum of 10 results for every request. If there are more results available, the response will return two extra elements  and . Note that these two elements are not present if there are no more available results. The  element indicates whether there are more results available and the  element indicates the next project id to include in the query string to retrieve the next set of results.

Actions.Name: Get all projects for a theme summary

Actions.Name: Getting all breached sites in the system
Actions.Description: A breach is an instance of a system having been compromised by an attacker and the data disclosed. For example, Adobe was a breach, Gawker was a breach etc. It is possible to return the details of each of breach in the system.

Actions.Name: Getting all breaches for an account
Actions.Description: The most common use of the API is to return a list of all breaches a particular account has been involved in. The API takes a single parameter which is the account to be searched for. The account is not case sensitive and will be trimmed of leading or trailing white spaces.

Actions.Name: Getting a single breached site
Actions.Description: Sometimes just a single breach is required and this can be retrieved by the breach name. This is the stable value which may or may not be the same as the breach title (which can change).

Actions.Name: Getting all data classes in the system
Actions.Description: A "data class" is an attribute of a record compromised in a breach. For example, many breaches expose data classes such as "Email addresses" and "Passwords". The values returned by this service are ordered alphabetically in a string array and will expand over time as new breaches expose previously unseen classes of data.

Actions.Name: Getting all pastes for an account
Actions.Description: This action takes a single parameter which is the email address to be searched for. The email is not case sensitive and will be trimmed of leading or trailing white spaces.

Actions.Name: Update a ticket
Actions.Description: Perform a partial update of a ticket identified by {ticketId}. {ticketId} refers to the internal object ID by default, or optionally any unique property value as specified by the idProperty query param. Provided property values will be overwritten. Read-only and non-existent properties will be ignored. Properties values can be cleared by passing an empty string.

Actions.Name: Delete a form (Preview)
Actions.Description: Archive a form definition. New submissions will not be accepted and the form definition will be permanently deleted after 3 months.

Actions.Name: Create a form (Preview)
Actions.Description: Add a new HubSpot form.

Actions.Name: List Forms (Preview)
Actions.Description: Returns a list of forms based on the search filters. By default, it returns the first 20 hubspot forms.

Actions.Name: Get a form (Preview)
Actions.Description: Returns a form based on the form ID provided.

Actions.Name: Update a form (Preview)
Actions.Description: Update all fields of a HubSpot form definition.

Actions.Name: Delete a marketing email (V1)
Actions.Description: Archive a marketing email.

Actions.Name: Get campaign data for a particular campaign (V1)
Actions.Description: For a given campaign, return data associated with the campaign.

Actions.Name: Create a marketing email (V1)
Actions.Description: Create a new marketing email.

Actions.Name: Get all marketing emails (V1)
Actions.Description: Get all marketing emails for a HubSpot account.

Actions.Name: Get a marketing email (V1)
Actions.Description: Get the details for a specific marketing email.

Actions.Name: Update a marketing email (V1)
Actions.Description: Update a marketing email.

Actions.Name: Get a marketing event (Preview)
Actions.Description: Returns the details of the Marketing Event with the specified id, if one exists.

Actions.Name: Delete a marketing event (Preview)
Actions.Description: Archives an existing Marketing Event with the specified id, if one exists.

Actions.Name: Create or update a marketing event (Preview)
Actions.Description: Upserts a Marketing Event. If there is an existing Marketing event with the specified id, it will be updated; otherwise a new event will be created.

Actions.Name: Update a task's status to completed using it's ID
Actions.Description: Update a task's status to completed

Actions.Description: Get the content of a file by ID

Actions.Description: Uploads a file to the target folder

Actions.Description: Upload a form submission as a text file

Actions.Description: Get the content of a file by ID

Actions.Name: Create and upload a new file to a target folder
Actions.Description: Uploads a file to the target folder

Actions.Name: Board Added
Actions.Description: Triggers when you get added to a Board

Actions.Name: Assign a task
Actions.Description: Assign a Member to a Task (Task Nodes only)

Actions.Name: Assigned Task
Actions.Description: Triggers when you get assigned a Task

Actions.Name: Get board by id
Actions.Description: Get Board by ID (includes all Nodes of the Board)

Actions.Name: Create a Board
Actions.Description: Create a Board

Actions.Name: Get Board members
Actions.Description: Get Members of the Board

Actions.Name: My Boards
Actions.Description: Get Boards that I am a Member of

Actions.Name: Search for a Board

Actions.Name: Task completed in board
Actions.Description: Watch a specific Board for Completed Tasks

Actions.Name: Get cards in board
Actions.Description: Get all Cards in a Board

Actions.Name: Get child cards or lists
Actions.Description: Get Children of a Board / List / Card

Actions.Name: Get comments
Actions.Description: Get comments from a Board / List / Card

Actions.Name: Complete a task
Actions.Description: Mark a Task as Complete

Actions.Name: Create a comment
Actions.Description: Create a comment

Actions.Name: Card added to board
Actions.Description: Watch a specific Board for new Cards

Actions.Name: Find a task
Actions.Description: Finds a Task assigned to you by its name

Actions.Name: Incomplete a task
Actions.Description: Mark a Task as Incomplete

Actions.Name: Completed Task
Actions.Description: Triggers when you Complete a Task

Actions.Name: Get Card details
Actions.Description: Get a single Node

Actions.Name: Create a card or list
Actions.Description: Create a Node

Actions.Name: Change card or board dates
Actions.Description: Change Start, End or Due dates on a Card / Board

Actions.Name: Find a user
Actions.Description: Search for Users

Actions.Name: My Profile
Actions.Description: Returns logged in User

Actions.Name: Retrieve C2 Attribution information for Domain
Actions.Description: Retrieve C2 Attribution enrichment data for Domain.

Actions.Name: Retrieve Passive DNS information for domain
Actions.Description: Retrieve Passive DNS enrichment data for domain.

Actions.Name: Retrieve Current WHOIS information for domain
Actions.Description: Retrieve Current WHOIS enrichment data for domain.

Actions.Name: Retrieve Historic WHOIS information for domain
Actions.Description: Retrieve Historic WHOIS enrichment data for domain.

Actions.Name: Retrieve C2 Attribution information for Email address
Actions.Description: Retrieve C2 Attribution enrichment data for Email address.

Actions.Name: Retrieve Dynamic DNS information for email address
Actions.Description: Retrieve Dynamic DNS enrichment data for email address.

Actions.Name: Retrieve Historic WHOIS information for email address
Actions.Description: Retrieve Historic WHOIS enrichment data for email address.

Actions.Name: Retrieve C2 Attribution information for IP address
Actions.Description: Retrieve C2 Attribution enrichment data for IP address.

Actions.Name: Retrieve Dynamic DNS information for IP address
Actions.Description: Retrieve Dynamic DNS enrichment data for IP address.

Actions.Description: Retrieve Passive DNS enrichment data for IP address.

Actions.Name: Retrieve Device Geo information for IPv4 address
Actions.Description: Retrieve Device Geo enrichment data for IPv4 address.

Actions.Name: Retrieve Device Geo information for IPv6 address
Actions.Description: Retrieve Device Geo enrichment data for IPv6 address.

Actions.Name: Retrieve Passive Hash information for IP address
Actions.Description: Retrieve Passive Hash enrichment data for IP address.

Actions.Name: Retrieve Historic WHOIS information for phone number
Actions.Description: Retrieve Historic WHOIS enrichment data for phone number.

Actions.Name: Retrieve C2 Attribution information for SHA256
Actions.Description: Retrieve C2 Attribution enrichment data for SHA256.

Actions.Name: Retrieve Sinkhole information for IP address
Actions.Description: Retrieve Sinkhole enrichment data for IP address.

Actions.Name: Retrieve SSL certificate information for IP address
Actions.Description: Retrieve SSL certificate enrichment data for IP address.

Actions.Name: Add assembly search folder
Actions.Description: Adds a folder path (on the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running) to the list of folders for the IA-Connect Agent to scan when it tries to load an external reference.

Actions.Name: Clear assembly search folders
Actions.Description: Reset the additional list of folders for the IA-Connect Agent to scan when it tries to load an external reference.

Actions.Name: Create JSON from input variables
Actions.Description: Takes an array of input variables and returns in JSON format and optionally as a JSON table.

Actions.Name: Delete columns from a JSON table
Actions.Description: Takes an input table in JSON format, deletes a column or columns and returns a new table in JSON format. If you want to delete columns from a actual table (i.e. not in JSON format), use the action 'Delete columns from a table'.

Actions.Name: Delete columns from a table
Actions.Description: Takes an input table, deletes a column or columns and returns a new table. If you want to delete columns from a table in JSON format, use the action 'Delete columns from a JSON table'.

Actions.Name: Delete items from a string array
Actions.Description: Takes an input array of string items, deletes an item or items at a specified position and returns a new array. If you want to delete a row or rows from a table, use the action 'Delete a row from a table'. If you want to delete a row or rows from a table in JSON format, use the action 'Delete a row from a JSON table'.

Actions.Name: Delete rows from a JSON table
Actions.Description: Takes an input table in JSON format, deletes a row or rows at a specified position and returns a new table in JSON format. If you want to delete a row or rows from an actual table (i.e. not in JSON format), use the action 'Delete a row from a table'. If you want to delete a row or rows from a string array, use the action 'Delete a row from a string array'.

Actions.Name: Delete rows from a table
Actions.Description: Takes an input table, deletes a row or rows at a specified position and returns a new table. If you want to delete a row or rows from a string array, use the action 'Delete a row from a string array'. If you want to delete a row or rows from a table in JSON format, use the action 'Delete a row from a JSON table'.

Actions.Name: Filter JSON table
Actions.Description: Takes an input JSON table, filters the table (using .NET DataView rowfilter syntax) and returns a new JSON table. If you want to filter an actual table (i.e. not in JSON format), use the action 'Filter table'. If you want to filter a string array, use the action 'Filter string array'.

Actions.Name: Filter string array
Actions.Description: Takes an input array of string items, filters the array (using .NET DataView rowfilter syntax) and returns a new array. If you want to filter a table, use the action 'Filter table'. If you want to filter a table in JSON format, use the action 'Filter JSON table'.

Actions.Name: Filter table
Actions.Description: Takes an input table, filters the table (using .NET DataView rowfilter syntax) and returns a new table. If you want to filter a table in JSON format, use the action 'Filter JSON table'. If you want to filter a string array, use the action 'Filter string array'.

Actions.Name: Get IA-Connect lookup table summary
Actions.Description: Retrieves a summary of the lookup tables currently loaded into the IA-Connect Agent.

Actions.Name: Get JSON table from string array
Actions.Description: Takes an input array of string items and returns as a JSON table.

Actions.Name: Get regular expression group matches
Actions.Description: Performs a regular expression (regex) match on an input string and returns a list of matched group names and values.

Actions.Name: Get regular expression match
Actions.Description: Performs a regular expression (regex) match on an input string and returns whether the string matched the expression and details of the match.

Actions.Name: Get regular expression matches
Actions.Description: Performs a regular expression (regex) match on an input string and returns all matches in a string array. The array will be empty if there were no matches.

Actions.Name: Split string using a regular expression
Actions.Description: Splits an input string using a regular expression (regex) match and returns the individual split components of the string as a string array.

Actions.Name: Get string array from JSON table column
Actions.Description: Takes an input table in JSON format and returns a specified column as a string array. If you want to get a string array from an actual table (i.e. not in JSON format), use the action 'Get array from table'.

Actions.Name: Get string array from table column
Actions.Description: Takes an input table and returns a specified column as a string array. If you want to get a string array from a table in JSON format, use the action 'Get array from JSON table'.

Actions.Name: Get string between
Actions.Description: Takes an input string and returns the first instance of a string that is located between two specified strings or between a string and the end of the line.

Actions.Name: Get string from JSON table cell
Actions.Description: Takes an input table in JSON format and returns a specified cell as a string.

Actions.Name: Get table from JSON
Actions.Description: Takes an input table in JSON format and returns as a table. This is known as deserialization.

Actions.Name: Get table from string array
Actions.Description: Takes an input array of string items and returns as a table.

Actions.Name: Import assembly from local file
Actions.Description: Uploads a DotNet assembly from the computer where the IA-Connect Director is running to the IA-Connect Agent where it is loaded into memory and will be used if referenced by dynamic DotNet code.

Actions.Name: Insert a row into a JSON table
Actions.Description: Takes an input table in JSON format, inserts a row at a specified position and returns a new table in JSON format. If you want to insert a row into an actual table (i.e. not in JSON format), use the action 'Insert a row into a table'. If you want to insert a string into a string array, use the action 'Insert a row into a string array'.

Actions.Name: Insert a row of input variables into a JSON table
Actions.Description: Takes an input table in JSON format, inserts a row created from input variables at a specified position and returns a new table in JSON format. The input row schema should match that of the input table (i.e. Use the same property names and data types). If you want to insert a row into an actual table (i.e. not in JSON format), use the action 'Insert a row into a table'. If you want to insert a string into a string array, use the action 'Insert a row into a string array'.

Actions.Name: Insert a row into a string array
Actions.Description: Takes an input array of string items, inserts a row at a specified position and returns a new array. If you want to insert a row into a table, use the action 'Insert a row into a table'. If you want to insert a row into a table in JSON format, use the action 'Insert a row into a JSON table'.

Actions.Name: Insert a row into a table
Actions.Description: Takes an input table, inserts a row at a specified position and returns a new table. If you want to insert a string into a string array, use the action 'Insert a row into a string array'. If you want to insert a row into a table in JSON format, use the action 'Insert a row into a JSON table'.

Actions.Name: Is PowerShell automation installed
Actions.Description: Reports whether PowerShell automation is available on the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running. If PowerShell automation is not available, PowerShell automation actions will not work.

Actions.Name: Is PowerShell module installed
Actions.Description: Searches for a specified PowerShell module on the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running and returns whether it is installed.

Actions.Name: Load IA-Connect lookup table
Actions.Description: Loads an IA-Connect lookup table from the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running. These lookup tables can be used by further IA-Connect actions to perform data lookups.

Actions.Name: Lookup columns from IA-Connect lookup table
Actions.Description: Retrieves one or more columns with a common name from a lookup table currently loaded into the IA-Connect Agent and returns as a table. For example, the lookup table could contain multiple output columns named 'AD group' to represent multiple AD groups and they will be returned as separate rows in the output table.

Actions.Name: Lookup value from IA-Connect lookup table
Actions.Description: Retrieves a value from a lookup table currently loaded into the IA-Connect Agent.

Actions.Name: Remove all IA-Connect lookup tables
Actions.Description: Removes all lookup tables currently loaded into the IA-Connect Agent.

Actions.Name: Remove IA-Connect lookup table
Actions.Description: Removes a lookup table currently loaded into the IA-Connect Agent.

Actions.Name: Rename a column in a JSON table
Actions.Description: Takes an input table in JSON format, renames a specified column and returns a new table in JSON format. If you want to rename a column from an actual table (i.e. not in JSON format), use the action 'Rename a column in a table'.

Actions.Name: Rename a column in a table
Actions.Description: Takes an input table, renames a specified column and returns a new table. If you want to rename a column from a table in JSON format, use the action 'Rename a column in a JSON table'.

Actions.Name: Run PowerShell script
Actions.Description: Runs a PowerShell script in the session where the IA-Connect Agent is running, where the script contents are passed to the IA-Connect Agent as part of the command. This is the recommended action for running your own custom PowerShell code.

Actions.Name: Sort JSON table
Actions.Description: Takes an input JSON table, sorts the table and returns a new JSON table. If you want to sort an actual table (i.e. not in JSON format), use the action 'Sort table'. If you want to sort a string array, use the action 'Sort string array'.

Actions.Name: Sort string array
Actions.Description: Takes an input array of string items, sorts the array and returns a new array. If you want to sort a table, use the action 'Sort table'. If you want to sort a table in JSON format, use the action 'Sort JSON table'.

Actions.Name: Sort table
Actions.Description: Takes an input table, sorts one or more rows and returns a new table. If you want to sort a table in JSON format, use the action 'Sort JSON table'. If you want to sort a string array, use the action 'Sort string array'.

Actions.Name: Check Java element
Actions.Description: Sets the state of an element (typically a checkbox or radio box) to either checked or unchecked.

Actions.Name: Connect to Java Access Bridge
Actions.Description: Starts the IA-Connect Java subsystem (IA-JavaAccessBridge) and connects it to the specified Java Access Bridge DLL (or leave blank to search for one). This step must be performed before you can automate Java applications. This action also enables the Java Access Bridge which must be enabled before running any Java applications.

Actions.Name: Create handle for Java element at screen coordinate
Actions.Description: Creates a handle to a Java element by providing the screen coordinates. If a Java element exists at the specified coordinate, the action will identify the element and return a handle to it.

Actions.Name: Disconnect from Java Access Bridge
Actions.Description: Shuts down any running IA-Connect Java subsystem (IA-JavaAccessBridge).

Actions.Name: Does Java desktop element exist
Actions.Description: Reports whether a Java desktop element exists and provides some basic element properties.

Actions.Name: Does Java element exist
Actions.Description: Reports whether a Java element exists and returns some basic element properties.

Actions.Name: Draw rectangle around Java element
Actions.Description: Draws a rectangle around the perimeter of a Java element to aid in identifying that the element found is the one required. The rectangle is automatically removed after 5 seconds.

Actions.Name: Expand Java selection element
Actions.Description: Expands or collapses a Java element (typically a menu / dropdown item). If the item is already expanded, nothing will happen.

Actions.Name: Focus Java element
Actions.Description: Focusses a Java element which makes it the active element for keyboard focus and, depending on the application, may bring the element window to the foreground.

Actions.Name: Reset all Java element handles
Actions.Description: Resets all Java element handles currently stored by IA-Connect which can be useful if you have been identifying a lot of elements and have a large number of element handles stored. In scenarios with extremely high numbers of element handles (100,000+) this action can also be used to free up RAM usage.

Actions.Name: Get actions for Java element
Actions.Description: Returns the accessible actions for a Java element. These accessible actions can then be performed on the element by using the action name as an input to the action 'Perform action on Java element', for example 'click' or 'select-all'.

Actions.Name: Get all Java child element properties
Actions.Description: Returns all properties of all Java child elements. This can be useful if you are uncertain which field holds the property values required.

Actions.Name: Get Java child element properties
Actions.Description: Returns all properties of a specific Java child element, specified by index. This can be useful if you are uncertain which field holds the property values required.

Actions.Name: Get windows access bridge connection status
Actions.Description: Returns the current status of the connection between IA-Connect Agent and the Windows Access Bridge (WAB). If IA-Connect Agent is connected to the WAB then the relevant details are returned as outputs.

Actions.Name: Get Java desktop elements
Actions.Description: Returns a list of Java application windows and dialogs on the desktop. You must first connect to the Java Access Bridge.

Actions.Name: Get Java element properties as list
Actions.Description: Returns the properties of a Java element as a single line list (single line collection / data table) instead of individual items, this maybe useful depending on how you intend to use the data.

Actions.Name: Get Java element text value
Actions.Description: Returns the text value of a Java element. A text value is usually associated with a text element, but many elements can have this property.

Actions.Name: Get Java element value
Actions.Description: Returns the value of an element. A value is usually associated with a text input area, but many elements can have this property.

Actions.Name: Get Java element properties
Actions.Description: Returns all Java properties of a Java element. This can be useful if you are uncertain which field holds the property values required.

Actions.Name: Get multiple Java parent element properties
Actions.Description: Returns the properties of all parent elements of a Java element. This action will search the entire height of the element tree returning all parent properties if the 'Max parents to process' parameter is set high enough.

Actions.Name: Get Java parent element properties
Actions.Description: Returns the properties of the parent element of a Java element. This action will only return the properties of the direct parent element and will not search the entire height of the element tree.

Actions.Name: Get Java role CSV from element handle
Actions.Description: Returns the tree of element roles below the specified element handle as CSV. This action would only be used for development purposes and provides an overview of the elements of the application which can be useful for visualising the application structure and optimising element searches.

Actions.Name: Get Java role CSV from element search
Actions.Description: Performs a Java element search and outputs the details of the elements searched (up to the point where the element was found) as CSV. This action would only be used for development purposes and provides an overview of the elements of the application which can be useful for visualising the application structure and optimising element searches.

Actions.Name: Get Java selection element items
Actions.Description: Returns all child selection element items found under the specified Java selection element. You can choose to retrieve the selection element options either by looping through the selection, selecting each individual option in the list OR by reading the labels of the child elements of the selection. If you choose to retrieve the selection element options by reading the labels of the child elements of the selection, you will likely need to expand the selection first by providing the 'Expand first' parameter as 'True' and you can then optionally close the selection afterwards by also providing the 'Collapse after' parameter as 'True'.

Actions.Name: Get Java selection state by index
Actions.Description: Returns the selection state of a child element in a selection (typically an item in a list or drop-down) by providing the child element index. You can retrieve all selection child element items to check their index by using the action 'Get Java selection element items'.

Actions.Name: Get Java selection state by name
Actions.Description: Returns the selection state of a child element in a selection (typically an item in a list or drop-down) by providing the child element name. You can retrieve all selection child element items to check their name by using the action 'Get Java selection element items'.

Actions.Name: Get Java table cell at screen coordinate
Actions.Description: If a Java table cell that is a child element of the table exists at the specified coordinates, this action will identify the element, its properties and will optionally return a handle to the table cell element.

Actions.Name: Get Java table cell properties
Actions.Description: Returns the properties and contents of a specified cell within a Java table element. This is an element with rows, columns, a header and cells (i.e. a table). You can optionally specify whether to determine which if the cell is currently visible on screen and it's coordinates by enumerating the viewport.  The viewport element typically contains the table (e.g. it is a parent element of the table) and represents the visible area of the table.

Actions.Name: Get Java table contents
Actions.Description: Returns the contents of a Java table element. This is an element with rows, columns, a header and cells (i.e. a table).

Actions.Name: Get Java table properties
Actions.Description: Returns the properties of a Java table element. This is an element with rows, columns, a header and cells (i.e. a table). You can optionally specify whether to determine which components of the table are currently visible on screen by enumerating the viewport.  The viewport element typically contains the table (e.g. it is a parent element of the table) and represents the visible area of the table.

Actions.Name: Get Java properties for UIA element
Actions.Description: Returns all Java properties of a UIA element. This can be useful if you are uncertain which field holds the property values required.

Actions.Name: Get visible bounding rectangle of Java element
Actions.Description: Retrieves the visible bounds of a Java element. Typically, the Java Access Bridge will return the virtual positional values of an element, regardless of whether the element is visible on screen and these virtual values are provided by the 'Get Java element properties' action. With larger elements (e.g. a table element which can scroll) as these may not always be visible on screen, this action returns the coordinates of the currently visible area of the element.

Actions.Name: Get windows access bridge info
Actions.Description: Returns information about the Windows Access Bridge (WAB) for a particular Java VM ID, including the Java and Windows DLL versions. The Java VM ID can be obtained as an output from the 'Get Java element properties' action.

Actions.Name: Global double left mouse click on Java element
Actions.Description: Moves the mouse to the centre of a Java element and double clicks the left mouse button.

Actions.Name: Global input password into Java element
Actions.Description: Moves the mouse to centre of the Java element, focusses it, left clicks, and presses keys. Typically used with a password input that will not accept native UIA input methods.

Actions.Name: Global input text into Java element
Actions.Description: Moves the mouse to centre of the Java element, focusses it, left clicks, and presses keys. Typically used with a text input that will not accept native UIA input methods.

Actions.Name: Global left mouse click on Java element
Actions.Description: Moves the mouse to the centre of a Java element and clicks the left mouse button.

Actions.Name: Global middle mouse click on Java element
Actions.Description: Moves the mouse to the centre of a Java element and clicks the middle mouse button.

Actions.Name: Global mouse click on Java table cell
Actions.Description: Moves the mouse to the centre of a Java table cell and clicks the specified mouse button.

Actions.Name: Global right mouse click on Java element
Actions.Description: Moves the mouse to the centre of a Java element and clicks the right mouse button.

Actions.Name: Input password into Java element
Actions.Description: Inputs a password into a Java element (typically a password entry field), replacing the existing text.

Actions.Name: Input text into Java element
Actions.Description: Inputs text into a Java element (typically a text entry field), either replacing the existing text or inserting the new value at a specific position.

Actions.Name: Are Java element handles the same
Actions.Description: Compares two Java element handles for Java elements to see if they represent the same Java object. This can be useful if you have identified an element and retrieved a handle to its parent.

Actions.Name: Is Java window
Actions.Description: Returns whether a UIA window is a Java element.

Actions.Name: Is Java table cell visible onscreen
Actions.Description: Returns whether a specific table cell within a Java table element is currently visible onscreen.

Actions.Name: Perform action on Java element
Actions.Description: Performs an accessible action for a Java element. These accessible actions for a specific element can be queried by using the 'Get actions for Java element' action. Some common actions are 'click' for a button or 'select-all' for a text element.

Actions.Name: Press Java element
Actions.Description: Presses a Java element (typically a button).

Actions.Name: Select Java list element by index
Actions.Description: Selects the list element that matches the specified index. This is typically used to select an item in a dropdown / menu item.

Actions.Name: Select Java list element by name
Actions.Description: Selects the list element with the specified name. This is typically used to select an item in a dropdown / menu item.

Actions.Name: Wait for Java desktop element
Actions.Description: Waits for a Java desktop element (typically a window) to exist.

Actions.Name: Wait for Java desktop element to not exist
Actions.Description: Waits for a Java desktop element (typically a window) to no longer exist.

Actions.Name: Wait for Java element
Actions.Description: Waits for a Java element (typically an individual element within a window such as a button or a text input area) to exist.

Actions.Name: Wait for Java element to not exist
Actions.Description: Waits for a Java element (typically an individual element within a window such as a button or a text input area) to no longer exist.

Actions.Name: Set Azure AD user's manager
Actions.Description: Set an Azure Active Directory user's mananger.

Actions.Name: Add Active Directory group member
Actions.Description: Add an Active Directory user to an existing Active Directory group where the user and group are specified by identity.

Actions.Name: Add Active Directory user
Actions.Description: Creates a new Active Directory user account.

Actions.Name: Add Active Directory user to multiple groups by name
Actions.Description: Add an Active Directory user to multiple existing Active Directory groups where the groups are specified by name. IA-Connect adds the user to as many groups as possible and reports on the outcome.

Actions.Name: Check Active Directory OU exists
Actions.Description: Reports if an Active Directory Organizational Unit (OU) exists.

Actions.Name: Clear Active Directory user account expiration
Actions.Description: Clears the expiration date for an Active Directory account.

Actions.Name: Clone Active Directory user group membership
Actions.Description: Adds the destination Active Directory user to the same Active Directory groups that the first user is a member of, minus the primary group (usually 'Domain users') since it technically isn't a membership.

Actions.Name: Clone Active Directory user properties
Actions.Description: Configures the specified properties / attributes of the source Active Directory user to the destination Active Directory user.

Actions.Name: Perform Active Directory DirSync
Actions.Description: Performs a synchronisation between Active Directory (on-premises) and Azure Active Directory (cloud). This command must be issued to the server with the 'DirSync' role (i.e. the computer performing the synchronisation).

Actions.Name: Disable Active Directory user account
Actions.Description: Disables an Active Directory user account. If a user account is disabled, the user cannot logon.

Actions.Name: Enable Active Directory user account
Actions.Description: Enables an Active Directory user account. If the account is not disabled, this command does nothing.

Actions.Name: Get Active Directory group
Actions.Description: Returns the properties of a specified Active Directory group.

Actions.Name: Get Active Directory user
Actions.Description: Returns the properties of a specified Active Directory user.

Actions.Name: Get Active Directory user group membership
Actions.Description: Returns a list of Active Directory groups the specified user is a member of, minus the primary group (usually 'Domain users') since it technically isn't a membership.

Actions.Name: Get Active Directory domain FQDN from DN
Actions.Description: A utility function. Given an Active Directory user's Distinguished Name (DN), returns the Active Directory domain containing the user.

Actions.Name: Get Active Directory domain info
Actions.Description: Retrieves information about an Active Directory domain.

Actions.Name: Get Active Directory OU from user DN
Actions.Description: A utility function. Given an Active Directory user's Distinguished Name (DN), returns the Organizational Unit (OU) the user is located within.

Actions.Name: Modify Active Directory user boolean property
Actions.Description: Modify an individual boolean (true / false) property of an Active Directory user. This allows you to modify a very specific user setting, including custom properties.

Actions.Name: Modify Active Directory common user properties
Actions.Description: Modify common properties of an Active Directory user. You can only assign values to properties, not set them to blank. To set properties to blank, use the action 'Modify Active Directory user string properties'.

Actions.Name: Modify Active Directory user string properties
Actions.Description: Modify individual string property(s) of an Active Directory user. This allows you to modify very specific user settings, including custom properties. You can also set individual user properties to blank.

Actions.Name: Move Active Directory user to OU
Actions.Description: Moves an Active Directory user to an existing Active Directory Organizational Unit (OU).

Actions.Name: Remove Active Directory group member
Actions.Description: Removes an Active Directory user from an Active Directory group where the group is specified by identity.

Actions.Name: Remove Active Directory user
Actions.Description: Removes a user from Active Directory.

Actions.Name: Remove Active Directory user from all groups
Actions.Description: Removes an Active Directory user from all of the Active Directory groups they are a member of. IA-Connect removes the user from as many groups as possible and reports on the outcome.

Actions.Name: Remove Active Directory user from multiple groups by name
Actions.Description: Removes an Active Directory user from multiple existing Active Directory groups where the groups are specified by name. IA-Connect removes the user from as many groups as possible and reports on the outcome.

Actions.Name: Reset Active Directory user password
Actions.Description: Resets an Active Directory user's password with a new password.

Actions.Name: Set Active Directory server
Actions.Description: Sets a specific Active Directory server to use for all further Active Directory actions.

Actions.Name: Modify Active Directory user home folder
Actions.Description: Sets the home folder / directory / drive for an Active Directory user.

Actions.Name: Set Active Directory user protected from accidental deletion
Actions.Description: Sets an Active Directory account to be protected (or not protected) from accidental deletion. If you protect an account from accidental deletion, you cannot delete that account until you remove the protection.

Actions.Name: Unlock Active Directory account
Actions.Description: Unlock an Active Directory account. If the account is not locked, this command does nothing.

Actions.Name: Add Azure AD user to group
Actions.Description: Add an Azure Active Directory user (or other object) to an existing Azure Active Directory group.

Actions.Name: Get Azure AD license SKUs
Actions.Description: Returns a list of Azure Active Directory license Stock Keeping Units (SKUs) which the connected Azure AD is subscribed to, using the Azure AD v2 PowerShell modules.

Actions.Name: Get Azure AD user group membership
Actions.Description: Returns a list of Azure Active Directory groups the specified user is a member of, using the Azure AD v2 PowerShell modules.

Actions.Name: Get Azure AD user licenses
Actions.Description: Retrieves a list of licenses (SKU) assigned to a Azure AD user, using the Azure AD v2 PowerShell modules.

Actions.Name: Get Azure AD user license service plans
Actions.Description: Retrieves a list of licenses plans assigned to a specified Azure AD user license (SKU), using the Azure AD v2 PowerShell modules. For example: If the user has the FLOW_FREE license assigned, this will allow you to view which service plans they have provisioned to that license.

Actions.Name: Get Azure AD users
Actions.Description: Returns the details of users in Azure Active Directory (known as Azure AD or AAD), using the Azure AD v2 PowerShell modules. You can search by object Id or using a filter. An object Id search should return 0 or 1 results. A filter search could return 0 or more results.

Actions.Name: Is user in Azure AD user group
Actions.Description: Returns whether a user is a member of an Azure Active Directory group, using the Azure AD v2 PowerShell modules.

Actions.Name: Remove all Azure AD user licenses
Actions.Description: Removes all Azure AD user license (SKU) assigned to a user, using the Azure AD v2 PowerShell modules.

Actions.Name: Remove Azure AD user from all groups
Actions.Description: Removes an Azure Active Directory user (or other object) from all of the Azure Active Directory groups they are a member of.

Actions.Name: Remove Azure AD user from group
Actions.Description: Removes an Azure Active Directory user (or other object) from an Azure Active Directory group.

Actions.Name: Modify Azure AD user properties
Actions.Description: Modify common properties of an Azure Active Directory user. You can only assign values to properties, not set them to blank.

Actions.Name: Set Azure AD user license
Actions.Description: Adds or removes an Azure AD user license (SKU), using the Azure AD v2 PowerShell modules.

Actions.Name: Disconnect from Active Directory
Actions.Description: If you have used the action 'Open Active Directory PowerShell runspace with credentials' to run Active Directory PowerShell commands as an alternative user account or to an alternative domain, this action returns the IA-Connect Agent to the default behaviour of running Active Directory actions as the user account the IA-Connect Agent is running as.

Actions.Name: Disconnect from Azure AD
Actions.Description: Disconnects IA-Connect from Azure using the Azure AD v2 PowerShell modules (connected using one of the 'Connect to Azure AD' actions). You will not be able to issue Azure AD v2 actions again until you reconnect.

Actions.Name: Disconnect from Microsoft Exchange
Actions.Description: Disconnects IA-Connect from a Microsoft Exchange server (connected using the action 'Connect to Microsoft Exchange'). You will not be able to issue Microsoft Exchange PowerShell actions again until you reconnect.

Actions.Name: Disconnect from Office 365
Actions.Description: Disconnects IA-Connect from Office 365 using the Office 365 PowerShell modules (connected using the action 'Connect to Office 365'). You will not be able to issue Office 365 PowerShell actions again until you reconnect.

Actions.Name: Add Microsoft Exchange mailbox permission
Actions.Description: Assign mailbox permissions to an Active Directory object (e.g. user or group).

Actions.Name: Add Microsoft Exchange member to distribution group
Actions.Description: Add a member (for example a user) to an Exchange distribution group. If the member is already in the group, no action is taken.

Actions.Name: Add Microsoft Exchange mailbox permission to user
Actions.Description: Assign mailbox permissions to a specifed mailbox user, user or security group.

Actions.Name: Disable the Microsoft Exchange mailbox for a user
Actions.Description: Disable an existing Microsoft Exchange mailbox.

Actions.Name: Disable the Microsoft Exchange Online mailbox for a user
Actions.Description: Disable an existing Microsoft Exchange Online or Office 365 (remote) mailbox. The request is sent via your on-premises Microsoft Exchange server.

Actions.Name: Does Microsoft Exchange mailbox exist
Actions.Description: Returns whether the specified Exchange mailbox exists.

Actions.Name: Does Microsoft Exchange Online mailbox exist
Actions.Description: Returns whether the specified Microsoft Exchange Online or Office 365 (remote) mailbox exists. The request is sent via your on-premises Microsoft Exchange server.

Actions.Name: Create a Microsoft Exchange mailbox for a user
Actions.Description: Creates a Microsoft Exchange mailbox for an existing user who doesn't already have a mailbox.

Actions.Name: Create Microsoft Exchange Online mailbox for a user
Actions.Description: Creates a Microsoft Exchange Online or Office 365 (remote) mailbox for an existing user in on-premises Active Directory who doesn't already have a mailbox. The request is sent via your on-premises Microsoft Exchange server.

Actions.Name: Retrieve Microsoft Exchange distribution group details
Actions.Description: Retrieve the details of a Microsoft Exchange Distribution group. You can search by Identity or using a filter. An Identity search should return 0 or 1 results. A filter search could return 0 or more results.

Actions.Name: Get Microsoft Exchange distribution group members
Actions.Description: Retrieve a list of the members of a Microsoft Exchange Distribution group.

Actions.Name: Retrieve Microsoft Exchange mailbox details
Actions.Description: Returns the properties of the specified Exchange mailbox. You can search by Identity or using a filter. An Identity search should return 0 or 1 results. A filter search could return 0 or more results.

Actions.Name: Retrieve Microsoft Exchange mailbox distribution group membership
Actions.Description: Retrieve which distribution groups a mailbox is a member of.

Actions.Name: Retrieve a Microsoft Exchange mailbox email addresses
Actions.Description: Retrieves a list of all email addresses assigned to a Microsoft Exchange mailbox. This includes the primary SMTP address, proxy email addresses, X.400 addresses and EUM (Exchange Unified Messaging) addresses.

Actions.Name: Retrieve Microsoft Exchange Online mailbox details
Actions.Description: Returns the properties of the specified Microsoft Exchange Online or Office 365 (remote) mailbox. The request is sent via your on-premises Microsoft Exchange server. You can search by Identity or using a filter. An Identity search should return 0 or 1 results. A filter search could return 0 or more results.

Actions.Name: Retrieve a Microsoft Exchange Online mailbox email addresses
Actions.Description: Retrieves a list of all email addresses assigned to an existing Microsoft Exchange Online or Office 365 (remote) mailbox. This includes the primary SMTP address, proxy email addresses, X.400 addresses and EUM (Exchange Unified Messaging) addresses.

Actions.Name: Create a new Microsoft Exchange distribution group
Actions.Description: Creates a new Microsoft Exchange distribution group or mail-enabled security group.

Actions.Name: Create Microsoft Exchange Online mailbox and user account
Actions.Description: Create a mail-enabled user in on-premises Active Directory and create an associated remote mailbox in Microsoft Exchange Online or Office 365. Only use this action if the user doesn't exist in on-premises Active Directory. If the user already exists, use the action 'Create Microsoft Exchange Online mailbox for a user'. The request is sent via your on-premises Microsoft Exchange server.

Actions.Name: Remove Microsoft Exchange distribution group
Actions.Description: Remove a Microsoft Exchange distribution group.

Actions.Name: Remove Microsoft Exchange member from distribution group
Actions.Description: Remove a member (for example a user) from an Exchange distribution group. If the member is not in the group, no action is taken.

Actions.Name: Remove Microsoft Exchange mailbox permission from user
Actions.Description: Remove mailbox permissions from a specifed mailbox user, user or security group.

Actions.Name: Reset the properties on a Microsoft Exchange mailbox
Actions.Description: Set the specified properties of an existing Microsoft Exchange mailbox to blank.

Actions.Name: Reset the properties on a Microsoft Exchange Online mailbox
Actions.Description: Set the specified properties of an existing Microsoft Exchange Online or Office 365 (remote) mailbox to blank.

Actions.Name: Set Exchange to view entire Active Directory forest
Actions.Description: Specify whether the entire Active Directory forest (including sub-domains) is searched / viewed when performing Exchange actions. You may need to use this action if you have multiple linked domains.

Actions.Name: Set the properties on a Microsoft Exchange mailbox
Actions.Description: Set the properties of an existing Microsoft Exchange mailbox.

Actions.Name: Modify a Microsoft Exchange mailbox email addresses
Actions.Description: Modify the email addresses on a Microsoft Exchange mailbox. You can add, remove and replace primary and alias email addresses.

Actions.Name: Set Exchange mailbox send on behalf of
Actions.Description: Specify who can send on behalf of this existing mailbox.

Actions.Name: Set the properties on a Microsoft Exchange Online mailbox
Actions.Description: Set the properties of an existing Microsoft Exchange Online or Office 365 (remote) mailbox. The request is sent via your on-premises Microsoft Exchange server.

Actions.Name: Modify a Microsoft Exchange Online mailbox email addresses
Actions.Description: Modify the email addresses on an an existing Microsoft Exchange Online or Office 365 (remote) mailbox. You can add, remove and replace primary and alias email addresses.

Actions.Name: Is connected to Active Directory
Actions.Description: Reports if IA-Connect is connected to Active Directory. By default, IA-Connect is automatically connected to the Domain the computer running the IA-Connect Agent is a member of, using the account the IA-Connect Agent is running as. Use the action 'Connect to Active Directory with credentials' to connect using alternative credentials or to an alternative domain.

Actions.Name: Is Azure AD v2 PowerShell module installed
Actions.Description: Reports if the PowerShell modules required for Azure AD v2 are installed on the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running.

Actions.Name: Is connected to Azure AD
Actions.Description: Reports if IA-Connect is connected to Azure using the Azure AD v2 PowerShell modules. Use one of the 'Connect to Azure AD' actions to connect.

Actions.Name: Is connected to Microsoft Exchange
Actions.Description: Reports if IA-Connect is connected to a Microsoft Exchange server. Use the action 'Connect to Microsoft Exchange' to connect.

Actions.Name: Is connected to Office 365
Actions.Description: Reports if IA-Connect is connected to Office 365 using the Office 365 PowerShell modules. Use the action 'Connect to Office 365' to connect.

Actions.Name: Get next available account name
Actions.Description: Given details regarding the naming format for Active Directory and Exchange account names, provides the details of the next available spare account name. Used to determine which Active Directory and Exchange account to create for a given user. This action does not create any accounts, it provides information regarding name availability.

Actions.Name: Add Office 365 member to distribution group
Actions.Description: Add a member to a Microsoft Exchange Online or Office 365 distribution group.

Actions.Name: Add Office 365 mailbox permission to user
Actions.Description: Assign mailbox permissions to a specifed mailbox user, user or security group.

Actions.Name: Get Office 365 distribution group
Actions.Description: Returns the properties of the specified Microsoft Exchange Online or Office 365 distribution group.

Actions.Name: Get Office 365 mailbox
Actions.Description: Returns the properties of the specified Microsoft Exchange Online or Office 365 mailbox.

Actions.Name: Create a new Office 365 distribution group
Actions.Description: Creates a new Microsoft Exchange Online or Office 365 distribution group or mail-enabled security group.

Actions.Name: Set the properties on a Office 365 mailbox
Actions.Description: Set the properties on a Microsoft Exchange Online or Office 365 mailbox.

Actions.Name: Wait for a Office 365 mailbox
Actions.Description: Wait for a specified Microsoft Exchange Online or Office 365 mailbox to exist. This is common if you are waiting for an AD sync or license setting to take effect. If the mailbox already existed, the action will immediately return successful.

Actions.Name: Connect to Active Directory with credentials
Actions.Description: Allows you to specify an alternative account to use when running Active Directory PowerShell commands. This affects all Active Directory commands issued after this action. If you don't use this action then all Active Directory PowerShell commands will run as the user account the IA-Connect Agent is running as.

Actions.Name: Connect to Azure AD with credentials
Actions.Description: Connects IA-Connect to Azure AD using the Azure AD v2 PowerShell modules. This action (or 'Connect to Azure AD with certificate') must be issued before running any other Azure AD v2 actions. This action either requires an account which doesn't use MFA (2FA) or you'll need to use the UI automation module to automate the 2FA component (i.e. the one-time password authentication popup). Alternatively, use the action 'Connect to Azure AD with certificate'.

Actions.Name: Connect to Azure AD with certificate
Actions.Description: Connects IA-Connect to Azure AD using the Azure AD v2 PowerShell modules. This action (or 'Connect to Azure AD with credentials') must be issued before running any other Azure AD v2 actions. This action requires an Azure Service Principal and Azure AD app registration with certificate to be setup in Azure AD before it will work, but has the advantage of not requiring MFA (2FA).

Actions.Name: Connect to Microsoft Exchange
Actions.Description: Connects IA-Connect to a Microsoft Exchange server. This action must be issued before running any other Exchange actions. If you specify a username and password, all subsequent Exchange actions will run as that account. If you don't specify a username and password, all subsequent Exchange actions will run as the user account the IA-Connect Agent is running as.

Actions.Name: Connect to default Active Directory domain
Actions.Description: Connects the IA-Connect Agent to the Domain the computer running the IA-Connect Agent is a member of, using the account the IA-Connect Agent is running as (i.e. the default behaviour).

Actions.Name: Connect to Office 365 with credentials
Actions.Description: Connects IA-Connect to Office 365 using the Office 365 PowerShell modules. This action (or 'Connect to Office 365 with certificate') must be issued before running any other Office 365 actions. This action either requires an account which doesn't require MFA (2FA) or you'll need to use the UI automation module to automate the 2FA component (i.e. the one-time password authentication popup). Alternatively, use the action 'Connect to Office 365 with certificate'.

Actions.Name: Connect to Office 365 with certificate
Actions.Description: Connects IA-Connect to Office 365 using the Office 365 PowerShell modules. This action (or 'Connect to Office 365 with credentials') must be issued before running any other Office 365 actions. This action requires an Azure AD app registration with certificate and the correct roles to be setup in Azure AD before it will work, but has the advantage of not requiring MFA (2FA).

Actions.Name: Run Active Directory PowerShell script
Actions.Description: Runs a PowerShell script in the Active Directory runspace in the session where the IA-Connect Agent is running, where the script contents are passed to the IA-Connect Agent as part of the command. This is the recommended action for running your own custom Active Directory PowerShell code.

Actions.Name: Run Azure AD PowerShell script
Actions.Description: Runs a PowerShell script in the Azure AD v2 runspace in the session where the IA-Connect Agent is running, where the script contents are passed to the IA-Connect Agent as part of the command. This is the recommended action for running your own custom Azure AD v2 PowerShell code.

Actions.Name: Run Exchange PowerShell script
Actions.Description: Runs a PowerShell script in the Exchange runspace in the session where the IA-Connect Agent is running, where the script contents are passed to the IA-Connect Agent as part of the command. This is the recommended action for running your own custom Exchange PowerShell code.

Actions.Name: Run Office 365 PowerShell script
Actions.Description: Runs a PowerShell script in the Office 365 runspace in the session where the IA-Connect Agent is running, where the script contents are passed to the IA-Connect Agent as part of the command. Due to Office 365 PowerShell security restrictions, this action is likely to be blocked.

Actions.Name: Connect to terminal emulation session
Actions.Description: Connects any running IA-Connect HLLAPI subsystem (IA-HLLAPI) to the specified connected Mainframe session Id. The session Id is an Id assigned by the terminal emulator you are using for Mainframe connections. The Mainframe session must be running before you connect to it using this action.

Actions.Name: Get terminal emulation Operator Information Area (OIA)
Actions.Description: Returns the Operator Information Area displayed by the terminal emulator. This is the line at the bottom of the terminal emulator screen and commonly indicates status information such as whether the system is waiting or is in an invalid input state.

Actions.Name: Disconnect from terminal emulation session
Actions.Description: Disconnects the running IA-Connect HLLAPI subsystem (IA-HLLAPI) from a specified connected Mainframe session Id. The session Id is an Id assigned by the terminal emulator you are using for Mainframe connections.

Actions.Name: Dispose of terminal emulation HLLAPI DLL
Actions.Description: Shuts down any running IA-Connect HLLAPI subsystem (IA-HLLAPI).

Actions.Name: Get terminal emulation connection status
Actions.Description: Returns the current terminal emulation connection state within the specified session.

Actions.Name: Get terminal emulation cursor position
Actions.Description: Gets the current cursor position in a Mainframe session.

Actions.Name: Get is terminal emulation keyboard unlocked
Actions.Description: Returns whether the terminal emulator is reporting that the keyboard is unlocked. The output of this action is dependent on how the specific emulator has implemented HLLAPI and the output may vary from emulator to emulator.

Actions.Name: Send reset key to terminal emulation session
Actions.Description: Sends a reset key to the terminal emulator session. This will reset all input and will clear an invalid input state.

Actions.Name: Query terminal emulation session status
Actions.Description: Returns information about the connected Mainframe session. Some terminal emulators may not return values for all outputs.

Actions.Name: Read terminal emulation screen at cursor position
Actions.Description: Reads the specified number of characters from the Mainframe session, starting at the specified cursor position.

Actions.Name: Read terminal emulation screen rows
Actions.Description: Reads the screen rows from a specified Mainframe session. This action is commonly used to read larger quantities of data which can then be filtered if necessary.

Actions.Name: Reset terminal emulation session
Actions.Description: Resets the current Mainframe session. The action disconnects IA-Connect Agent from the session and undoes any session parameters that have been set. After calling this action you will need to re-connect to the session by using the 'Connect to Session' action in order to continue interacting with it.

Actions.Name: Search for string in terminal emulation session
Actions.Description: Searches for a specified string in the current display of the terminal emulator. If the string is found, it's position and index will be returned.

Actions.Name: Send password to terminal emulation session
Actions.Description: Sends a password to a Mainframe session at the current cursor position. If you wish to send a password to a specific cursor position, you can use the action 'Send password to terminal emulation session at position' instead.

Actions.Name: Send password to terminal emulation session at position
Actions.Description: Sends a password to a Mainframe session at the specified cursor position.

Actions.Name: Send string to terminal emulation session
Actions.Description: Sends a string to a Mainframe session at the current cursor position. If you wish to send a string to a specific cursor position, you can use the action 'Send string to terminal emulation session at position' instead.

Actions.Name: Send string to terminal emulation session at position
Actions.Description: Sends a string to a Mainframe session at the specified cursor position.

Actions.Name: Set terminal emulation cursor position
Actions.Description: Sets the current cursor position in a Mainframe session to the specified position.

Actions.Name: Set terminal emulation HLLAPI DLL
Actions.Description: Starts the IA-Connect HLLAPI subsystem (IA-HLLAPI) and connects it to the specified Terminal Emulator HLLAPI DLL (a component of the terminal emulation software being used to connect to Mainframe sessions).

Actions.Name: Set session parameter in terminal emulation session
Actions.Description: This action sets an advanced HLLAPI session parameter. This action should only be used if you are familiar with HLLAPI session parameters.

Actions.Name: Wait for terminal emulation keyboard unlocked
Actions.Description: Waits for the terminal emulator to report that the keyboard is unlocked. The output of this action is dependent on how the specific emulator has implemented HLLAPI and the output may vary from emulator to emulator.

Actions.Name: Wait for string in terminal emulation session
Actions.Description: Waits for a specified string to be displayed in the terminal emulator session. This action can be used when moving between screens to validate that you are on the correct screen.

Actions.Name: Wait for terminal emulation system ready
Actions.Description: Waits for the terminal emulator to report that the system is ready. The output of this action is dependent on how the specific emulator has implemented HLLAPI and the output may vary from emulator to emulator.

Actions.Name: Activate MS Excel worksheet
Actions.Description: Activates a named worksheet in a workbook in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Add macro to MS Excel workbook
Actions.Description: Adds a macro to a workbook in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Attach to existing MS Excel instance
Actions.Description: Attaches to an instance Microsoft Excel that has already been started.

Actions.Name: Clear MS Excel clipboard
Actions.Description: Clears the current Excel clipboard (the dotted area) in a workbook in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Close current MS Excel workbook
Actions.Description: Closes the current Excel workbook in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Close MS Excel instance
Actions.Description: Closes an instance Microsoft Excel that was started using a Visual Basic Object (or attached to later). The instance of Excel to close is defined by the handle.

Actions.Name: Close MS Excel workbook
Actions.Description: Closes an open Excel workbook in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Copy selection in MS Excel workbook
Actions.Description: Copies the current selection in a workbook in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Create MS Excel instance
Actions.Description: Starts Microsoft Excel using a Visual Basic Object to allow Excel to be automated using the actions in this IA-Connect module. Microsoft Excel starts hidden because it doesn't need to be visible for automation.

Actions.Name: Create MS Excel workbook
Actions.Description: Creates a new Excel workbook in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Create MS Excel worksheet
Actions.Description: Creates a named worksheet in a workbook in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Cut selection in MS Excel workbook
Actions.Description: Cuts the current selection in a workbook in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Delete selection in MS Excel workbook
Actions.Description: Deletes the current selection in a workbook in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Delete MS Excel worksheet
