Actions.Description: Deletes a named worksheet in a workbook in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Evaluate MS Excel expression
Actions.Description: Returns the result of evaluating an expression in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Execute MS Excel command bar object
Actions.Description: Executes any command bar object in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle) given the Control Name, e.g. Copy, Undo, BorderNone, SortAscendingExcel, SortDecendingExcel.

Actions.Name: Find next cell with value in MS Excel worksheet
Actions.Description: Finds the next cell with a specified value in a named worksheet in a workbook in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Find next empty cell in MS Excel worksheet
Actions.Description: Finds the next empty cell in a named worksheet in a workbook in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Format cell in active MS Excel worksheet
Actions.Description: Formats a cell in the active worksheet in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Format current cell in active MS Excel worksheet
Actions.Description: Formats the active cell in the active worksheet in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Get active cell in active MS Excel worksheet
Actions.Description: Returns the cell reference of the active cell in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Get cell text in active MS Excel worksheet
Actions.Description: Get text in a cell in the active workbook in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Get cell value in active MS Excel worksheet
Actions.Description: Get the string value in a cell in the active workbook in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Get cell value 2 in active MS Excel worksheet
Actions.Description: Gets the raw value in a cell in the active workbook in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle). This returns the 'true' value of the cell without any formatting applied.

Actions.Name: Get MS Excel country setting
Actions.Description: Returns the Country setting for an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Get number of rows in MS Excel worksheet
Actions.Description: Returns the number of data rows in a named worksheet in a workbook in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Get MS Excel worksheet as collection enhanced
Actions.Description: Retrieves the contents of a named worksheet in a workbook in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Get active MS Excel worksheet name
Actions.Description: Returns the name of the worksheet at a specified index (starting at 1) in a workbook in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Get MS Excel worksheet names
Actions.Description: Returns the names of worksheets in a workbook in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Get MS Excel worksheet used range
Actions.Description: Returns the used range in a named worksheet in a workbook in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Go to cell in active MS Excel worksheet
Actions.Description: Goes to (selects) a cell in the active workbook in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Go to next empty cell down in MS Excel worksheet
Actions.Description: Goto next empty cell down in a named worksheet in a workbook in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Go to next empty cell left in MS Excel worksheet
Actions.Description: Goto next empty cell to the left in a named worksheet in a workbook in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Go to next empty cell right in MS Excel worksheet
Actions.Description: Goto next empty cell to the right in a named worksheet in a workbook in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Go to next empty cell up in MS Excel worksheet
Actions.Description: Goto next empty cell up in a named worksheet in a workbook in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Hide MS Excel
Actions.Description: Hides an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle). This would typically only be used during development because Excel doesn't need to be visible for automation.

Actions.Name: Insert on selection in MS Excel workbook
Actions.Description: Inserts on the current selection in a workbook in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Open MS Excel workbook
Actions.Description: Opens a specified Excel workbook in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Paste into selection in MS Excel workbook
Actions.Description: Pastes into the current selection in a workbook in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Run MS Excel macro
Actions.Description: Runs a macro in a workbook in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Save current MS Excel workbook
Actions.Description: Saves the current workbook in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Save current MS Excel workbook as
Actions.Description: Saves the current workbook in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle) as a specified filename.

Actions.Name: Save current MS Excel workbook as CSV
Actions.Description: Saves the current workbook as CSV in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle) as a specified filename.

Actions.Name: Save MS Excel workbook
Actions.Description: Saves a specified open workbook in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Save MS Excel workbook as
Actions.Description: Saves a specified open workbook in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle) as a specified filename.

Actions.Name: Save MS Excel workbook as CSV
Actions.Description: Saves a specified open workbook as CSV in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle) as a specified filename.

Actions.Name: Save MS Excel workbook as with password
Actions.Description: Saves a specified open workbook in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle) as a specified filename with a password.

Actions.Name: Select cell range in MS Excel worksheet
Actions.Description: Selects a range in a named worksheet in a workbook in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Set MS Excel calculation mode
Actions.Description: Sets the calculation mode (0 = manual, 1 = automatic, 2 = semi automatic) in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Set cell value in active MS Excel worksheet
Actions.Description: Set the string value of a cell in the active workbook in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Show MS Excel
Actions.Description: Makes an instance of Microsoft Excel visible (referenced by the handle). This would typically only be used during development because Excel doesn't need to be visible for automation.

Actions.Name: Trust MS Excel VB object model in registry
Actions.Description: Sets the registry value for Excel to trust VB object model (needed to create macros). Excel must not be running and only works if not overridden by GPO. This is the same as enabling the 'Trust access to the VBA project object model' option in the 'Developer Macro Settings' section of Trust Center.

Actions.Name: Write collection to MS Excel worksheet
Actions.Description: Writes a collection (array) into a named worksheet in a workbook in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Write collection to MS Excel worksheet with dates
Actions.Description: Writes a collection (array) with date fields into a named worksheet in a workbook in an instance of Microsoft Excel (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Attach to existing MS Outlook instance
Actions.Description: Attaches to a running Outlook instance to allow Outlook to be automated using the actions in this IA-Connect module.

Actions.Name: Start background monitor for MS Outlook Allow popup
Actions.Description: Creates a background thread that monitors the remote session for a specified number of seconds, searching for an 'Allow' popup, which can be triggered by a number of Outlook actions such as 'Send email'. Once the element is located, the action will then click the 'Allow' button to permit the triggering action to complete successfully.

Actions.Name: Close MS Outlook instance
Actions.Description: Closes an instance of Microsoft Outlook that was started using the 'Create instance' action (or attached to later), without waiting for any active requests to complete. This action can sometimes cause issues when Outlook cached mode is enabled and should be used after calling 'Wait for mails to send' to ensure that Outlook has successfully completed any ongoing tasks such as sending emails.

Actions.Name: Close MS Outlook instance using Window
Actions.Description: Closes an instance of Microsoft Outlook that was started using the 'Create instance' action (or attached to later), by making Outlook visible and then closing the Outlook window (as a user would close Outlook). This can be more reliable when Outlook cached mode is enabled.

Actions.Name: Create MS Outlook instance
Actions.Description: Starts Microsoft Outlook using a Visual Basic Object to allow Outlook to be automated using the actions in this IA-Connect module. Microsoft Outlook starts hidden because it doesn't need to be visible for automation. Only one instance of Outlook can be running at any one time.

Actions.Name: Create mail folder in MS Outlook
Actions.Description: Creates a mail folder within the current Outlook profile. This action can be used to create top-level folders if no parent folder path is provided, or child folders by providing a parent folder path.

Actions.Name: Delete email in MS Outlook
Actions.Description: Deletes an email in Outlook.

Actions.Name: Forward email in MS Outlook
Actions.Description: Forwards an email in Outlook.

Actions.Name: Get email attachment filenames in MS Outlook
Actions.Description: Retrieves details about the attachments on an email in Outlook.

Actions.Name: Get email body in MS Outlook
Actions.Description: Retrieves the body of an email in Outlook.

Actions.Name: Get emails in MS Outlook
Actions.Description: Retrieves emails from a specified folder in Outlook.

Actions.Name: Get first email in MS Outlook
Actions.Description: Retrieves the first email from a specified folder in Outlook. As the emails are not ordered in any particular way, if you require the emails to be in a specific order (e.g. the first email by date received) then you should instead use the 'Get emails' action and then sort the output.

Actions.Name: Get mail folders in MS Outlook
Actions.Description: Retrieves all mail folders in Outlook by providing a folder path and optionally a flag to indicate whether subfolders should also be returned.

Actions.Name: Get MS Outlook MAPI profiles
Actions.Description: Retrieves all the configured MAPI profiles which can be used with Outlook.

Actions.Name: Get MS Outlook namespace information
Actions.Description: Retrieves information about the current Outlook instance running and the Exchange server that it is connected to.

Actions.Name: Get number of MS Outlook mails
Actions.Description: Returns the number of emails from a specified folder in Outlook that match the provided search criteria.

Actions.Name: Get MS Outlook process Id
Actions.Description: Returns the dynamic Process ID (PID) of the running Outlook process which could be used for performing UIA actions.

Actions.Name: Is MS Outlook connected
Actions.Description: Checks to see if IA-Connect is connected to an instance of Outlook.

Actions.Name: Mark email as read in MS Outlook
Actions.Description: Marks a specific email in Outlook as read or unread, depending on the input flag set.

Actions.Name: Move email in MS Outlook
Actions.Description: Moves a specific email from a specified folder in Outlook to another folder.

Actions.Name: Reply to email in MS Outlook
Actions.Description: Replies to an email in Outlook.

Actions.Name: Save email attachments as file in MS Outlook
Actions.Description: Saves the attachments from a specific email in Outlook.

Actions.Name: Send email in MS Outlook
Actions.Description: Sends a new email in Outlook.

Actions.Name: Set MS Outlook Allow popup details
Actions.Description: Overrides the default Outlook 'Allow' popup element search details used by IA-Connect Agent to locate the 'Allow' button. Button names may change with the language settings, if so use this before calling 'Background monitor for Allow popup'.

Actions.Name: Show MS Outlook
Actions.Description: Shows the current Outlook instance that is being automated.

Actions.Name: Add table to MS Word document
Actions.Description: Adds a table with the specified number of rows and columns to a named document in an instance of Microsoft Word (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Add table column to MS Word document
Actions.Description: Adds a column to a table (specified by index) in a named document in an instance of Microsoft Word (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Add table row to MS Word document
Actions.Description: Adds a row to a table (specified by index) in a named document in an instance of Microsoft Word (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Attach to existing MS Word instance
Actions.Description: Attaches to an instance Microsoft Word that has already been started.

Actions.Name: Clear clipboard
Actions.Description: Clears the contents of the clipboard in the IA-Connect Agent user session.

Actions.Name: Close MS Word document
Actions.Description: Closes an open Word document in an instance of Microsoft Word (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Close MS Word instance
Actions.Description: Closes an instance of Microsoft Word that was started using a Visual Basic Object (or attached to later). The instance of Word to close is defined by the handle.

Actions.Name: Copy MS Word selection to clipboard
Actions.Description: Copies the selected contents of a document in an instance of Microsoft Word (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Create MS Word document
Actions.Description: Creates a new Word document in an instance of Microsoft Word (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Create MS Word instance
Actions.Description: Starts Microsoft Word using a Visual Basic Object to allow Word to be automated using the actions in this IA-Connect module. Microsoft Word starts hidden because it doesn't need to be visible for automation.

Actions.Name: Detach from MS Word instance
Actions.Description: Detaches from a running instance of Microsoft Word that was started using a Visual Basic Object (or attached to later). The instance of Word to detach from is defined by the handle.

Actions.Name: Export MS Word document as PDF
Actions.Description: Saves a named document as a PDF in an instance of Microsoft Word (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Get MS Word document body text
Actions.Description: Reads the content from a specified character range in the body of a named document in an instance of Microsoft Word (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Get highlighted text in MS Word document
Actions.Description: Returns all highlighted text in a document in an instance of Microsoft Word (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Get number of tables in MS Word document
Actions.Description: Returns the number of tables in a named document in an instance of Microsoft Word (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Get MS Word document table bounds
Actions.Description: Returns the number of rows and columns in a table (specified by index) in a named document in an instance of Microsoft Word (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Get table cell text value in MS Word document
Actions.Description: Gets the text value of a cell in a table (specified by index) in a named document in an instance of Microsoft Word (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Get MS Word document table cell text value trimmed
Actions.Description: Gets the text value of a cell with any leading or trailing whitespace characters (e.g. spaces) removed in a table (specified by index) in a named document in an instance of Microsoft Word (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Hide MS Word
Actions.Description: Hides an instance of Microsoft Word (referenced by the handle). This would typically only be used during development because Word doesn't need to be visible for automation.

Actions.Name: Open MS Word document
Actions.Description: Opens a specified Word document in an instance of Microsoft Word (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Paste into MS Word from clipboard
Actions.Description: Pastes the content of the clipboard into a document at the currently selected point in an instance of Microsoft Word (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Save As MS Word document
Actions.Description: Saves a specified open document in an instance of Microsoft Word (referenced by the handle) as a specified filename.

Actions.Name: Save MS Word document
Actions.Description: Saves a specified open document in an instance of Microsoft Word (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Select all in MS Word document
Actions.Description: Selects all of the content in an open document in an instance of Microsoft Word (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Select range in MS Word document
Actions.Description: Selects a character range in a named document in an instance of Microsoft Word (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Select table in MS Word document
Actions.Description: Selects a table (specified by index) in a named document in an instance of Microsoft Word (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Select table cell in MS Word document
Actions.Description: Selects a cell in a table (specified by index) in a named document in an instance of Microsoft Word (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Set MS Word document table cell text value
Actions.Description: Sets the text value of a cell in a table (specified by index) in a named document in an instance of Microsoft Word (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Show MS Word
Actions.Description: Makes an instance of Microsoft Word visible (referenced by the handle). This would typically only be used during development because Word doesn't need to be visible for automation.

Actions.Name: Type text in MS Word document
Actions.Description: Types the specified text into a document from the currently selected point in an instance of Microsoft Word (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Update MS Word bookmark
Actions.Description: Updates a bookmark in a named document in an instance of Microsoft Word (referenced by the handle).

Actions.Name: Attach to SAPGUI instance
Actions.Description: Attaches to an instance of SAP GUI which is already running. This is the first step towards automating SAP GUI if SAP GUI was already running.

Actions.Name: Attach to SAP session
Actions.Description: Attaches IA-Connect to an open SAP session. This action can be used to switch control to any new SAP sessions that are opened within an existing connection.

Actions.Name: Bring SAP window to the front
Actions.Description: Brings a SAP window to the front.

Actions.Name: Check SAP element
Actions.Description: Sets the state of an SAP element (typically a checkbox or radio box) to either checked or unchecked.

Actions.Name: Check SAP grid view cell checkbox
Actions.Description: Check or uncheck a checkbox in a grid view cell at the specified row and column within a grid view. Row index 1 represents the top row of cells in the grid view.

Actions.Name: Check SAP table visible checkbox cell
Actions.Description: Check or uncheck a checkbox in a visible table cell at the specified row and column index within a table. Row index 1, column index 1 represents the top left corner of the visible cells in the table. This action can only be used to check or uncheck visible cells.

Actions.Name: Check SAP tree item
Actions.Description: Checks a SAP tree item. The specific node or item can be searched using one of either the node key, node path or node text. The key, path or text values can be determined by using the action 'Get SAP tree nodes'.

Actions.Name: Click link on SAP tree item
Actions.Description: Clicks a link on a SAP tree item. The specific node or item can be searched using one of either the node key, node path or node text. The key, path or text values can be determined by using the action 'Get SAP tree nodes'.

Actions.Name: Click SAP grid view cell
Actions.Description: Clicks a grid view cell in the specified row and column within a grid view. Row index 1 represents the top row of cells in the grid view.

Actions.Name: Close SAP session
Actions.Description: Closes an open SAP session.

Actions.Name: Deselect all SAP tree nodes
Actions.Description: Deselect all nodes in a SAP tree.

Actions.Name: Detach from SAPGUI
Actions.Description: Detaches IA-Connect from the running instance of SAPGUI.

Actions.Name: Double click SAP grid view cell
Actions.Description: Double clicks a grid view cell in the specified row and column within a grid view. Row index 1 represents the top row of cells in the grid view.

Actions.Name: Double click SAP tree item
Actions.Description: Double clicks a node or item in a SAP tree. The specific node or item can be searched using one of either the node key, node path or node text. The key, path or text values can be determined by using the action 'Get SAP tree nodes'.

Actions.Name: Draw rectangle around SAP element
Actions.Description: Draws a rectangle around the perimeter of an SAP element to aid in identifying that the element found is the one required. The rectangle is automatically removed after 5 seconds.

Actions.Name: Draw rectangle around SAP grid view cell
Actions.Description: Draws a rectangle around the perimeter of an SAP grid view cell to aid in identifying that the cell found is the one required. The rectangle is automatically removed after 5 seconds.

Actions.Name: Enable SAP scripting
Actions.Description: Enables SAP scripting in the SAP GUI. This setting must also be enabled on the SAP server by setting the 'sapgui/user_scripting' parameter value to TRUE.

Actions.Name: Enter SAP T-code
Actions.Description: Enters an SAP transaction code (T-code). This is the same as entering a T-code into the SAP command box.

Actions.Name: Expand SAP tree node
Actions.Description: Expands or collapses a node in a SAP tree. The specific node or item can be searched using one of either the node key, node path or node text. The key, path or text values can be determined by using the action 'Get SAP tree nodes'.

Actions.Name: Focus SAP calendar date
Actions.Description: Focusses the specified calendar date (YYYYMMDD) in a SAP calendar element.

Actions.Name: Focus SAP element
Actions.Description: Focusses an SAP element which makes it the active element for keyboard focus and brings the SAP window to the foreground.

Actions.Name: Get all SAP child element properties
Actions.Description: Returns all properties of all SAP child elements. This can be useful if you are uncertain which field holds the property values required.

Actions.Name: Get attached session properties
Actions.Description: Returns information about the SAP session that IA-Connect is attached to.

Actions.Name: Get SAP element properties
Actions.Description: Returns all properties of an SAP element. This can be useful if you are uncertain which field holds the property values required.

Actions.Name: Get SAP element properties as collection
Actions.Description: Returns the properties of an SAP element as a single line list (single line collection / data table) instead of individual items, this maybe useful depending on how you intend to use the data.

Actions.Name: Get SAP element text value
Actions.Description: Returns the text value of an SAP element. A text value is usually associated with a text element, but many elements can have this property.

Actions.Name: Get SAP grid view text contents
Actions.Description: Returns all the text contents of a SAP grid view.

Actions.Name: Get SAP selection list items
Actions.Description: Returns a list of child element items found under the specified SAP element (typically dropdown / menu items).

Actions.Name: Get SAP element at screen coordinate
Actions.Description: If a SAP element exists at the specified coordinates, this action will identify the element and return the element ID.

Actions.Name: Get SAP parent element Id
Actions.Description: Returns the SAP element Id of the parent element of an SAP element.

Actions.Name: Get SAP grid view cell contents
Actions.Description: Gets the contents of a grid view cell in the specified row and column within a grid view. Row index 1 represents the top row of cells in the grid view.

Actions.Name: Get SAP grid view cell properties
Actions.Description: Returns all properties of a grid view cell in the specified row and column within a grid view. Row index 1 represents the top row of cells in the grid view.

Actions.Name: Get SAP grid view column headers
Actions.Description: Returns a list of column headers in a grid view. The name or title of the column headers can be used for the 'Search column name' or 'Search column title' input in many SAP grid view actions.

Actions.Name: Get SAP grid view properties
Actions.Description: Returns the properties of an SAP grid view element. This is an element with an element type of 'GridView'.

Actions.Name: Get SAPGUI attach status
Actions.Description: Returns information about the current IA-Connect connection to SAP GUI.

Actions.Name: Get SAP sessions
Actions.Description: Returns a list of running SAP sessions. This information is useful if you wish to attach to an existing SAP connection / session but you don't know which ones are available.

Actions.Name: Get SAP session top level element properties
Actions.Description: Returns the properties of the SAP element at the top-level of the active SAP session, typically the GuiMainWindow element.

Actions.Name: Get SAP table properties
Actions.Description: Returns the properties of an SAP table element. This is an element with an element type of 'GuiTableControl'. For gridview elements (these are similar to tables but provide additional functionality via a built-in toolbar), use the alternative action 'Get SAP grid view properties'.

Actions.Name: Get SAP table visible cell properties
Actions.Description: Returns all properties of a visible table cell at the specified row and column index within a table. Row index 1, column index 1 represents the top left corner of the visible cells in the table. This action can only be used to retrieve the properties of visible cells.

Actions.Name: Get SAP table visible cell text contents
Actions.Description: Gets the contents of a visible table cell at the specified row and column index within a table. Row index 1, column index 1 represents the top left corner of the visible cells in the table. This action can only be used to retrieve the contents of visible cells.

Actions.Name: Get SAP shell toolbar elements
Actions.Description: Returns a list of elements (usually buttons) in a GuiShell toolbar.

Actions.Name: Get SAP table visible text contents
Actions.Description: Gets the contents of all visible table cells within a table. This action can only be used to retrieve the contents of visible cells.

Actions.Name: Get SAP tree column headers
Actions.Description: Returns a list of column headers in a tree. The name or title of the column headers can be used for the 'Search column name' or 'Search column title' input in many SAP tree actions.

Actions.Name: Get SAP tree item properties
Actions.Description: Returns the properties of a SAP tree item. The specific node or item can be searched using one of either the node key, node path or node text. The key, path or text values can be determined by using the action 'Get SAP tree nodes'.

Actions.Name: Get SAP tree nodes
Actions.Description: Returns a list of all nodes in an SAP tree element.

Actions.Name: Get SAP tree text contents
Actions.Description: Returns the text contents of all nodes in a SAP tree.

Actions.Name: Global double left click SAP grid view cell
Actions.Description: Moves the mouse to the centre of an SAP grid view cell and double clicks the left mouse button.

Actions.Name: Global double left mouse click on SAP element
Actions.Description: Moves the mouse to the centre of an SAP element and double clicks the left mouse button.

Actions.Name: Global input password into SAP element
Actions.Description: Moves the mouse to centre of the SAP element, focusses it, left clicks, and presses keys. Typically used with a password input that will not accept native input methods.

Actions.Name: Global input text into SAP element
Actions.Description: Moves the mouse to centre of the SAP element, focusses it, left clicks, and presses keys. Typically used with a text input that will not accept native input methods.

Actions.Name: Global left click SAP grid view cell
Actions.Description: Moves the mouse to the centre of an SAP grid view cell and clicks the left mouse button.

Actions.Name: Global left mouse click on SAP element
Actions.Description: Moves the mouse to the centre of an SAP element and clicks the left mouse button.

Actions.Name: Global middle mouse click on SAP element
Actions.Description: Moves the mouse to the centre of an SAP element and clicks the middle mouse button.

Actions.Name: Global right click SAP grid view cell
Actions.Description: Moves the mouse to the centre of an SAP grid view cell and clicks the right mouse button.

Actions.Name: Global right mouse click on SAP element
Actions.Description: Moves the mouse to the centre of an SAP element and clicks the right mouse button.

Actions.Name: Deselect all on SAP grid view
Actions.Description: Deselects everything in a SAP grid view.

Actions.Name: Open SAP grid view context menu
Actions.Description: Opens the SAP grid view context menu.

Actions.Name: Select all on SAP grid view
Actions.Description: Selects everything in a SAP grid view.

Actions.Name: Input password into SAP element
Actions.Description: Inputs a password into an SAP element (typically a password entry field).

Actions.Name: Input text into SAP element
Actions.Description: Inputs text into an SAP element (typically a text entry field), either replacing the existing text or inserting the new value at a specific position.

Actions.Name: Launch SAPGUI
Actions.Description: Enables SAP scripting and launches SAP GUI. This is the first step towards automating SAP GUI if it was not already running.

Actions.Name: Modify SAP grid view cell value
Actions.Description: Modifies the contents of a grid view cell at the specified row and column within a grid view. Row index 1 represents the top row of cells in the grid view.

Actions.Name: Open SAP connection
Actions.Description: Open a SAP connection using either the description of the SAP system (i.e. the name in the list of SAP connections) or the address of the SAP system (e.g. /H/address/S/3200).

Actions.Name: Open SAP tree item context menu
Actions.Description: Opens the context menu for a SAP tree node or item. The specific node or item can be searched using one of either the node key, node path or node text. The key, path or text values can be determined by using the action 'Get SAP tree nodes'.

Actions.Name: Press button on SAP tree item
Actions.Description: Presses a button on a SAP tree item. The specific node or item can be searched using one of either the node key, node path or node text. The key, path or text values can be determined by using the action 'Get SAP tree nodes'.

Actions.Name: Press key on SAP tree
Actions.Description: Press a key on a SAP tree. There are a limited built-in list of keys you can press, for example 'F1', 'F4', 'Delete', 'Insert', 'Enter', 'Cut', 'Copy' or 'Paste'.

Actions.Name: Press SAP element
Actions.Description: Presses an SAP element (typically a button).

Actions.Name: Press SAP grid view cell button
Actions.Description: Presses a button in a grid view cell at the specified row and column within a grid view. Row index 1 represents the top row of cells in the grid view.

Actions.Name: Press SAP grid view column header
Actions.Description: Presses a column header in a SAP grid view.

Actions.Name: Press SAP table visible cell
Actions.Description: Presses a button in a visible table cell at the specified row and column index within a table. Row index 1, column index 1 represents the top left corner of the visible cells in the table. This action can only be used to press visible cells.

Actions.Name: Press SAP shell toolbar element
Actions.Description: Presses an SAP element (usually a button) in a toolbar. The specific element to press can be searched using one of either the element Id, the text value or the element index.

Actions.Name: Press SAP shell toolbar context button
Actions.Description: Presses a context button on a SAP element in a toolbar. The specific element to press the context button on can be searched using one of either the element Id, the text value or the element index.

Actions.Name: Scroll SAP table
Actions.Description: Scrolls an SAP table element either horizontally, vertically or both.

Actions.Name: Select SAP calendar month
Actions.Description: Selects the specified month (1 to 12) in the specified year in a SAP calendar element. The month is selected in addition to any existing selection.

Actions.Name: Select SAP calendar date range
Actions.Description: Selects the specified date range (from YYYYMMDD to YYYYMMDD) in a SAP calendar element. This selection replaces any existing date selections.

Actions.Name: Select SAP calendar week
Actions.Description: Selects the specified week (starting at 1) in the specified year in a SAP calendar element. The week is selected in addition to any existing selection.

Actions.Name: Select SAP element
Actions.Description: Selects an SAP element (typically a tab element or item in a list or drop-down).

Actions.Name: Select SAP grid view column
Actions.Description: Selects a single SAP column in a grid view. If a different column or columns are currently selected, they will remain selected unless the 'Clear selection first' parameter is set to true.

Actions.Name: Select SAP grid view multiple rows
Actions.Description: Selects multiple SAP rows in a grid view. If a different row or rows are currently selected, they will become deselected.

Actions.Name: Select SAP grid view row
Actions.Description: Selects a single SAP row in a grid view. If a different row or rows are currently selected, they will become deselected.

Actions.Name: Select SAP table visible column
Actions.Description: Selects the visible table column at the specified column index within a table. Column index 1, represents the first visible column in the table. This action can only be used to select visible columns.

Actions.Name: Select SAP table visible row
Actions.Description: Selects the visible table row at the specified row index within a table. Row index 1, represents the first visible row in the table. This action can only be used to select visible rows.

Actions.Name: Select SAP shell toolbar menu item
Actions.Description: Selects a menu item in a shell toolbar. The specific element to select can be searched using one of either the element Id, the text value or the element index.

Actions.Name: Select SAP tree item
Actions.Description: Select or deselect a node or item in a SAP tree. The specific node or item can be searched using one of either the node key, node path or node text. The key, path or text values can be determined by using the action 'Get SAP tree nodes'.

Actions.Name: Send SAP command
Actions.Description: Inputs and submits a SAP command. This is the same as entering a command or transaction code into the command box.

Actions.Name: Send enter virtual key
Actions.Description: Sends the enter virtual key to an SAP element. Virtual keys can only be sent to a GUI Frame window, for example 'wnd[0]'.

Actions.Name: Send virtual key
Actions.Description: Sends a virtual key to an SAP element. Virtual keys can only be sent to a GUI Frame window, for example 'wnd[0]'.

Actions.Name: Select SAP list item by key
Actions.Description: Selects the list element with the specified key. This is typically used to select an item in a dropdown / menu item.

Actions.Name: Select SAP list item by name
Actions.Description: Selects the list element with the specified name. This is typically used to select an item in a dropdown / menu item.

Actions.Name: Set SAP grid view current cell
Actions.Description: Sets the current cell in a grid view to the cell at the specified row and column. Row index 1 represents the top row of cells in the grid view.

Actions.Name: Set SAP grid view current column
Actions.Description: Sets the current column within a grid view. The current row will remain unchanged.

Actions.Name: Set SAP grid view current row index
Actions.Description: Sets the current row index within a grid view. The current column will remain unchanged.

Actions.Name: Set SAP grid view first visible column
Actions.Description: Scrolls a SAP grid view until the specified column is the first visible column.

Actions.Name: Set SAP grid view first visible row index
Actions.Description: Scrolls a SAP grid view until the specified row index (starting at 1) is the first visible row. If you set a row index higher than the number of rows in the grid view then it will scroll down as far as possible.

Actions.Name: Write to SAP table visible text cell
Actions.Description: Writes to a visible table cell at the specified row and column index within a table. Row index 1, column index 1 represents the top left corner of the visible cells in the table. This action can only be used to set the contents of visible cells.

Actions.Name: Set SAP tree column width
Actions.Description: Set the width (in pixels) of a SAP tree column. The specific column can be searched using one of either the column name or column title. The column name or title values can be determined by using the action 'Get SAP tree column headers'.

Actions.Name: Visualise SAP element
Actions.Description: Tells the SAP GUI to draw a red rectangle around the element. This is a built-in SAP feature and not the same as asking IA-Connect to display a highlighting rectangle. The element will remain visualised until it is interacted with.

Actions.Name: Wait for attached SAP session not busy
Actions.Description: Waits for the attached SAP session to report that it is no longer busy.

Actions.Name: Wait for SAP element
Actions.Description: Waits for an SAP element (typically an individual element within a window such as a button or a text input area) to exist.

Actions.Name: Wait for SAP window
Actions.Description: Waits for a SAP window with the specified title.

Actions.Name: Close SAP window
Actions.Description: Closes an SAP window.

Actions.Name: Maximise SAP window
Actions.Description: Maximises a SAP window.

Actions.Name: Minimise SAP window
Actions.Description: Minimises a SAP window.

Actions.Name: Restore SAP window
Actions.Description: Restores a SAP window from being maximised or minimised.

Actions.Name: Add file to ZIP
Actions.Description: ZIPs a file (stores the file into a compression archive).

Actions.Name: Add folder to ZIP
Actions.Description: ZIPs files in a folder into a ZIP file (stores the files into a compression archive).

Actions.Name: Add permission to file
Actions.Description: Adds a permission to a file on the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running.

Actions.Name: Add permission to folder
Actions.Description: Adds a permission to a folder on the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running.

Actions.Name: Attach to IA-Connect session by index
Actions.Description: Attaches to the specified IA-Connect Director session by index (e.g. attach to first Citrix ICA session). This is the session into which commands to an IA-Connect Agent are sent.

Actions.Name: Attach to IA-Connect session by name
Actions.Description: Attaches to the specified IA-Connect Director session by name. This is the session into which commands to an IA-Connect Agent are sent.

Actions.Name: Attach to most recent IA-Connect session
Actions.Description: Attaches to the IA-Connect Director session which most recently connected (optionally of a specified type). This is the session into which commands to an IA-Connect Agent are sent.

Actions.Name: Attach to tier 1 IA-Connect session
Actions.Description: Attaches to the IA-Connect Director session of the Director receiving the SOAP and / or REST messages. This is the session into which commands to an IA-Connect Agent are sent.

Actions.Name: Break folder security inheritance
Actions.Description: Breaks security inheritance on a folder on the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running.

Actions.Name: Bring IA-Connect Agent GUI to front
Actions.Description: Brings the IA-Connect Agent GUI to the front so it is visible onscreen.

Actions.Name: Calibrate mouse_event
Actions.Description: Calibrates the mouse_event method by moving the mouse by the specified number of pixels and then reading the new mouse position.

Actions.Name: Clear clipboard
Actions.Description: Clears the contents of the clipboard in the IA-Connect Agent user session.

Actions.Name: Close IA-Connect Agent
Actions.Description: Closes the IA-Connect Agent. This does not affect the user session where the IA-Connect Agent was running.

Actions.Name: Configure next hop IA-Connect Director
Actions.Description: Configure the next-hop Director in a double-hop scenario. This is only required if the default IA-Connect next-hop Director settings are not suitable.

Actions.Name: Copy file
Actions.Description: Copies a file on the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running.

Actions.Name: Copy file from client to server
Actions.Description: Copies a file from the local computer (running the IA-Connect Director) to the remote computer (running the IA-Connect Agent).

Actions.Name: Copy file to clipboard
Actions.Description: Copies the specified local file to the clipboard in the IA-Connect Agent user session.

Actions.Name: Create directory
Actions.Description: Creates a directory (folder) on the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running.

Actions.Name: Deletes a user credential
Actions.Description: Deletes a credential in the user's profile in the IA-Connect Agent session. Credentials can be viewed from the Windows Control Panel.

Actions.Name: Read from a user credential
Actions.Description: Reads a username and password from a credential in the user's profile in the IA-Connect Agent session. Credentials can be viewed from the Windows Control Panel. Both the username and password can be retrieved from a Generic credential while only the username can be retrieved from a Windows credential.

Actions.Name: Write to a user credential
Actions.Description: Writes a username and password to a credential in the user's profile in the IA-Connect Agent session, creating that credential if it doesn't exist. Credentials can be viewed from the Windows Control Panel.

Actions.Name: Delete directory
Actions.Description: Deletes a directory (folder) on the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running.

Actions.Name: Delete file
Actions.Description: Deletes a file on the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running.

Actions.Name: Delete files
Actions.Description: Deletes files within a specified folder matching a pattern on the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running.

Actions.Name: Does directory exist
Actions.Description: Reports true or false as to whether a directory (folder) exists on the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running.

Actions.Name: Is directory accessible
Actions.Description: Returns whether a directory (folder) is accessible and whether permissions are restricting access to it on the computer where the IA-Connect Agent.

Actions.Name: Disable IA-Connect next hop
Actions.Description: Disables next-hop so that all future commands will be processed by the Agent which receives them (as opposed to being forwarded on to the next hop Agent).

Actions.Name: Disconnect remote session
Actions.Description: Disconnects the remote session where the IA-Connect Agent is running. This is not the same as logging off and will leave the remote session running in a disconnected state. This action can be used where you wish to connect back to the remote session later and continue from the same state, rather than starting a new session.

Actions.Name: Does IA-Connect session exist by name
Actions.Description: Returns if the specified IA-Connect Director session exists. This is the session into which commands to an IA-Connect Agent are sent. The name will be known from an earlier 'Attach' action.

Actions.Name: Double left click mouse
Actions.Description: Double clicks the left mouse button in the IA-Connect Agent user session.

Actions.Name: Double left click mouse at coordinate
Actions.Description: Double clicks the left mouse button in the IA-Connect Agent user session at the specified coordinates.

Actions.Name: Download HTTP file
Actions.Description: Downloads a file to the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running using HTTP(S).

Actions.Name: Enable folder security inheritance
Actions.Description: Enables security inheritance on a folder on the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running.

Actions.Name: Enable IA-Connect next hop
Actions.Description: Enables the next hop which will forward all future commands received onto the IA-Connect Agent running in the next hop session.

Actions.Name: Expand environment variable
Actions.Description: Expands a string containing environment variables (e.g. %USERPROFILE% or %TEMP%) in the IA-Connect Agent user session.

Actions.Name: Expand password string
Actions.Description: Accepts an input string which contains references to IA-Connect stored passwords and returns that string with the references replaced by the stored passwords.

Actions.Name: Does file exist
Actions.Description: Reports true or false as to whether a file exists on the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running.

Actions.Name: Generate password
Actions.Description: Generates a password containing dictionary words, numbers, symbols, characters as defined in a template format.

Actions.Name: Create Remote Desktop Session (RDS) launch file
Actions.Description: Create a Remote Desktop Session (RDS) launch file which can be used to automatically launch a Remote Desktop Session using specified parameters, instead of requiring automation of the Remote Desktop client UI. A RDS launch file has the extension '.rdp' and is often called a RDP file.

Actions.Name: Get IA-Connect Agent process count
Actions.Description: Returns the number of instances of the IA-Connect Agent currently running in the user session. This is useful for detecting if there are multiple instances of the IA-Connect Agent running.

Actions.Name: Get all IA-Connect command statistics
Actions.Description: Returns all currently stored statistics on which commands the IA-Connect Agent has executed in the current session.

Actions.Name: Get available IA-Connect Sessions
Actions.Description: Retrieves a list of IA-Connect Director sessions (available connections to sessions where the IA-Connect Agent is running, such as local, Microsoft RDP or Citrix ICA).

Actions.Name: Get clipboard
Actions.Description: Gets the current content of the clipboard in the IA-Connect Agent user session.

Actions.Name: Get CSV text as collection
Actions.Description: Returns a CSV file on the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running as a collection (table). Only requires read only access to CSV file.

Actions.Name: Get current mouse coordinate
Actions.Description: Gets the current mouse cursor position in the IA-Connect Agent user session.

Actions.Name: Get default printer
Actions.Description: Gets the name of the default printer for the user in the IA-Connect Agent session.

Actions.Name: Get IA-Connect Director uptime
Actions.Description: Returns the uptime of this IA-Connect Director in seconds (i.e. how long the Director has been running).

Actions.Name: Get disk free space
Actions.Description: Returns the amount of free space for a specified disk on the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running.

Actions.Name: Get environment info
Actions.Description: Returns information about the environment in which the IA-Connect Agent user session is running.

Actions.Name: Get files
Actions.Description: Returns a list of files in a folder (matching a CSV list of patterns) on the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running.

Actions.Name: Get file security permissions
Actions.Description: Returns a list of permissions currently set on a file on the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running.

Actions.Name: Get file size
Actions.Description: Returns the size (in bytes) of a file on the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running.

Actions.Name: Get folders
Actions.Description: Returns all sub-folders within a specified folder on the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running.

Actions.Name: Get folder security permissions
Actions.Description: Returns a list of permissions currently set on a folder on the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running.

Actions.Name: Get IA-Connect Agent info
Actions.Description: Returns the properties of the IA-Connect Agent, including the version number and the path to the Agent executable.

Actions.Name: Get IA-Connect Agent log
Actions.Description: Returns the current IA-Connect Agent log, either as a file or by reading the contents and returning it in an output variable.

Actions.Name: Get last input info
Actions.Description: Gets the time since the last user input was received in the IA-Connect Agent user session.

Actions.Name: Get IA-Connect Agent current license state
Actions.Description: Returns whether the IA-Connect Agent is currently licensed and if licensed, the properties of the license.

Actions.Name: Get list of drives
Actions.Description: Returns a list of drives on the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running.

Actions.Name: Get list of printers
Actions.Description: Returns a list of all available printers in the IA-Connect Agent session.

Actions.Name: Get machine domain
Actions.Description: Returns the domain of the machine that is running the IA-Connect Agent user session.

Actions.Name: Get machine name
Actions.Description: Returns the name of the machine that is running the IA-Connect Agent user session.

Actions.Name: Get mouse move method
Actions.Description: Gets the current mouse move method.

Actions.Name: Get IA-Connect next hop status
Actions.Description: Reports on the next hop Director status for the Agent which receives this command. If next-hop is enabled, that Agent is forwarding commands to the next hop (via the next-hop Director). If next-hop is disabled, that Agent is processing commands itself (the default).

Actions.Name: Get Orchestrator Flow stats
Actions.Description: Returns a list of Flow stats from the IA-Connect Orchestrator. Used for reporting purposes. You can optionally use one or more filters to limit the returned results.

Actions.Name: Get parent process Id
Actions.Description: Returns the process Id of the parent process for any running process in the IA-Connect Agent user session which has the specified process Id.

Actions.Name: Get process by process Id
Actions.Description: Returns whether a process with the specified process Id is running in the IA-Connect Agent user session. Process Ids are unique so only one process can match the Id. Process Ids are dynamic and are different for every launch of an application.

Actions.Name: Get process count by name
Actions.Description: Returns a count of running processes in the IA-Connect Agent user session which has the specified process name.

Actions.Name: Get processes
Actions.Description: Returns a list of running processes in the IA-Connect Agent user session. This can optionally be filtered by providing a process name.

Actions.Name: Get process Id command line properties
Actions.Description: Returns the command line properties for any running process in the IA-Connect Agent user session which has the specified process Id.

Actions.Name: Get IA-Connect Agent log level
Actions.Description: Returns the current IA-Connect Agent logging level. The logging levels are set from 1 to 4, with 1 being the lowest level and 4 being the highest.

Actions.Name: Get client hostname
Actions.Description: Returns the hostname of the client where the IA-Connect Director is running.

Actions.Name: Get IA-Connect Agent session info
Actions.Description: Returns information about the IA-Connect Agent user session.

Actions.Name: Get screen resolution
Actions.Description: Returns the screen resolution of the IA-Connect Agent user session (as seen by the user session).

Actions.Name: Get stored password
Actions.Description: Retrieves a previously generated or stored password.

Actions.Name: Is screen reader enabled
Actions.Description: Returns whether the screen reader has been enabled in the IA-Connect Agent user session.

Actions.Name: Is TCP port responding
Actions.Description: Reports whether a network TCP port is responding to a connection attempt by the IA-Connect Agent. This could be a TCP port on the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running (enter 'localhost' for the remote host) or on any remote computer. If the IA-Connect Agent successfully connects to a TCP port, it immediately closes the TCP connection.

Actions.Name: Keep session alive
Actions.Description: Keeps the IA-Connect Agent user session alive by moving the mouse at the specified interval to prevent the session from becoming idle.

Actions.Name: Kill all other IA-Connect Agents
Actions.Description: Kills any other instances of the IA-Connect Agent that are currently running in the user session. This will ensure that only one instance of the IA-Connect Agent is running.

Actions.Name: Kill IA-Connect session by name
Actions.Description: Kills the specified IA-Connect Director session if it exists. This is the session into which commands to an IA-Connect Agent are sent. The name will be known from an earlier 'Attach' action.

Actions.Name: Kill process
Actions.Description: Kills any running process in the IA-Connect Agent user session which has the specified process name.

Actions.Name: Kill process ID
Actions.Description: Kills a running process in the IA-Connect Agent user session which has the specified process Id. Process Ids are unique so only one process can match the Id. Process Ids are dynamic and are different for every launch of an application.

Actions.Name: Launch Remote Desktop Session (RDS)
Actions.Description: Launch a Remote Desktop Session (RDS) using a RDP launch file.

Actions.Name: Left click mouse
Actions.Description: Clicks the left mouse button in the IA-Connect Agent user session.

Actions.Name: Left click mouse at coordinate
Actions.Description: Clicks the left mouse button in the IA-Connect Agent user session at the specified coordinates.

Actions.Name: Left hold mouse
Actions.Description: Holds the left mouse button in the IA-Connect Agent user session for the specified amount of seconds.

Actions.Name: Left hold mouse at coordinate
Actions.Description: Holds the left mouse button at the specified coordinates in the IA-Connect Agent user session for the specified amount of seconds.

Actions.Name: Left mouse button down
Actions.Description: Presses (and does not release) the left mouse button in the IA-Connect Agent user session. To release the mouse, use the left mouse button up action.

Actions.Name: Left mouse button up
Actions.Description: Releases the left mouse button in the IA-Connect Agent user session.

Actions.Name: Left mouse drag between coordinates
Actions.Description: Performs a left mouse button drag between the two specified coordinates in the IA-Connect Agent user session.

Actions.Name: Logoff remote session
Actions.Description: Logs off the remote session where the IA-Connect Agent is running.

Actions.Name: Middle click mouse
Actions.Description: Clicks the middle mouse button in the IA-Connect Agent user session.

Actions.Name: Middle click mouse at coordinate
Actions.Description: Clicks the middle mouse button in the IA-Connect Agent user session at the specified coordinates.

Actions.Name: Middle hold mouse
Actions.Description: Holds the middle mouse button in the IA-Connect Agent user session for the specified amount of seconds.

Actions.Name: Middle hold mouse at coordinate
Actions.Description: Holds the middle mouse button at the specified coordinates in the IA-Connect Agent user session for the specified amount of seconds.

Actions.Name: Middle mouse button down
Actions.Description: Presses (and does not release) the middle mouse button in the IA-Connect Agent user session. To release the mouse, use the middle mouse button up action.

Actions.Name: Middle mouse button up
Actions.Description: Releases the middle mouse button in the IA-Connect Agent user session.

Actions.Name: Middle mouse drag between coordinates
Actions.Description: Performs a middle mouse button drag between the two specified coordinates in the IA-Connect Agent user session.

Actions.Name: Move file
Actions.Description: Moves a file on the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running.

Actions.Name: Move mouse relative
Actions.Description: Moves the mouse in the IA-Connect Agent user session by the specified number of pixels, relative to it's current position.

Actions.Name: Move mouse to coordinate
Actions.Description: Moves the mouse in the IA-Connect Agent user session to the specified pixel coordinates.

Actions.Name: Purge directory
Actions.Description: Purges a directory (folder) on the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running, removing all files stored within the directory.

Actions.Name: Read all text from file
Actions.Description: Reads the text contents of a file on the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running.

Actions.Name: Remove identity from file security
Actions.Description: Removes an identity (e.g. user, group or computer) from the security permissions on a file on the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running.

Actions.Name: Remove identity from folder security
Actions.Description: Removes an identity (e.g. a user, group or computer) from the security permissions on a folder on the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running.

Actions.Name: Replace variable data in INI file
Actions.Description: Updates a single variable in an INI file.

Actions.Name: Reset IA-Connect command statistics
Actions.Description: Resets any currently stored statistics on which commands the IA-Connect Agent has executed in the current session.

Actions.Name: Reset next hop IA-Connect Director settings
Actions.Description: Resets any custom IA-Connect Director settings that have been set, restoring the default settings.

Actions.Name: Right click mouse
Actions.Description: Clicks the right mouse button in the IA-Connect Agent user session.

Actions.Name: Right click mouse at coordinate
Actions.Description: Clicks the right mouse button in the IA-Connect Agent user session at the specified coordinates.

Actions.Name: Right hold mouse
Actions.Description: Holds the right mouse button in the IA-Connect Agent user session for the specified amount of seconds.

Actions.Name: Right hold mouse at coordinate
Actions.Description: Holds the right mouse button at the specified coordinates in the IA-Connect Agent user session for the specified amount of seconds.

Actions.Name: Right mouse button down
Actions.Description: Presses (and does not release) the right mouse button in the IA-Connect Agent user session. To release the mouse, use the right mouse button up action.

Actions.Name: Right mouse button up
Actions.Description: Releases the right mouse button in the IA-Connect Agent user session.

Actions.Name: Right mouse drag between coordinates
Actions.Description: Performs a right mouse button drag between the two specified coordinates in the IA-Connect Agent user session.

Actions.Name: Run alternative IA-Connect Agent
Actions.Description: Runs an alternative IA-Connect Agent (for example a later version) by loading the Agent executable from a file location.

Actions.Name: Run alternative IA-Connect Agent sent from director
Actions.Description: Runs an alternative IA-Connect Agent (for example a later version) by uploading the alternative Agent from the IA-Connect Director and then loading the alternative Agent executable.

Actions.Name: Run generic IA-Connect Agent command
Actions.Description: Runs a generic IA-Connect Agent command passing arguments as JSON and returning output data as JSON. Used to run Agent commands when the Director and Inspector are older versions than the Agent and hence don't understand the command.

Actions.Name: Run process
Actions.Description: Launch a process, command or application.

Actions.Name: Send key events
Actions.Description: Sends global key press events to the IA-Connect Agent user session.

Actions.Name: Send keys
Actions.Description: Sends global key presses to the IA-Connect Agent user session.

Actions.Name: Send password key events
Actions.Description: Sends global key press events to the IA-Connect Agent user session, specifically for entering a password.

Actions.Name: Send password keys
Actions.Description: Sends global key presses to the IA-Connect Agent user session, specifically for entering a password.

Actions.Name: Set clipboard
Actions.Description: Sets the content of the clipboard in the IA-Connect Agent user session.

Actions.Name: Set mouse cursor position
Actions.Description: Sets the mouse cursor in the IA-Connect Agent user session to the specified position.

Actions.Name: Set default printer
Actions.Description: Sets the default printer for the user in the IA-Connect Agent session.

Actions.Name: Set IA-Connect license code
Actions.Description: Uploads an old-style (7.0 and 7.1) Agent domain license to the IA-Connect Agent.

Actions.Name: Set IA-Connect license key
Actions.Description: Licenses the IA-Connect Agent with a license key. This can be a license string or the friendly name of a license held in the IA-Connect Orchestrator.

Actions.Name: Set IA-Connect Director log level
Actions.Description: Sets the IA-Connect Director logging level to the specified value (1 being the lowest level and 4 being the highest).

Actions.Name: Set mouse move method
Actions.Description: Sets the current mouse move method to either mouse_event or setcursorpos.

Actions.Name: Set mouse multiplier
Actions.Description: Sets the mouse multiplier in the IA-Connect Agent user session. This can be useful during development if you encounter issues with remote desktop scaling.

Actions.Name: Set owner on file
Actions.Description: Sets the owner on a file on the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running.

Actions.Name: Set owner on folder
Actions.Description: Sets the owner on a folder on the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running.

Actions.Name: Set IA-Connect Agent log level
Actions.Description: Sets the IA-Connect Agent logging level to the specified value (1 being the lowest level and 4 being the highest).

Actions.Name: Set IA-Connect Agent command timeout
Actions.Description: Sets the command timeout that the IA-Connect Agent will use for each command that is executed.

Actions.Name: Set IA-Connect Agent GUI opacity
Actions.Description: Sets the opacity of the IA-Connect Agent from 1 (visible) to 0 (transparent).

Actions.Name: Set IA-Connect Agent GUI position
Actions.Description: Sets the onscreen position of the IA-Connect Agent GUI to the specified location.

Actions.Name: Set IA-Connect Agent GUI topmost
Actions.Description: Sets the IA-Connect Agent as topmost. This means that the IA-Connect Agent will always be visible on screen and cannot be hidden behind other application windows.

Actions.Name: Set screen reader
Actions.Description: Enables or disables the screen reader in the IA-Connect Agent user session.

Actions.Name: Stop keep session alive
Actions.Description: Stops the IA-Connect Agent user session keep alive.

Actions.Name: Take screenshot
Actions.Description: Takes a screenshot of the IA-Connect Agent user session and returns it as a Base64 encoded string.

Actions.Name: Add new Orchestrator deferred task
Actions.Description: Add a new Orchestrator deferred task into a queue that can be monitored from a Flow. The task will be deferred to a specified time in the future. Use this action to temporarily suspend a task for a specified amount of time (for example if you are waiting for something).

Actions.Name: Add new Orchestrator automation task
Actions.Description: Add a new Orchestrator automation task into a queue that can be monitored from a Flow. Tasks can either be ready to run immediately or be deferred to run at a later time.

Actions.Name: Change Orchestrator automation task status
Actions.Description: Changes the selected Orchestrator automation task status to completed, failed or new.

Actions.Name: Defer existing Orchestrator automation task
Actions.Description: Defer an existing Orchestrator task which is already in the queue. The task will be deferred to a specified time in the future. This is commonly used to re-defer an existing task (i.e. the task was previously deferred and now needs to be deferred again). Use this action to temporarily suspend a task for a specified amount of time (for example if you are waiting for something).

Actions.Name: Delete Orchestrator automation task
Actions.Description: Delete an Orchestrator automation task that has been deferred.

Actions.Name: Get all Orchestrator automation tasks
Actions.Description: Retrieves all the Orchestrator automation tasks that match the filters.

Actions.Name: Get next Orchestrator automation task
Actions.Description: Retrieves the next Orchestrator automation task matching the given search critieria.

Actions.Name: Get Orchestrator automation task
Actions.Description: Retrieves a specfic Orchestrator automation task.

Actions.Name: Turn mouse wheel
Actions.Description: Turns the mouse wheel (positive or negative notches) in the IA-Connect Agent user session.

Actions.Name: UnZIP file
Actions.Description: Unzips a file which has been compressed using ZIP compression.

Actions.Name: Update Orchestrator Flow stats result
Actions.Description: Update the result statistics for the current Worker Flow in the IA-Connect Orchestrator. This is used to modify the final result of a Flow stat in the IA-Connect Orchestator which is typically used for reporting purposes. This only works for the current Flow (the Orchestrator detects the Flow run Id). You cannot modify the stats for any other Flow.

Actions.Name: Wait for IA-Connect session to close by name
Actions.Description: Waits for the specified IA-Connect Director session to close. This is the session into which commands to an IA-Connect Agent are sent. The name will be known from an earlier 'Attach' action.

Actions.Name: Wait for IA-Connect next hop session to connect
Actions.Description: Waits for the next hop session to connect and for the IA-Connect Agent to be running in the next hop session.

Actions.Name: Wiggle mouse
Actions.Description: Moves the mouse back and forth by the specified number of coordinates.

Actions.Name: Mark Flow as complete
Actions.Description: Mark a Flow as complete, which informs the IA-Connect Orchestrator that the assigned worker machine is now available to process other Flows.

Actions.Name: Write to CSV file
Actions.Description: Creates a CSV file on the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running. The CSV file is created from a collection (table) or from a table in JSON format.

Actions.Name: Write text file
Actions.Description: Creates a text file on the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running and writes text into the file.

Actions.Name: Check UIA element
Actions.Description: Sets the state of an element (typically a checkbox or radio box) to either checked or unchecked.

Actions.Name: Check multiple UIA elements
Actions.Description: Sets the state of multiple elements (typically a checkbox or radio box) to either checked or unchecked.

Actions.Name: Click UIA list element item by index
Actions.Description: Clicks the list element that matches the specified index. This is typically used to select an item in a dropdown / menu item.

Actions.Name: Click UIA list element item by name
Actions.Description: Clicks the list element with the specified name. This is typically used to select an item in a dropdown / menu item.

Actions.Name: Close UIA element window
Actions.Description: Closes the element window. Typically only works on windows or dialogs.

Actions.Name: Collapse UIA element
Actions.Description: Collapses an element (typically a menu / dropdown item). If the item is already collapsed, nothing will happen.

Actions.Name: Does UIA desktop element exist
Actions.Description: Reports whether a desktop element exists and provides some basic element properties.

Actions.Name: Does UIA element exist
Actions.Description: Reports whether an element exists and returns some basic element properties.

Actions.Name: Does process have Win32 window
Actions.Description: A simple and fast Win32 action which reports whether a process (specified by name) has any visible windows. The window must exist: IA-Connect will not wait. It is recommended to use the action 'Wait for desktop element' which is more powerful.

Actions.Name: Does top level Win32 window exist
Actions.Description: A simple and fast Win32 action which reports whether a top-level window exists. A top-level window is one that is directly connected to the desktop.  The window must exist: IA-Connect will not wait. It is recommended to use the action 'Wait for desktop element' which is more powerful.

Actions.Name: Draw rectangle around UIA element
Actions.Description: Draws a rectangle around the perimeter of an element to aid in identifying that the element found is the one required. The rectangle is automatically removed after 5 seconds.

Actions.Name: Expand UIA element
Actions.Description: Expands an element (typically a menu / dropdown item). If the item is already expanded, nothing will happen.

Actions.Name: Focus UIA element
Actions.Description: Focusses an element which makes it the active element for keyboard focus and, depending on the application, may bring the element window to the foreground.

Actions.Name: Get UIA datagrid element contents
Actions.Description: Returns the contents of a DataGrid element. This is an element with rows, columns, header and cells (i.e. a table).

Actions.Name: Get UIA datagrid element properties
Actions.Description: Returns table properties of a DataGrid element. This is an element with rows, columns, header and cells (i.e. a table).

Actions.Name: Get UIA desktop elements
Actions.Description: Returns a list of all windows and dialogs on the desktop.

Actions.Name: Get UIA element at screen coordinates
Actions.Description: Returns the UIA element located at the given screen coordinates.

Actions.Name: Get UIA element label value
Actions.Description: Returns the value of the label on the element.

Actions.Name: Get UIA element properties
Actions.Description: Returns all properties of an element. This can be useful if you are uncertain which field holds the property values required.

Actions.Name: Get UIA element properties as list
Actions.Description: Returns the properties of an element as a single line list (single line collection / data table) instead of individual items, this maybe useful depending on how you intend to use the data.

Actions.Name: Get UIA element text value
Actions.Description: Returns the text value of an element. A text value is usually associated with a label, but many elements can have this property.

Actions.Name: Get UIA element value
Actions.Description: Returns the value of an element. A value is usually associated with a text input area, but many elements can have this property.

Actions.Name: Get UIA handle for desktop
Actions.Description: Returns a handle for the desktop. This is an obsolete action because the handle '-2' can be used to refer to the desktop element but also because there are plenty of actions which can search relative to the desktop (e.g 'wait for desktop element').

Actions.Name: Get UIA handle for focussed element
Actions.Description: Returns a handle for the currently focused UIA element.

Actions.Name: Get UIA handle for main window of focussed element
Actions.Description: Returns a handle for the main window of the currently focused UIA element.  The 'Main' window is typically the main application window: a login dialog or sub-window is generally not the 'Main' window.

Actions.Name: Get UIA handle for process Id main window
Actions.Description: A simple and fast Win32 action which returns the handle for any main window of a process (specified by Process ID). The 'Main' window is typically the main application window: a login dialog or sub-window is generally not the 'Main' window. It is recommended to use the action 'Wait for desktop element' which is more powerful.

Actions.Name: Get UIA handle for process main window
Actions.Description: A simple and fast Win32 action which returns the handle for any main window of a process (specified by name). The 'Main' window is typically the main application window: a login dialog or sub-window is generally not the 'Main' window.  The window must exist: IA-Connect will not wait. It is recommended to use the action 'Wait for desktop element' which is more powerful.

Actions.Name: Get UIA handle for top level Win32 window
Actions.Description: A simple and fast Win32 action which returns the handle for any top-level window which has the specified class name or window title. A top-level window is one that is directly connected to the desktop.  The window must exist: IA-Connect will not wait. It is recommended to use the action 'Wait for desktop element' which is more powerful.

Actions.Name: Get UIA list element items
Actions.Description: Returns a list of child element items found under the specified element (typically dropdown / menu items).

Actions.Name: Get multiple UIA element properties
Actions.Description: Returns the properties of multiple elements. This can be useful if you are uncertain which fields holds the property values required.

Actions.Name: Get multiple UIA elements as table
Actions.Description: Enumerates the values of child elements of a specified parent element and returns in a table format. This can be used to returns 'Tables' of data which aren't technically tables.

Actions.Name: Get multiple UIA parent element properties
Actions.Description: Returns a hierarchal tree of parent elements of the specified element, all the way up to the desktop (root level). The parent element is defined as the element which is at the next level up the UIA 'tree' and is almost always a containing element.

Actions.Name: Get UIA parent element handle
Actions.Description: Returns a handle for the parent element of the specified element. The parent element is defined as the element which is at the next level up the UIA 'tree' and is almost always a containing element.

Actions.Name: Global double left mouse click on UIA element
Actions.Description: Moves the mouse to the centre of an element and double clicks the left mouse button.

Actions.Name: Global middle mouse click on UIA element
Actions.Description: Moves the mouse to the centre of an element and clicks the middle mouse button.

Actions.Name: Global left mouse click on UIA element
Actions.Description: Moves the mouse to the centre of an element and clicks the left mouse button.

Actions.Name: Global input password into UIA element
Actions.Description: Moves the mouse to centre of the element, focusses it, left clicks, and presses keys. Typically used with a password input that will not accept native UIA input methods.

Actions.Name: Global right mouse click on UIA element
Actions.Description: Moves the mouse to the centre of an element and clicks the right mouse button.

Actions.Name: Global input text into UIA element
Actions.Description: Moves the mouse to centre of the element, focusses it, left clicks, and presses keys. Typically used with a text input that will not accept native UIA input methods.

Actions.Name: Input password into UIA element
Actions.Description: UIA action which inputs a password into an element (typically a password entry field), replacing the existing text.

Actions.Name: Input return into UIA element
Actions.Description: Inputs a Windows return / new line () into an element (typically a text entry field), either replacing the existing text or inserting the return at a specific position.

Actions.Name: Input text into UIA element
Actions.Description: UIA action which inputs text into an element (typically a text entry field), either replacing the existing text or inserting the new value at a specific position.

Actions.Name: Input text into multiple UIA elements
Actions.Description: UIA Action which inputs different pieces of text into multiple elements (typically text entry fields), either replacing the existing text or inserting the new value at a specific position.

Actions.Name: Is UIA element checked
Actions.Description: This action returns true or false indicating whether an element (typically a checkbox or radio box) is checked.

Actions.Name: Maximise UIA window
Actions.Description: Maximises the window with the specified UIA handle.

Actions.Name: Minimise UIA window
Actions.Description: Minimises the window with the specified UIA handle.

Actions.Name: Press UIA element
Actions.Description: Presses an element (typically a button).

Actions.Name: Reset all UIA element handles
Actions.Description: Resets all UIA element handles currently stored by IA-Connect which can be useful if you have been identifying a lot of elements and have a large number of element handles stored. In scenarios with extremely high numbers of element handles (100,000+) this action can also be used to free up RAM usage.

Actions.Name: Search for first UIA parent element
Actions.Description: Searches up the UIA tree hierarchy for the first parent element which matches the search criteria. The parent element is defined as the element which is at the next level up the UIA 'tree' and is almost always a containing element.

Actions.Name: Select UIA element
Actions.Description: Selects an element (typically an item in a list or drop-down).

Actions.Name: Set UIA element to numeric range value
Actions.Description: Sets the value of the element which has a numeric range, for example a scrollbar.

Actions.Name: Set UIA element to numeric value
Actions.Description: Sets the value of the element which has a numeric input, for example a text field or a scrollbar.

Actions.Name: Set foreground UIA window
Actions.Description: Brings a window to the foreground.

Actions.Name: Set UIA transaction timeout
Actions.Description: Controls how long the UIA API will wait for an application to return the information about an element. This transaction timeout would typically only be reached if the application was non-responsive.
