Actions.Name: Set UIA window to normal
Actions.Description: Normalises the window with the specified UIA handle (i.e. sets it to a normal sized window instead of minimised or maximised).

Actions.Name: Take screenshot of UIA element location
Actions.Description: Takes a screenshot of the location of an element and returns an image. The element should be brought to the front first as the screenshot is taking a copy of the screen at the elements location.

Actions.Name: Toggle UIA element
Actions.Description: Toggles an element (typically a checkbox or a radio box). This gives the element the opposite state to its current state (e.g. checked becomes unchecked and vice-versa). If you want to set a specific state, use the action 'Check element' instead.

Actions.Name: Wait for UIA desktop element
Actions.Description: Waits for a desktop element (typically a window) to exist.

Actions.Name: Wait for UIA desktop element to not exist
Actions.Description: Waits for a desktop element (typically a window) to no longer exist.

Actions.Name: Wait for UIA element
Actions.Description: Waits for an element (typically an individual element within a window such as a button or a text input area) to exist.

Actions.Name: Wait for UIA element to not exist
Actions.Description: Waits for an element (typically an individual element within a window such as a button or a text input area) to no longer exist.

Actions.Name: Wait for UIA process Id main window
Actions.Description: A simple and fast Win32 action which waits for a main window of a process (specified by Process ID) to exist and returns a handle. The 'Main' window is typically the main application window: a login dialog or sub-window is generally not the 'Main' window. It is recommended to use the action 'Wait for desktop element' which is more powerful.

Actions.Name: Wait for UIA process main window
Actions.Description: A simple and fast Win32 action which waits for a specified time for the main window of a process (specified by name) to exist before returning a handle. The 'Main' window is typically the main application window: a login dialog or sub-window is generally not the 'Main' window. It is recommended to use the action 'Wait for desktop element' which is more powerful.

Actions.Name: Wait for UIA top level Win32 window
Actions.Description: A simple and fast Win32 action which waits for a specified time for a top-level window to exist before returning a handle. A top-level window is one that is directly connected to the desktop. It is recommended to use the action 'Wait for desktop element' which is more powerful.

Actions.Name: Check web element
Actions.Description: Checks / ticks a HTML element (typically a checkbox or radio box).

Actions.Name: Check multiple web elements
Actions.Description: Checks / ticks multiple HTML elements (typically a checkbox or radio box).

Actions.Name: Clear all web element text
Actions.Description: Clears all existing text from a web element.

Actions.Name: Click web element
Actions.Description: Clicks an element (typically a button or hyperlink) in the web browser.

Actions.Name: Close active web browser tab
Actions.Description: Closes the current active browser tab. After calling this action the IA-Connect Agent will not switch to a new active tab by default. To re-attach to another tab you will need to the call 'Set browser tab' action before attempting to interact with the page.

Actions.Name: Close Google Chrome browser
Actions.Description: Closes the Google Chrome web browser which was opened using the 'Open Chrome' action.

Actions.Name: Close Chromium Edge browser
Actions.Description: Closes the Chromium Edge browser which was opened using the 'Open Chromium Edge' action.

Actions.Name: Close Internet Explorer browser
Actions.Description: Closes the Internet Explorer browser which was opened using the 'Open Internet Explorer' action.

Actions.Name: Copy selected text on web element
Actions.Description: Copies all of the currently selected text from a web element into the clipboard.

Actions.Name: Create handle to web element
Actions.Description: Creates a handle to a HTML element. This handle can be used to automate child HTML elements.

Actions.Name: Create handle to parent web element
Actions.Description: Creates a handle to a HTML elements parent.

Actions.Name: Deselect all items in web selection list
Actions.Description: Deselects all currently selected options in a select element that supports multi-select.

Actions.Name: Deselect web selection list item
Actions.Description: Deselects an option on a select HTML element, either by Text, Value or Index. The text, value or index of each option in a selection can be discovered using the 'Get selection properties' action.

Actions.Name: Does web element exist
Actions.Description: Reports whether a HTML element currently exists. This action does not wait for the HTML element.

Actions.Name: Download suitable ChromeDriver from Internet
Actions.Description: Determines which version of ChromeDriver is suitable for the installed version of Google Chrome in the session where the IA-Connect Agent is running, checks if a suitable version is already downloaded and, if not, attempts to download a suitable version from Google's ChromeDriver Internet web page.

Actions.Name: Download suitable Chromium Edge driver from Internet
Actions.Description: Determines which version of Chromium Edge driver is suitable for the installed version of Chromium Edge browser in the session where the IA-Connect Agent is running, checks if a suitable version is already downloaded and, if not, attempts to download a suitable version from the Chromium Edge driver web page.

Actions.Name: Draw rectangle around web element
Actions.Description: Draws a rectangle around the perimeter of a HTML element to aid in identifying that the element found is the one required. The rectangle is automatically removed after 5 seconds.

Actions.Name: Execute JavaScript in webpage
Actions.Description: Executes the provided JavaScript code in the web page.

Actions.Name: Execute JavaScript on web element
Actions.Description: Executes the provided JavaScript code on the selected HTML element.

Actions.Name: Focus web element
Actions.Description: Focusses an HTML element. This makes the element the active element for keyboard focus and may bring the element to the foreground.

Actions.Name: Fullscreen active browser
Actions.Description: Sets the web browser to full screen so the website occupies the entire screen (hides the browser navigation toolbar, address bar, start bar etc).

Actions.Name: Get browser parent window details
Actions.Description: Returns properties of the browser parent window that the IA-Connect Agent is currently interacting with.

Actions.Name: Get Google Chrome EXE version from file
Actions.Description: Gets the version of Google Chrome installed in the session where the Agent is running.

Actions.Name: Get ChromeDriver folder
Actions.Description: Gets the ChromeDriver folder path for the ChromeDriver version that is used with the current Chrome EXE version. This is used by the 'Open Chrome' action and it is unlikely that you would need to call this directly.

Actions.Name: Get Chromium Edge EXE version from file
Actions.Description: Gets the version of Chromium Edge installed in the session where the Agent is running.

Actions.Name: Get Chromium Edge driver folder
Actions.Description: Gets the ChromiumEdgeDriver folder path for the ChromiumEdgeDriver version that is used with the current Chromium Edge EXE version. This is used by the 'Open Chromium Edge' action and it is unlikely that you would need to call this directly.

Actions.Name: Get current webpage frame window pixel coordinate
Actions.Description: Returns the pixel coordinates of the current HTML frame, relative to the browser document window (the area which displays the webpage).

Actions.Name: Get web element bounding rectangle
Actions.Description: Returns the pixel coordinates of the left, right, top, and bottom edges of the HTML element relative to the browser document window (the area which displays the webpage).

Actions.Name: Get web element children properties
Actions.Description: Gets the properties of the child elements of the matching HTML element.

Actions.Name: Get web element parents properties
Actions.Description: Gets the properties of the parent elements of the matching HTML element.

Actions.Name: Get web element properties
Actions.Description: Gets the properties of a HTML element.

Actions.Name: Get web element screen bounding rect
Actions.Description: Returns the pixel coordinates of the left, right, top, and bottom edges of the HTML element relative to the sessions screen.

Actions.Name: Get multiple web element properties
Actions.Description: Gets the properties of all HTML elements that matches search criteria.

Actions.Name: Get webpage text
Actions.Description: Gets all the text on the current page by selecting the entire browser page, copying it into the clipboard in the session where the IA-Connect Agent is running and then returning the clipboard contents.

Actions.Name: Get web selection list properties
Actions.Description: Returns all the options of a select HTML element and their properties.

Actions.Name: Get web table contents
Actions.Description: Returns the contents of a HTML table element.

Actions.Name: Get web browser tabs
Actions.Description: Returns the current tabs that are open in the browser window.

Actions.Name: Global mouse left click on web element
Actions.Description: Moves the mouse to the centre of an HTML element and presses the left mouse button. This is sometimes used instead of 'Click element' in scenarios where the element expects the mouse to be over the element before you press it.

Actions.Name: Global mouse right click on web element
Actions.Description: Moves the mouse to the centre of an HTML element and presses the right mouse button. This is sometimes used instead of 'Click element' in scenarios where the element expects the mouse to be over the element before you press it.

Actions.Name: Input password into web element
Actions.Description: Inputs a password into a HTML element (typically a text input field), either replacing the existing value or appending the new value to any existing value.

Actions.Name: Input text into web element
Actions.Description: Inputs text into a HTML element (typically a text input field), either replacing the existing text or appending the new value to any existing value.

Actions.Name: Input text into multiple web elements
Actions.Description: Inputs text into multiple HTML elements (typically text input fields), either replacing the existing text or appending the new value to any existing value.

Actions.Name: Is suitable remote ChromeDriver available
Actions.Description: Searches for a suitable version of ChromeDriver for the installed version of Google Chrome in the session where the IA-Connect Agent is running.

Actions.Name: Is suitable remote Chromium Edge driver available
Actions.Description: Searches for a suitable version of ChromiumEdgeDriver for the installed version of Chromium Edge in the session where the Agent is running.

Actions.Name: JavaScript simulate click on web element
Actions.Description: Simulates a mouse action by telling the browser's JavaScript engine to perform a left click. This is an alternative to the action 'Simulate mouse left click on element' and is usually sufficient for the web page to react as expected.

Actions.Name: Maximise active browser
Actions.Description: Maximises the web browser currently being controlled (the last browser opened using a browser 'Open' action).

Actions.Name: Minimise active browser
Actions.Description: Minimises the web browser currently being controlled (the last browser opened using a browser 'Open' action).

Actions.Name: Simulate mouse left click on web element
Actions.Description: Simulates a mouse action by telling the browser that a mouse left click action was performed. This is usually sufficient for the web page to react as expected. If this fails, consider using 'Global mouse left click on element' which moves the mouse and clicks in exactly the same way as a user would.

Actions.Name: Simulate mouse right click on web element
Actions.Description: Simulates a mouse action by telling the browser that a mouse right click action was performed. This is usually sufficient for the web page to react as expected. If this fails, consider using 'Global mouse right click on element' which moves the mouse and clicks in exactly the same way as a user would.

Actions.Name: Navigate active browser to URL
Actions.Description: Navigates the browser to the provided URL. IA-Connect will wait for the page to load before returning.

Actions.Name: Normalise active browser
Actions.Description: Normalises the browser window by resizing window to the provided dimensions and moving the window to the provided coordinates.

Actions.Name: Open Google Chrome browser
Actions.Description: Opens the Google Chrome web browser, allowing it to to be automated using the actions in this IA-Connect module. If the web browser was opened manually, by another application or using the 'Run Process' action then it can only be automated using UIA actions and not by the actions in this IA-Connect module.

Actions.Name: Open Chromium Edge browser
Actions.Description: Opens the Chromium Edge web browser, allowing it to to be automated using the actions in this IA-Connect module. If the web browser was opened manually, by another application or using the 'Run Process' action then it can only be automated using UIA actions and not by the actions in this IA-Connect module.

Actions.Name: Open Internet Explorer browser
Actions.Description: Opens the Internet Explorer web browser, allowing it to to be automated using the actions in this IA-Connect module. If the web browser was opened manually, by another application or using the 'Run Process' action then it can only be automated using UIA actions and not by the actions in this IA-Connect module.

Actions.Name: Open new web browser tab
Actions.Description: Opens a new tab in the browser window. In Internet Explorer, this action opens a new window but the new window behaves as a tab and can be interacted with in the same way as a tab with the 'Get browser tabs' or 'Set browser tab' actions.

Actions.Name: Paste into web element
Actions.Description: Pastes the contents of the clipboard into a HTML element (typically a text input field).

Actions.Name: Press CTRL key on web element
Actions.Description: Presses the CTRL key on a HTML element. This can be used with the 'Control key' parameter to perform shortcuts such as Ctrl-a (Select all), Ctrl-c (Copy), Ctrl-x (Cut) or Ctrl-v (Paste).

Actions.Name: Press enter on web element
Actions.Description: Presses the enter key on an HTML element. This can be used to submit the element or in some cases to interact with buttons.

Actions.Name: Print the current web page
Actions.Description: Prints the current web page.

Actions.Name: Refresh current webpage in active browser
Actions.Description: Refreshes the current browser page.

Actions.Name: Reset all web element handles
Actions.Description: Resets all web element handles that are currently held by the IA-Connect Agent. This action is generally used for memory clean-up and is only recommended for use in large complex processes which will result in high numbers of element handles (10,000+) being stored.

Actions.Name: Reset browser webpage frame stack
Actions.Description: Resets the browser frame stack. This should only be used if approved by Ultima Technical Support.

Actions.Name: Save webpage to file
Actions.Description: Saves the current HTML page to a file on disk.

Actions.Name: Scroll web element into view
Actions.Description: Scrolls the web page up, down, left or right until the HTML element is on screen.

Actions.Name: Scroll browser window by pixels
Actions.Description: Scrolls the browser window by the specified number of pixels.

Actions.Name: Scroll browser window to pixels
Actions.Description: Scrolls the browser window to the specified pixel coordinates.

Actions.Name: Select all on a web element
Actions.Description: Selects all of the contents of a HTML element (typically a text field).

Actions.Name: Select web selection list item
Actions.Description: Selects an option on a select HTML element, either by Text, Value or Index. The text, value or index of each option in a selection can be discovered using the 'Get selection properties' action.

Actions.Name: Set web browser tab
Actions.Description: Sets the active tab and switches the IA-Connect Agent to control this tab so that it can interact with it.

Actions.Name: Set browser timeouts
Actions.Description: Sets the internal timeouts that IA-Connect uses when interacting with the web browser.

Actions.Name: Set active browser window position
Actions.Description: Moves the browser window to the pixel coordinates specified.

Actions.Name: Set active browser window size
Actions.Description: Resizes the browser window to the width and height dimensions specified.

Actions.Name: Submit web element
Actions.Description: Submits a HTML element. This is typically performed on any input element in a form element and will cause the form to be submitted.

Actions.Name: Switch to webpage frame
Actions.Description: Switches the IA-Connect Agent to controlling or interacting with an alternative frame within a browser page.

Actions.Name: Switch to webpage parent frame
Actions.Description: Switches the IA-Connect Agent to controlling or interacting with the parent frame of the current frame within a web page.

Actions.Name: Switch to webpage root frame
Actions.Description: Switches the IA-Connect Agent to controlling or interacting with the root frame within a web page.

Actions.Name: Upload new ChromeDriver
Actions.Description: Uploads a new version of ChromeDriver from the local system (the digital worker) to the IA-Connect Agent session to be used with Google Chrome.

Actions.Name: Upload new Chromium Edge driver
Actions.Description: Uploads a new version of ChromiumEdgeDriver from the local system (the digital worker) to the IA-Connect Agent session to be used with Chromium Edge.

Actions.Name: Set the archived state of an inspection
Actions.Description: Choose 'Yes' to archive the inspection and 'No' to restore the archived inspection.

Actions.Name: Create an action
Actions.Description: Create a new action

Actions.Name: Generate a link to an inspection [DEPRECATED]
Actions.Description: Generate a link to a specific inspection that opens in iAuditor/SafetyCulture.

Actions.Name: Delete an action
Actions.Description: Delete an existing action

Actions.Name: Disable an inspection web report link
Actions.Description: Disable the web report link to an inspection.

Actions.Name: Get a specific inspection
Actions.Description: Retrieve the full data of an inspection.

Actions.Name: Download an audit report (legacy)
Actions.Description: Download the audit report submitted earlier.

Actions.Name: Get an inspection media
Actions.Description: Get a media file from an inspection

Actions.Name: Retrieve an inspection web report link
Actions.Description: If a link has previously been generated for this inspection, it is returned. Otherwise a new link is generated.

Actions.Name: Export an audit report (legacy)
Actions.Description: Submit an export request for an audit into the format passed as a query parameter.

Actions.Name: Export an inspection report
Actions.Description: Submit an export request for an inspection report in the selected format.

Actions.Name: Check the status of the export request submitted earlier (legacy)
Actions.Description: Check whether the download report submitted earlier is ready for download.

Actions.Name: Check inspection export status
Actions.Description: Check the inspection export status.

Actions.Name: Search actions
Actions.Description: Find actions related based upon their status, priority, assignees, item, inspection and more.

Actions.Name: Search modified inspections
Actions.Description: Retrieve the list of inspections filtered by dates, template, completion status and more.

Actions.Name: Update an action
Actions.Description: Update an existing action

Actions.Name: Runs a mainframe program over a TN3270 connection
Actions.Description: Access a definition file to call a program on a mainframe via TN3270. The definition file must be created by a separate Microsoft design tool and uploaded to an Azure Integration Account.

Actions.Name: Fetch a dad joke
Actions.Description: Fetch a dad joke by Joke ID

Actions.Name: Fetch a random dad joke
Actions.Description: Fetch a random dad joke from icanhazdadjoke.com

Actions.Name: Search for dad jokes
Actions.Description: Search for dad jokes

Actions.Name: List books
Actions.Description: Returns a list of books.

Actions.Name: Get book
Actions.Description: Returns a specific book.

Actions.Name: List characters
Actions.Description: Returns a list of characters.

Actions.Name: Get a character
Actions.Description: Returns a specific character.

Actions.Name: List houses
Actions.Description: Returns a list of houses.

Actions.Name: Get a house
Actions.Description: Returns a specific house.

Actions.Name: Get favicon
Actions.Description: Retrieve the best available favicon. A backup image is returned if no favicon is available.

Actions.Name: Add Image To Vault
Actions.Description: You can upload an image and add it to an existing vault entry by making HTTP POST request.

Actions.Name: Creating DocuPass Session
Actions.Description: You can create a verification session for every user requiring identity verification.

Actions.Name: Creating DocuPass Signature Session
Actions.Description: You can create a signature session where user will review and e-sign legal document without identity verification. If you want to perform both identity verification and have your user sign some document, please create an identity verification session instead.

Actions.Name: Delete Image From Vault
Actions.Description: You can delete an image inside a vault entry by making HTTP POST request. Note that after an image is deleted, the URL to the image may still be accessible for a short-period of time due to caching.

Actions.Name: Delete Entry From Vault
Actions.Description: You can delete single or multiple vault entries by making HTTP POST request.

Actions.Name: Face Search
Actions.Description: Face search allows you to search the entire vault using an image of a person. To use face search feature, you must enable face search indexing under web portal, and train your vault datasets periodically.

Actions.Name: Face Search Training
Actions.Description: Before performing face search, you must issue a train command to train the document datasets inside your vault. You may also train your vault data through web portal.  The training task is asynchronous, training time depends on the number of vault entries and images. It could take from several seconds to an hour.

Actions.Name: Get Vault Entry Content
Actions.Description: When entries are added to the vault, both Core API and DocuPass API will return a vault entry identifier named vaultid. You can use the identifier to query the content of an entry in the vault by submitting an HTTP POST request to the following endpoint.

Actions.Name: List and Filter Entries
Actions.Description: To list all the entries stored inside the vault or search for entries with specific values, send an HTTP POST request to the following endpoint.

Actions.Name: Searching AML Database
Actions.Description: AML API allows you to search ID Analyzer global AML database for sanctions, PEPs and wanted criminals using either a name, document number or both. You may further filter the results with birthday and nationality.

Actions.Name: Core API Setting
Actions.Description: Multi-function ID verification API to verify remote physical document, its authenticity and face match the document with your user photo.

Actions.Name: Training Status
Actions.Description: Check whether vault training is still ongoing or has completed.

Actions.Name: Update Vault Entry
Actions.Description: You can update the value of a single field or values of multiple fields in a vault entry by making HTTP POST request.

Actions.Name: Validating Callback
Actions.Description: To make sure the data was sent from our server.

Actions.Name: Retrieve Email address reputation data
Actions.Description: This API provides real-time email address reputation scoring and validation with hundreds of syntax & DNS checks. The API can be leveraged to determine if the email address inbox exists with the mail service provider and is able to accept new messages. In addition, users can determine if the email address has a poor reputation or has recently been associated with abuse or threats. Additional risk scoring can detect disposable and temporary mail services as well as emails with a history of fraudulent behavior online.

Actions.Name: Retrieve IP address reputation data
Actions.Description: This service performs real-time lookups to instantly determine how risky a user, click, or transaction is based on an IP address and optional device information. In addition to analyzing if the IP address is a proxy or VPN, the API returns over 20 relevant data points such as Geo location data, ISP, Connection type, Device details, Recent reputation activity, Overall fraud score, Status as a proxy, VPN, or TOR connection, Abuse Velocity, Other similar data points to classify reputation and risk.

Actions.Name: Retrieve Phone Number reputation data
Actions.Description: Accurately verify phone numbers worldwide and retrieve a combination of carrier and line type details with risk analysis data to assess phone number reputation. IPQS collects phone validation and verification data from a wide variety of carriers and tier 1 telecommunication providers, with support for all regions. Detect inactive and disconnected phone numbers for easy user validation similar to HLR & LRN lookups. Accurately identify virtual and disposable phone numbers along with numbers associated with abusive behavior online.

Actions.Name: Retrieve URL (or) Domain reputation data
Actions.Description: Scans links and domains in real-time to detect suspicious URLs using trusted machine learning models. These machine learning models can accurately identify phishing links, malware URLs, viruses, parked domains, and suspicious URLs with real-time risk scores. In addition, the machine learning models can confidently classify poor reputation domains, suspicious links, and phishing URLs with a real-time API integration. Features such as parking domain detection, domain spam scores, reputation checks, and domain age, elevates URL intelligence to a whole new level.

Actions.Name: Create a Flexible Asset Type
Actions.Description: Creates a new flexible asset type in your account. Returns the created object if successful. Use the nested Fields array to add one or more flexible asset fields to a flexible asset type. Creating a new flexible asset type requires a)at least the first field to be defined in the nested Fields array (located under advanced); b) at least one field needs to be set as Use for Title; and c) one field set as Show in List. Failure to meet all three criteria will generate an error 422.

Actions.Description: Triggered when your translation project is completed. Register project status webhook here.

Actions.Name: Drug Adverse Event
Actions.Description: The openFDA drug adverse event API returns data that has been collected from the FDA Adverse Event Reporting System (FAERS), a database that contains information on adverse event and medication error reports submitted to FDA.

Actions.Name: Drug Enforcement
Actions.Description: The openFDA drug enforcement reports API returns data from the FDA Recall Enterprise System (RES), a database that contains information on recall event information submitted to FDA. Currently, this data covers publicly releasable records from 2004-present. The data is updated weekly.

Actions.Name: Drug Labeling
Actions.Description: Drug manufacturers and distributors submit documentation about their products to FDA in the Structured Product Labeling (SPL) format. The openFDA drug product labeling API returns data from this dataset.

Actions.Name: Drug NDC
Actions.Description: The openFDA drug NDC Directory endpoint returns data from the NDC Directory, a database that contains information on the National Drug Code (NDC). FDA publishes the listed NDC numbers and the information submitted as part of the listing information in the NDC Directory which is updated daily.

Actions.Name: DrugsFDA
Actions.Description: DrugsFDA includes most of the drug products approved since 1939. The majority of patient information, labels, approval letters, reviews, and other information are available for drug products approved since 1998.

Actions.Name: Retrieves full corporate tree of subsidiaries
Actions.Description: The Corporate Tree API call allows a user to retrieve full corporate tree of subsidiaries for a given company, starting from its ultimate parent company. The input to the Corporate Tree call is the Orb Number of the target company (mandatory field).

Actions.Name: Obtain a full company profile from the Orb database
Actions.Description: The Fetch API call allows a user to obtain a full company profile from the Orb database, based on an Orb Number. The Orb Number for a company record can be obtained from a choosing a candidate from the Match call or from a previously identified matched record. The Fetch API call will return back all the standard fields in the Orb database for a single company record that corresponds to the Orb Number.

Actions.Name: Retrieves a list of companies similar to a target company
Actions.Description: The Lookalike API call allows a user to retrieve a list of companies similar to a target company. The input to the Lookalike call are the Orb Number of the target company.

Actions.Name: The Match API call performs a candidate retrieval process
Actions.Description: The Match API call performs a candidate retrieval process; the process by which Orb records are identified as potential matches to the query. The input fields must either include the name and country, or the website/email, or the EIN of the company record. All other fields are optional. Users can review the candidates to choose their preferred match based on the candidate with the highest Confidence Score, algorithmically, based on the match mask (for example, take those that match by website, even though the name didn't match) or manually.

Actions.Name: Retrieves a list of companies for the given search criteria
Actions.Description: The Search API call allows a user to retrieve a list of companies for the given search criteria. This enables a user to build out a list of companies for use cases such as building out a list of companies in a specific territory or segment. The input to the Search call are a list of filtering attributes that define the companies in the list. These filters can include the geographic location of the companies (at a city, state or country level), revenue, number of employees and their industry profile (e.g., SIC, NAICS, or Orb's proprietary categories classification).

Actions.Name: Bounding box operation
Actions.Description: Takes two points and creates a bounding box. All addresses within this bounding box are then returned.

Actions.Name: Find Operation
Actions.Description: A free text search designed for quick use e.g. form filling.

Actions.Name: Nearest operation
Actions.Description: Takes a pair of coordinates (X and Y) as an input to determine the closest address.

Actions.Name: Polygon Operation
Actions.Description: A POST Request that takes a geoJSON polygon or multi-polygon object and returns all addresses that are in the object.

Actions.Name: Postcode operation
Actions.Description: A search based on a property's postcode. The minimum for the resource is the area and district e.g. SO16, and will accept a full postcode consisting of the area, district, sector and unit e.g. SO16 0AS

Actions.Name: Radius operation
Actions.Description: Takes a pair of coordinates as the centre for a circle and returns all addresses that are intersected by it.

Actions.Name: UPRN Operation
Actions.Description: A search that takes a Unique Property Reference Number (UPRN) as the search parameter.

Actions.Name: Send file attachments to any URL

Actions.Name: Clone a user token
Actions.Description: Clones the authenticated user token. All applications associated with that token are automatically associated with the new token.

Actions.Name: Copy an app
Actions.Description: Copies the specified application. The new application will have the same schema as the original. See below for additional copy options.

Actions.Name: Create an app
Actions.Description: Creates an application in an account. You must have application creation rights in the respective account. Main properties and application variables can be set with this API.

Actions.Name: Create a field
Actions.Description: Creates a field within a table, including the custom permissions of that field.

Actions.Name: Create a relationship
Actions.Description: Creates a relationship in a table as well as lookup/summary fields. Relationships can only be created for tables within the same app.

Actions.Name: Create a table
Actions.Description: Creates a table in an application.

Actions.Name: Deactivate a user token
Actions.Description: Deactivates the authenticated user token. Once this is done, the user token must be reactivated in the user interface.

Actions.Name: Delete an app
Actions.Description: Deletes an entire application, including all of the tables and data.

Actions.Name: Delete fields
Actions.Description: Deletes one or many fields in a table, based on field id. This will also permanently delete any data or calculations in that field.

Actions.Name: Delete an attachment
Actions.Description: Deletes one file attachment version. Meta-data about files can be retrieved from the /records and /reports endpoints, where applicable. Use those endpoints to get the necessary information to delete file versions.

Actions.Name: Delete records
Actions.Description: Deletes record(s) in a table based on a query. Alternatively, all records in the table can be deleted.

Actions.Name: Delete a relationship
Actions.Description: Use this endpoint to delete an entire relationship, including all lookup and summary fields. The reference field in the relationship will not be deleted.

Actions.Name: Delete a table
Actions.Description: Deletes a specific table in an application, including all of the data within it.

Actions.Name: Delete a user token
Actions.Description: Deletes the authenticated user token. This is not reversible.

Actions.Name: Download an attachment
Actions.Description: Downloads the file attachment, with the file attachment content encoded in base64 format. The API response returns the file name in the Content-Disposition header. Meta-data about files can be retrieved from the /records and /reports endpoints, where applicable. Use those endpoints to get the necessary information to fetch files.

Actions.Name: Get an app
Actions.Description: Returns the main properties of an application, including application variables.

Actions.Name: Get app events
Actions.Description: Get a list of events that can be triggered based on data or user actions in this application, includes: Email notification, Reminders, Subscriptions, QB Actions, Webhooks, record change triggered Automations (does not include scheduled).

Actions.Name: Get tables for an app
Actions.Description: Gets a list of all the tables that exist in a specific application. The properties for each table are the same as what is returned in Get table.

Actions.Name: Get field
Actions.Description:
Gets the properties of an individual field, based on field id.
Properties present on all field types are returned at the top level. Properties unique to a specific type of field are returned under the 'properties' attribute. Please see Field types page for more details on the properties for each field type.

Actions.Name: Get fields for a table
Actions.Description: Gets the properties for all fields in a specific table. The properties for each field are the same as in Get field.

Actions.Name: Get usage for all fields
Actions.Description: Get all the field usage statistics for a table. This is a summary of the information that can be found in the usage table of field properties.

Actions.Name: Get a field usage
Actions.Description: Get a single fields usage statistics. This is a summary of the information that can be found in the usage table of field properties.

Actions.Name: Get all relationships
Actions.Description: Get a list of all relationships, and their definitions, for a specific table. Details are provided for both the parent and child sides of relationships within a given application. Limited details are returned for cross-application relationships.

Actions.Name: Get a report
Actions.Description: Get the schema (properties) of an individual report.

Actions.Name: Get a table
Actions.Description: Gets the properties of an individual table that is part of an application.

Actions.Name: Get all table reports
Actions.Description: Get the schema (properties) of all reports for a table. If the user running the API is an application administrator, the API will also return all personal reports with owner's user id.

Actions.Name: Get a temporary token for a DBID
Actions.Description: Use this endpoint to get a temporary authorization token, scoped to either an app or a table. You can then use this token to make other API calls (see authorization).  This token expires in 5 minutes.

Actions.Name: Run a formula
Actions.Description: Allows running a formula via an API call. Use this method in custom code to get the value back of a formula without a discrete field on a record.

Actions.Name: Query for data
Actions.Description: Pass in a query in the Quickbase query language. Returns record data with intelligent pagination based on the approximate size of each record. The metadata object will include the necessary information to iterate over the response and gather more data.

Actions.Name: Run a report
Actions.Description: Runs a report, based on an ID and returns the underlying data associated with it. The format of the data will vary based on the report type. Reports that focus on record-level data (table, calendar, etc.) return the individual records. Aggregate reports (summary, chart) will return the summarized information as configured in the report. UI-specific elements are not returned, such as totals, averages and visualizations. Returns data with intelligent pagination based on the approximate size of each record. The metadata object will include the necessary information to iterate over the response and gather more data.

Actions.Name: Update an app
Actions.Description: Updates the main properties and/or application variables for a specific application. Any properties of the app that you do not specify in the request body will remain unchanged.

Actions.Name: Update a field
Actions.Description: Updates the properties and custom permissions of a field. The attempt to update certain properties might cause existing data to no longer obey the field’s new properties and may be rejected. See the descriptions of required, unique, and choices, below, for specific situations. Any properties of the field that you do not specify in the request body will remain unchanged.

Actions.Name: Update a relationship
Actions.Description: Use this endpoint to add lookup fields and summary fields to an existing relationship. Updating a relationship will not delete existing lookup/summary fields.

Actions.Name: Update a table
Actions.Description: Updates the main properties of a specific table. Any properties of the table that you do not specify in the request body will remain unchanged.

Actions.Name: Insert andor update records
Actions.Description:
Insert and/or update record(s) in a table. In this single API call, inserts and updates can be submitted. Update can use the key field on the table, or any other supported unique field. Refer to the Field types page for more information about how each field type should be formatted. This operation allows for incremental processing of successful records, even when some of the records fail.
Note: This endpoint supports a maximum payload size of 10MB.

Actions.Name: Get Files Signed with Specific Certificate Thumbprint(s)
Actions.Description: This service provides a list of files signed with a particular certificate, specified by its thumbprint.

Actions.Name: Get File Hash Reputation
Actions.Description: This service provides information about the malware status of requested files.

Actions.Name: Get File Hash Analysis Detail
Actions.Description: This service provides analysis results for the requested file.

Actions.Name: Get Similar File Hashes Using Import Hashing Algorithm
Actions.Description: This service provides a list of SHA1 hashes functionally similar to the file associated with the provided import hash (ImpHash).

Actions.Name: Re-Analyze File
Actions.Description: This service provides a means to send file(s) for rescanning.

Actions.Name: Get URI Statistics on Email addresses, IP(s), Domain(s) and URL(s)
Actions.Description: This service provides statistical information on the number of known, malicious, and suspicious file(s) associated with the URI.

Actions.Name: Get specific dynamic analysis report for a file
Actions.Description: This service allows user to download a specific report of a dynamic analysis performed on the file.

Actions.Name: Get merged dynamic analysis report for a file
Actions.Description: This service allows user to download a merged report with an overview of all dynamic analyses performed on the file.

Actions.Name: Get Functionally Similar File Hashes Using ReversingLabs Hash Algorithm
Actions.Description: This service provides a list of SHA1 hashes of files that are functionally similar to the provided file (SHA1 hash) at the selected precision level.

Actions.Name: Get Historic Multi-AV Scan Records
Actions.Description: This service provides historic Multi-AV scan records for a given file hash.

Actions.Name: Get Historic Multi-AV Scan Records - Bulk Request
Actions.Description: This service provides a means to send multiple hashes of files in a single request and provides Multi-AV scan records data for those files.

Actions.Name: Find Files Using Multi-Part Search Criteria
Actions.Description: This service provides a means to acquire a list of hashes that match the provided multi-part search criteria.

Actions.Name: Get File Hash Reputation - Bulk Request
Actions.Description: This service provides a means to send multiple hashes of files in a single request and provides information about the malware status for those files..

Actions.Name: Get File Hash Analysis Detail - Bulk Request
Actions.Description: This service provides a means to send multiple file hashes in a single request and provides analysis results for these file hashes.

Actions.Name: Re-Analyze File - Bulk Request
Actions.Description: This service provides a means to initiate multiple files to be rescanned using a single request.

Actions.Name: Sample file upload
Actions.Description: This services provides a means to upload a file for analysis.

Actions.Name: Sample metadata file upload
Actions.Description: This service provides a means to send metadata for previously successfully uploaded file.

Actions.Name: File dynamic analysis
Actions.Description: This service allows users to detonate a previously uploaded file in the ReversingLabs TitaniumCloud sandbox.

Actions.Name: Analyze URL
Actions.Description: This service enables the submission of a URL for analysis.  ReversingLabs will crawl the URL, identifying files to download and submitting them to our file processing pipeline for classification and enrichment.  A detailed report can then be retrieved using our URL Threat Intelligence API.

Actions.Name: Get URL Threat Intelligence Report
Actions.Description: This service returns threat intelligence data, including reputation from various reputation sources, metadata for performed URL analyses, and the maliciousness of files found on the submitted URL.

Actions.Name: Get Assessment Attempts
Actions.Description: This endpoint returns a detailed report for all developers who have taken the Assessment with the given ID. The scope of the report may be filtered in a number of ways. You may filter results to a given developer by supplying their email address with the query. If a start date is provided, only attempts started or completed after (and including) this date are included. If an end date is provided, only challenges started or completed before this date are included. Providing both indicates a date range to filter on. This includes all the data in the summary report plus details on all the challenges that are a part of the assessment.

Actions.Name: Search Assessment
Actions.Description: This endpoint will return a list of Assessment objects which contain a range of datapoints related to assessments. This includes assessment IDs, which may be used in conjunction with the other assessments API endpoints. Results can be filtered based on status, name, supported language and difficulty.

Actions.Name: Search Assessment Attempts
Actions.Description: This endpoint returns a detailed report for all developers who have taken the Assessment with the given ID. The scope of the report may be filtered in a number of ways. You may filter results to given developer(s) by supplying their email address(es) with the query. If a status is provided, only assessment attempts with specified status are included. If team name(s) provided, only assessment attempts of users within those team(s) are included. If tags(s) is provided, only assessment attempts of users with those tag(s) are included. If a pass_status is provided, only assessment attempts with specified pass_status are included. This includes all the data in the summary report plus details on all the challenges that are a part of the assessment.

Actions.Name: Get Assessments
Actions.Description: This endpoint will return a list of Assessment objects which contain a range of datapoints related to assessments. This includes assessment IDs, which may be used in conjunction with the other assessments API endpoints.

Actions.Name: Add a File [Workspace]
Actions.Description: Adds a new file using a multi-part POST containing the file's metadata and the file contents. Using a multipart/form-data body, send body parts named 'metadata' and 'content'. The metadata should be a JSON object. The content part should contain the bytes of the file.

Actions.Name: Add a File [Library]
Actions.Description: Adds a new file using a multipart/form-data POST containing the file's metadata and the file contents. The metadata part includes required properties such as the name, format, and parentFolderId, but can also include any properties documented in the PATCH /files/:libraryContentId operation. Use the special keyword "root" to add files to the root folder of a teamsite. The content part includes the file's binary content to be uploaded.

Actions.Name: Add or get a contextual folder [Workspace]
Actions.Description:
Creates a contextual folder or gets the workspaceContentId for a contextual folder if it already exists. These contextual folders are identified by the combination of systemType, contextType, contextTypePlural, and contextId.

Caution: Folders Cannot be Deleted!
Any folders created with this API cannot be deleted including the folder for the systemType, contextTypePlural, and contextId, so take extreme caution when using this endpoint.  Any typo in any of these fields will yield invalid non-removable folders.  Each of the values is case sensitive.

Actions.Name: Add a folder [Workspace]
Actions.Description: Adds a new workspace folder inside a given folder. Use the special keywork "root" as the parentFolderId to create a new folder in the user's root.

Actions.Name: Generate a LiveDoc
Actions.Description:
This is where you start a generation, with all the necessary options. Each of the desired outputs must be specified in the "outputs" array. If you do not specify any outputs, this endpoint will return a 4xx error. Note: Generated outputs are only available for download for 24 hours from time of generation
BODY PARAMETER DEFINITIONS
ADHOCINPUTS
Single variables are represented as an object such as:

{"name" : "field name here", "value" : "the value to pass in"}

Adhoc tables are represented as an object with columns and a set of rows such as:

{ "name": "adhoc_4", "value": { "columns": ["StrCol", "IntCol"], "rows": [["hello", 1], ["goodbye", 2]] }

OUTPUTS

imageDpi for PPT and DOC can be set to 0, 96, 120, 144, 200, 300, 400. When set to 0, we will use placeholders rather than rasterized images in place of dynamic images.
layout for PDF can be set to Full Page Slides or Notes Pages to produce slides or note pages
openPassword specifies the password required to open the PDF, if not provided, it will default to no password
ownerPassword specifies the password required to open the PDF as an edit mode owner, if not provided, it will default to no password

Actions.Name: Download LiveDoc output
Actions.Description:
This is where you can download a particular generated output such as a PPTX, DOCX, PDF, or XLSX. This endpoint also supports the
special keywords of "pptx", "docx", "pdf" as special aliases of the generatedOutputId such that you do not need to first get the generatedOutputId
in order to use this endpoint.

Actions.Name: Get status of LiveDoc generation
Actions.Description:
This is where you get the status for a generation process, it will give you the overall status for all underlying steps, but will also provide
a breakdown for the readiness of the underlying assets. For example if you just want the PPTX, you may be able to download that before the PDF is done rendering.

Actions.Name: DOTS Address Geocode International - PlaceSearch
Actions.Description: The PlaceSearch operation returns the latitude and longitude for a given International Address, along with additional address and location information. It will attempt to geocode addresses at the property level, which is often a rooftop coordinate for some properties and then cascade to the next best available resolution such as the street, neighborhood, postal code, locality and so on. For non-address places such as streets, cities and postal codes, the coordinates will return a coordinate point that is commonly associated with the location or a centroid for the area.

Actions.Name: DOTS Address Geocode International - ReverseSearch
Actions.Description: The ReverseSearch operation returns the address or place information for a given set of coordinates, along with additional address and location information. It will attempt to reverse geocode coordinates and return international addresses at the property level, which is often at the premise level resolution for some properties and then cascade to the next best available resolution such as the street, neighborhood, postal code, locality and so on. For non-address places such as streets, cities and postal codes returned by the service, the coordinates output in the response body will represent a coordinate point that is commonly associated with the location or a centroid for the area.

Actions.Name: DOTS Address Validation USA 3- GetBestMatches
Actions.Description: Returns parsed and validated address elements including Delivery Point Validation (DPV), Residential Delivery Indicator (RDI), and Suite data. GetBestMatches will attempt to validate the input address against a CASS approved engine, and make corrections where possible. Multiple address candidates may be returned if a definitive decision cannot be made by the service.

Actions.Name: DOTS Address Validation International - GetAddressInfo
Actions.Description: Our real-time International Address Validation API service verifies and corrects global mailing addresses to the unique requirements of each countrys postal address formats and cultural idiosyncrasies. With continual updates from country-specific postal authorities, our data is always up-to-date with genuine and accurate addresses.

Actions.Name: DOTS IP Address Validation - GetLocationByIP_V4
Actions.Description: Returns geographic location, proxy, host name and US region information for a given IP address.

Actions.Name: DOTS Lead Validation International - ValidateLeadInternational
Actions.Description: DOTS Lead Validation International (LVI) evaluates international lead data and scores the data quality into pass/fail/review categories. By evaluating the information quality of a contact, online marketers can more effectively weed-out fraudulent contacts.Online fraudsters are more likely to provide inaccurate contact information because the address and phone number can be easily traced. Unlike other validation services that perform simple data checks on single variables, Service Objects Lead Validation solution is able to cross-validate that a contact's name, address, phone numbers, e-mail and IP address are all matched each other and are related to the consumer.

Actions.Name: DOTS Phone Exchange International - GetInternationalExchangeInfo
Actions.Description: Our international Phone Exchange service validates and formats phone numbers for international direct dialing, while returning line type, country code and geocoding information.

The trigger relies on the last modified time of a file. If a file is being created by a third-party client, the preservation of the last modified time should be disabled in the client. Actions.Name: Accumulate loyalty points
Actions.Description: Adds points to a loyalty account.

Actions.Name: Adjust loyalty points
Actions.Description: Adds points to or subtracts points from a buyer's account. Use this endpoint only when you need to manually adjust points.

Actions.Name: Calculate loyalty points
Actions.Description: Calculates the points a purchase earns. An application might call this endpoint to show the points that a buyer can earn with the specific purchase.

Actions.Name: Create loyalty account
Actions.Description: Creates a loyalty account.

Actions.Name: Create loyalty reward
Actions.Description: Creates a loyalty reward. After a reward is created, the points are locked and not available for the buyer to redeem another reward.

Actions.Name: Delete loyalty reward
Actions.Description: Deletes a loyalty reward. Returns the loyalty points back to the loyalty account. You cannot delete a reward that has reached the terminal state (REDEEMED).

Actions.Name: Redeem loyalty reward
Actions.Description: Redeems a loyalty reward. After the reward reaches the terminal state, it cannot be deleted. In other words, points used for the reward cannot be returned to the account.

Actions.Name: Retrieve loyalty account
Actions.Description: Retrieves a loyalty account.

Actions.Name: Retrieve loyalty program
Actions.Description: Retrieves the loyalty program in a seller's account, specified by the program ID or the keyword main.  Loyalty programs define how buyers can earn points and redeem points for rewards.

Actions.Name: Retrieve loyalty reward
Actions.Description: Retrieves a loyalty reward.

Actions.Name: Search loyalty accounts
Actions.Description: Searches for loyalty accounts in a loyalty program.

Actions.Name: Search loyalty events
Actions.Description: Searches for loyalty events. A Square loyalty program maintains a ledger of events that occur during the lifetime of a buyer's loyalty account. Each change in the point balance (for example, points earned, points redeemed, and points expired) is recorded in the ledger. Using this endpoint, you can search the ledger for events.

Actions.Name: Search loyalty rewards
Actions.Description: Searches for loyalty rewards in a loyalty account.

Actions.Name: Retrieve merchant
Actions.Description: Retrieve a Merchant object for the given merchant_id.

Actions.Name: Create mobile authorization code
Actions.Description: Generates code to authorize a mobile application to connect to a Square card reader. Authorization codes are one-time-use and expire 60 minutes after being issued.

Actions.Name: List sites
Actions.Description: Lists the Square Online sites that belong to a seller.

Actions.Name: Delete snippet
Actions.Description: Removes your snippet from a Square Online site.

Actions.Name: Retrieve snippet
Actions.Description: Retrieves your snippet from a Square Online site. A site can contain snippets from multiple snippet applications, but you can retrieve only the snippet that was added by your application.

Actions.Name: Upsert snippet
Actions.Description: Adds a snippet to a Square Online site or updates the existing snippet on the site. The snippet code is appended to the end of the head element on every page of the site, except checkout pages. A snippet application can add one snippet to a given site.

Actions.Description: Retrieves details for a specific Card.

Actions.Name: Batch delete catalog objects
Actions.Description: Deletes a set of CatalogItems based on the provided list of target IDs and returns a set of successfully deleted IDs in the response.

Actions.Name: Batch retrieve catalog objects
Actions.Description: Returns a set of objects based on the provided ID. Each CatalogItem returned in the set includes all of its child information including: all of its CatalogItemVariation objects, references to its CatalogModifierList objects, and the ids of any CatalogTax objects that apply to it.

Actions.Name: Batch upsert catalog objects
Actions.Description: Creates or updates up to 10,000 target objects based on the provided list of objects. The target objects are grouped into batches and each batch is inserted/updated in an all-or-nothing manner. If an object within a batch is malformed in some way, or violates a database constraint, the entire batch containing that item will be disregarded. However, other batches in the same request may still succeed. Each batch may contain up to 1,000 objects, and batches will be processed in order as long as the total object count for the request (items, variations, modifier lists, discounts, and taxes) is no more than 10,000.

Actions.Name: Delete catalog object
Actions.Description: Deletes a single CatalogObject based on the provided ID and returns the set of successfully deleted IDs in the response. Deletion is a cascading event such that all children of the targeted object are also deleted. For example, deleting a CatalogItem will also delete all of its CatalogItemVariation children.

Actions.Name: Catalog info
Actions.Description: Retrieves information about the Square Catalog API, such as batch size limits that can be used by the BatchUpsertCatalogObjects endpoint.

Actions.Name: List catalog
Actions.Description: Returns a list of CatalogObjects that includes all objects of a set of desired types (for example, all CatalogItem and CatalogTax objects) in the catalog. ListCatalog does not return deleted catalog items.

Actions.Name: Retrieve catalog object
Actions.Description: Returns a single CatalogItem as a CatalogObject based on the provided ID. The returned object includes all of the relevant CatalogItem information including: CatalogItemVariation children, references to its CatalogModifierList objects, and the ids of any CatalogTax objects that apply to it.

Actions.Name: Search catalog objects
Actions.Description: Searches for CatalogObject of any type by matching supported search attribute values, excluding custom attribute values on items or item variations, against one or more of the specified query filters.

Actions.Name: Update item modifier lists
Actions.Description: Updates the CatalogModifierList objects that apply to the targeted CatalogItem without having to perform an upsert on the entire item.

Actions.Name: Update item taxes
Actions.Description: Updates the CatalogTax objects that apply to the targeted CatalogItem without having to perform an upsert on the entire item.

Actions.Name: Upsert catalog object
Actions.Description: Creates or updates the target CatalogObject.

Actions.Name: Add group to customer
Actions.Description: Adds a group membership to a customer. The customer is identified by the customer_id value and the customer group is identified by the group_id value.

Actions.Name: Create customer
Actions.Description: Creates a new customer for a business.

Actions.Name: Delete customer
Actions.Description: Deletes a customer profile from a business. This operation also unlinks any associated cards on file.

Actions.Name: Delete customer group
Actions.Description: Deletes a customer group as identified by the group_id value.

Actions.Name: List customer groups
Actions.Description: Retrieves the list of customer groups of a business.

Actions.Name: Retrieve customer group
Actions.Description: Retrieves a specific customer group.

Actions.Name: Update customer group
Actions.Description: Updates a customer group.

Actions.Name: List customers
Actions.Description: Lists customer profiles associated with a Square account. Under normal operating conditions, newly created or updated customer profiles become available for the listing operation in well under 30 seconds. Occasionally, propagation of the new or updated profiles can take closer to one minute or longer, especially during network incidents and outages.

Actions.Name: Remove group from customer
Actions.Description: Removes a group membership from a customer. The customer is identified by the customer_id value and the customer group is identified by the group_id value.

Actions.Name: Retrieve customer
Actions.Description: Returns details for a single customer.

Actions.Name: Search customers
Actions.Description: Searches the customer profiles associated with a Square account using a supported query filter.  Calling SearchCustomers without any explicit query filter returns all customer profiles ordered alphabetically based on given_name and family_name.

Actions.Name: List customer segments
Actions.Description: Retrieves the list of customer segments of a business.

Actions.Name: Retrieve customer segment
Actions.Description: Retrieves a specific customer segment.

Actions.Name: Update customer
Actions.Description: Updates a customer profile. To change an attribute, specify the new value. To remove an attribute, specify the value as an empty string or empty object.

Actions.Name: Create customer group
Actions.Description: Creates a new customer group for a business.

Actions.Name: Accept dispute
Actions.Description: Accepts the loss on a dispute. Square returns the disputed amount to the cardholder and updates the dispute state to ACCEPTED. Square debits the disputed amount from the seller’s Square account. If the Square account does not have sufficient funds, Square debits the associated bank account.

Actions.Name: Create dispute evidence text
Actions.Description: Uploads text to use as evidence for a dispute challenge.

Actions.Name: Delete dispute evidence
Actions.Description: Removes specified evidence from a dispute.

Actions.Name: List disputes
Actions.Description: Returns a list of disputes associated with a particular account.

Actions.Name: List dispute evidence
Actions.Description: Returns a list of evidence associated with a dispute.

Actions.Name: Retrieve dispute
Actions.Description: Returns details about a specific dispute.

Actions.Name: Retrieve dispute evidence
Actions.Description: Returns the evidence metadata specified by the evidence ID in the request URL path. You must maintain a copy of the evidence you upload if you want to reference it later.  You cannot download the evidence after you upload it.

Actions.Name: Submit evidence
Actions.Description: Submits evidence to the cardholder's bank. Before submitting evidence, Square compiles all available evidence. This includes evidence uploaded using the CreateDisputeEvidenceFile and CreateDisputeEvidenceText endpoints and evidence automatically provided by Square, when available.

Actions.Name: Batch change inventory
Actions.Description: Applies adjustments and counts to the provided item quantities. On success: returns the current calculated counts for all objects referenced in the request.

Actions.Name: Batch retrieve inventory changes
Actions.Description: Returns historical physical counts and adjustments based on the provided filter criteria.

Actions.Name: Batch retrieve inventory counts
Actions.Description: Returns current counts for the provided CatalogObjects at the requested Locations.

Actions.Name: Retrieve inventory adjustment
Actions.Description: Returns the InventoryAdjustment object with the provided adjustment_id.

Actions.Name: Retrieve inventory count
Actions.Description: Retrieves the current calculated stock count for a given CatalogObject at a given set of Locations.

Actions.Name: Retrieve inventory physical count
Actions.Description: Returns the InventoryPhysicalCount object with the provided physical_count_id.

Actions.Name: Retrieve inventory transfer (Beta)
Actions.Description: Returns the InventoryTransfer object with the provided transfer_id.

Actions.Name: Cancel invoice
Actions.Description: Cancels an invoice. The seller cannot collect payments for the canceled invoice.

Actions.Name: Create invoice
Actions.Description: Creates a draft invoice for an order created using the Orders API. A draft invoice remains in your account and no action is taken. You must publish the invoice before Square can process it (send it to the customer's email address or charge the customer’s card on file).

Actions.Name: Delete invoice
Actions.Description: Deletes the specified invoice. When an invoice is deleted, the associated order status changes to CANCELED. You can only delete a draft invoice (you cannot delete a published invoice, including one that is scheduled for processing).

Actions.Name: Get invoice
Actions.Description: Retrieves an invoice by invoice ID.

Actions.Name: List invoices
Actions.Description: Returns a list of invoices for a given location.

Actions.Name: Publish invoice
Actions.Description: Publishes the specified draft invoice. After an invoice is published, Square follows up based on the invoice configuration. For example, Square sends the invoice to the customer's email address, charges the customer's card on file, or does nothing. Square also makes the invoice available on a Square-hosted invoice page.

Actions.Name: Search invoices
Actions.Description: Searches for invoices from a location specified in the filter.

Actions.Name: Update invoice
Actions.Description: Updates an invoice by modifying fields, clearing fields, or both.

Actions.Name: Batch retrieve orders
Actions.Description: Retrieves a set of orders by their IDs. If a given order ID does not exist, the ID is ignored instead of generating an error.

Actions.Name: Calculate order (Beta)
Actions.Description: Enables applications to preview order pricing without creating an order.

Actions.Name: Clone order (Beta)
Actions.Description: Creates a new order, in the DRAFT state, by duplicating an existing order. The newly created order has only the core fields (such as line items, taxes, and discounts) copied from the original order.

Actions.Name: Create order
Actions.Description: Creates a new order that can include information about products for purchase and settings to apply to the purchase.

Actions.Name: Pay order (Beta)
Actions.Description: Pay for an order using one or more approved payments or settle an order with a total of 0. The total of the payment_ids listed in the request must be equal to the order total. Orders with a total amount of 0 can be marked as paid by specifying an empty array of payment_ids in the request.

Actions.Name: Retrieve order
Actions.Description: Retrieves an Order by ID.

Actions.Name: Search orders
Actions.Description: Search all orders for one or more locations. Orders include all sales, returns, and exchanges regardless of how or when they entered the Square ecosystem (such as Point of Sale, Invoices, and Connect APIs).

Actions.Name: Update order (Beta)
Actions.Description: Updates an open order by adding, replacing, or deleting fields. Orders with a COMPLETED or CANCELED state cannot be updated.

Actions.Name: Cancel payment
Actions.Description: Cancels (voids) a payment. You can use this endpoint to cancel a payment with the APPROVED status.

Actions.Name: Cancel payment by idempotency key
Actions.Description: Cancels (voids) a payment identified by the idempotency key that is specified in the request. Use this method when the status of a CreatePayment request is unknown (for example, after you send a CreatePayment request, a network error occurs and you do not get a response). In this case, you can direct Square to cancel the payment using this endpoint. In the request, you provide the same idempotency key that you provided in your CreatePayment request that you want to cancel. After canceling the payment, you can submit your CreatePayment request again. Note that if no payment with the specified idempotency key is found, no action is taken and the endpoint returns successfully.

Actions.Name: Complete payment
Actions.Description: Completes (captures) a payment. By default, payments are set to complete immediately after they are created.

Actions.Name: Create payment
Actions.Description: Creates a payment using the provided source. You can use this endpoint to charge a card (credit/debit card or Square gift card) or record a payment that the seller received outside of Square (cash payment from a buyer or a payment that an external entity processed on behalf of the seller).

Actions.Name: Get payment
Actions.Description: Retrieves details for a specific payment.

Actions.Name: List payments
Actions.Description: Retrieves a list of payments taken by the account making the request. Results are eventually consistent, and new payments or changes to payments might take several seconds to appear.

Actions.Name: Update payment
Actions.Description: Updates a payment with the APPROVED status. You can update the amount_money and tip_money using this endpoint.

Actions.Name: Get payment refund
Actions.Description: Retrieves a specific refund using the refund_id.

Actions.Name: List payment refunds
Actions.Description: Retrieves a list of refunds for the account making the request. Results are eventually consistent, and new refunds or changes to refunds might take several seconds to appear.

Actions.Name: Refund payment
Actions.Description: Refunds a payment. You can refund the entire payment amount or a portion of it. You can use this endpoint to refund a card payment or record a refund of a cash or external payment.

Actions.Name: Cancel subscription
Actions.Description: Sets the canceled_date field to the end of the active billing period. After this date, the status changes from ACTIVE to CANCELED.

Actions.Name: Create subscription
Actions.Description: Creates a subscription for a customer to a subscription plan. If you provide a card on file in the request, Square charges the card for the subscription. Otherwise, Square bills an invoice to the customer's email address. The subscription starts immediately, unless the request includes the optional start_date. Each individual subscription is associated with a particular location.

Actions.Name: List subscription events
Actions.Description: Lists all events for a specific subscription.

Actions.Name: Resume subscription
Actions.Description: Resumes a deactivated subscription.

Actions.Name: Retrieve subscription
Actions.Description: Retrieves a subscription.

Actions.Name: Search subscriptions
Actions.Description: Searches for subscriptions. Results are ordered chronologically by subscription creation date. If the request specifies more than one location ID, the endpoint orders the result by location ID, and then by creation date within each location. If no locations are given in the query, all locations are searched.

Actions.Name: Update subscription
Actions.Description: Updates a subscription. You can set, modify, and clear the subscription field values.

Actions.Name: Cancel terminal checkout
Actions.Description: Cancels a Terminal checkout request if the status of the request permits it.

Actions.Name: Cancel terminal refund
Actions.Description: Cancels an Interac Terminal refund request by refund request ID if the status of the request permits it.

Actions.Name: Create terminal checkout
Actions.Description: Creates a Terminal checkout request and sends it to the specified device to take a payment for the requested amount.

Actions.Name: Create terminal refund
Actions.Description: Creates a request to refund an Interac payment completed on a Square Terminal.

Actions.Name: Get terminal checkout
Actions.Description: Retrieves a Terminal checkout request by checkout_id.

Actions.Name: Get terminal refund
Actions.Description: Retrieves an Interac Terminal refund object by ID.

Actions.Name: Search terminal checkouts
Actions.Description: Retrieves a filtered list of Terminal checkout requests created by the account making the request.

Actions.Name: Search terminal refunds
Actions.Description: Retrieves a filtered list of Interac Terminal refund requests created by the seller making the request.
